<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><rss xmlns:a10="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" version="2.0"><channel><title>News Highlights</title><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/</link><description /><a10:link rel="self" type="application/rss+xml" href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/feeds/news-highlights" /><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:42292698-f5da-4237-9835-d84a85e976d5</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-and-vaccination-progress-(12-aug-2021)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Update on Local COVID-19 Situation and Vaccination Progress (12 Aug 2021)</title><description>&lt;div dir="ltr" align="left"&gt;&lt;div dir="ltr" align="left"&gt;&lt;table&gt;&lt;colgroup&gt;&lt;col width="600"&gt;&lt;/colgroup&gt;&lt;tbody&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of local situation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;ul&gt;&lt;li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr" role="presentation"&gt;As of 12 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 59 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection and 0 imported cases.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;ul&gt;&lt;li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr" role="presentation"&gt;470 cases are currently warded in hospital. Most are well and under observation. There are currently 36 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 9 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;ul&gt;&lt;li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr" role="presentation"&gt;Over the last 28 days, the percentage of unvaccinated who became severely ill or died is 9.3%, while that for the fully vaccinated is 0.9%.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;ul&gt;&lt;li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr" role="presentation"&gt;As of 11 August 2021, 73% of our population has completed their full regimen/ received two doses of COVID-19 vaccines, and 81% has received at least one dose.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Update on vaccination progress&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 11 August 2021, we have administered a total of 8,241,298 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme (Pfizer-BioNTech Comirnaty and Moderna), covering 4,393,708 individuals, with 3,974,953 individuals having completed the full vaccination regimen.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In addition, 141,405 doses of other vaccines recognised in the World Health Organization’s Emergency Use Listing (WHO EUL) have been administered as of 11 August 2021, covering 82,881 individuals. In total, 73% of our population has completed their full regimen/ received two doses of COVID-19 vaccines, and 81% has received at least one dose.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 1: &lt;/strong&gt;Percentage of Total Population who Received At Least First Dose&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt; and Completed Full Regimen&lt;sup&gt;2&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;of NVP and WHO EUL Vaccines&lt;sup&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure01_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=d7b5a951_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure01_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=d7b5a951_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure01_12Aug2021" title="Figure01_12Aug2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 2: &lt;/strong&gt;Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose of NVP and WHO EUL Vaccines by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure02_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=e48d3e30_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure02_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=e48d3e30_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure02_12Aug2021" title="Figure02_12Aug2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 3: &lt;/strong&gt;Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen of NVP and WHO EUL Vaccines by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure03_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=384e57dc_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure03_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=384e57dc_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure03_12Aug2021" title="Figure03_12Aug2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 4: &lt;/strong&gt;Total number of doses administered&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure04_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=a1f8f89d_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure04_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=a1f8f89d_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure04_12Aug2021" title="Figure04_12Aug2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of hospitalised cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;470 cases are currently warded in hospital. There are currently 36 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 9 in critical condition in the ICU. 5 amongst these 45 cases are fully vaccinated. Of those who have fallen very ill, 37 are seniors above 60 years, of whom 32 are completely unvaccinated or partially vaccinated.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 5:&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen &lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure05_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=9ef97b3e_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure05_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=9ef97b3e_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure05_12Aug2021" title="Figure05_12Aug2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure06_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=1089d84a_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure06_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=1089d84a_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure06_12Aug2021" title="Figure06_12Aug2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There is continuing evidence that almost all fully-vaccinated individuals do not suffer serious disease when infected, unless if they had underlying medical conditions that made them more susceptible. Over the last 28 days, the percentage of unvaccinated who became severely ill or died is 9.3%, while that for the fully vaccinated is 0.9%.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 7: &lt;/strong&gt;Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status &amp;amp; Severity of Condition&lt;sup&gt;4&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure07_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=aa2354f9_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure07_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=aa2354f9_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure07_12Aug2021" title="Figure07_12Aug2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;by Vaccination Status&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure08_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=e7ef2adc_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure08_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=e7ef2adc_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure08_12Aug2021" title="Figure08_12Aug2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Locally transmitted COVID-19 cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are 59 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection today. 33 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 26 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 14 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 19 are currently unlinked.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 9: &lt;/strong&gt;Number of Local Unlinked Cases and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/Detected through Surveillance&lt;sup&gt;5&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure09_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=1a970ffc_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure09_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=1a970ffc_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure09_12Aug2021" title="Figure09_12Aug2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Overall, the number of new cases in the community has decreased from 723 cases in the week before to 412 cases in the past week. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also decreased from 215 cases in the week before to 117 cases in the past week. The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 42.1 and 16.7 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/strong&gt; 7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases&lt;sup&gt;5&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure10_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=2d1c133a_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure10_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=2d1c133a_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure10_12Aug2021" title="Figure10_12Aug2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 14 Days by Age Group and Vaccination Status&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure11_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=570a7bbc_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure11_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=570a7bbc_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure11_12Aug2021" title="Figure11_12Aug2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are no imported cases today.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 12: &lt;/strong&gt;Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/&amp;nbsp;Detected during SHN or Isolation&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure12_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=36a33231_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure12_12aug2021.png?sfvrsn=36a33231_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure12_12Aug2021" title="Figure12_12Aug2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;8.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There are 3 new clusters today. There are currently 119 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 1,151 infections.&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 13: &lt;/strong&gt;Number of Active (Jurong)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;Case 65791&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;Case 65342&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;Case 64850&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;Khoi Grill &amp;amp; Hotpot&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;8&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;* Yuhua Market &amp;amp; Hawker Centre is currently linked to this cluster.&lt;/p&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Please refer to MOH’s daily Situation Report (&lt;a href="https://covidsitrep.moh.gov.sg/"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report)&lt;/a&gt; for details.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;12 AUGUST 2021&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;hr&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt; Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;2 &lt;/sup&gt;Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt; Other vaccines recognised in the WHO EUL account for about 2% of the total population who received at least 1 dose and about 1% of total population who completed the full regimen.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;4&lt;/sup&gt; Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;5&lt;/sup&gt; Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;6&lt;/sup&gt; Includes new cases added today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Thu, 12 Aug 2021 14:33:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:0219eba6-c63e-411a-a3e3-75ddc24673ed</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/59-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>59 New Cases of Locally Transmitted COVID-19 Infection  </title><description>&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 12 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 59 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 26 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 14 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 19 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 5 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There are no imported cases today.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;12 AUGUST 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Thu, 12 Aug 2021 09:40:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:0e0ac734-1091-41f8-a727-eb2b0bf4425b</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-and-vaccination-progress_11_August_2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Update on Local COVID-19 Situation and Vaccination Progress </title><description>&lt;p align="center" style="margin-left: 0in; text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border: none;"&gt; &lt;tbody&gt;&lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="601" valign="top" style="width: 450.8pt; padding: 5.75pt 0.1in; border-style: solid; border-width: 1pt; text-align: left;"&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of local situation &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul style="list-style-type: disc;"&gt;&lt;li&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;As of 11 August&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt; 2021, 12pm, the &lt;/span&gt;Ministry of Health (MOH) &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;has confirmed &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;and verified &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;that &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;there are 61 &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection and 2&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt; imported cases. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;508 cases are currently warded in hospital. Most are well and under observation. There are currently 35 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 8 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU).&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;Over the last 28 days, the percentage of unvaccinated who became severely ill or died is 8.7%, while that for the fully vaccinated is 0.9%.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;As of 10 August 2021, 72% of our population has completed their full regimen/ received two doses of COVID-19 vaccines, and 81% has received at least one dose.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt; &lt;p style="margin-left: 0in; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="margin-left: 0in; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Update on vaccination progress&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="margin-left: 0in; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 10 August 2021, we have administered a total of 8,193,151 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme (Pfizer-BioNTech Comirnaty and Moderna), covering 4,383,631 individuals, with 3,936,162 individuals having completed the full vaccination regimen. In addition, 138,879 doses of other vaccines recognised in the World Health Organization’s Emergency Use Listing (WHO EUL) have been administered as of 10 August 2021, covering &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;82,406 individuals&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;In total, 72% of our population has completed their full regimen/ received two doses of COVID-19 vaccines, and 81% has received at least one dose.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p align="center" style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt; Percentage of Total Population who Received At Least First Dose [1]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&amp;nbsp;and Completed Full Regimen[2]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;of NVP and WHO EUL Vaccines[3]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align="center" style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: none;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/210811-figure-1.png?sfvrsn=31fd092a_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/210811-figure-1.png?sfvrsn=31fd092a_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="210811 Figure 1" title="210811 Figure 1" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="margin-bottom: 8pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: none;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align="center" style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt; &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="margin-bottom: 8pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: none;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/210811-figure-2.png?sfvrsn=cfe83101_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/210811-figure-2.png?sfvrsn=cfe83101_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="210811 Figure 2" title="210811 Figure 2" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align="center" style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 3:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt; Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen of NVP and WHO EUL Vaccines by Age Group&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align="center" style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: none;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/210811-figure-3.png?sfvrsn=f7d90f2f_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/210811-figure-3.png?sfvrsn=f7d90f2f_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="210811 Figure 3" title="210811 Figure 3" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align="center" style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 4:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt; Total number of doses administered&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/210811-figure-4.png?sfvrsn=fc7faa2f_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/210811-figure-4.png?sfvrsn=fc7faa2f_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="210811 Figure 4" title="210811 Figure 4" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="margin-left: 0in; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="margin-left: 0in; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext;"&gt;Condition of hospitalised cases&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;508 cases are currently warded in hospital. There are currently 35 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 8 in critical condition in the ICU. 7 amongst these 43 cases are fully vaccinated. Of those who have fallen very ill, 36 are seniors above 60 years, of whom 29 are completely unvaccinated or partially vaccinated.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;66910&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;, a 69 year-old male Singaporean, has passed away from complications due to COVID&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;-19 infection on 11 August 2021. He had developed symptoms on 28 July, and was admitted to Tan Tock Seng Hospital on 29 July where he tested positive for COVID-19 infection. He had not been vaccinated against COVID-19, and had a history of stroke, &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;diabetes mellitus, hypertension and hyperlipidaemia&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;. In total, 43 have passed away from complications due to COVID-19 infection&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 5:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/210811-figure-5.png?sfvrsn=25fa9da3_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/210811-figure-5.png?sfvrsn=25fa9da3_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="210811 Figure 5" title="210811 Figure 5" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;br&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;by Age Group&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/210811-figure-6.png?sfvrsn=90f25fe5_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/210811-figure-6.png?sfvrsn=90f25fe5_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="210811 Figure 6" title="210811 Figure 6" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There is continuing evidence that almost all fully-vaccinated individuals do not suffer serious disease when infected, unless if they had underlying medical conditions that made them more susceptible. Over the last 28 days, the percentage of unvaccinated who became severely ill or died is 8.7%, while that for the fully vaccinated is 0.9%.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration-line: none;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;There are 61 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection today. 33 are &lt;span class="bumpedfont15"&gt;linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 11 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 17 are currently unlinked&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class="bumpedfont15"&gt;.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;upon arrival in Singapore. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;In total, there are 63 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Overall, &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;the number of new cases in the community has decreased from 758 cases in the week before to 448 cases in the past week. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also decreased from 227 cases in the week before to 129 cases in the past week.&amp;nbsp;The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 45.6 and 18.4 respectively.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Please refer to MOH’s daily Situation Report (&lt;/span&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;) for details.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="margin-left: 0in; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong style="text-align: left;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div style="padding: 0in 0in 1pt; border-top: none; border-right: none; border-bottom-width: 1pt; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left: none;"&gt; &lt;p style="padding: 0in; border: none;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;11 AUGUST 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br clear="all"&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt; &lt;div id="ftn1"&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 13px;"&gt;[1] Based on National Immunisation Registry data. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn2"&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 13px;"&gt;[2]&amp;nbsp;Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn3"&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 13px;"&gt;[3]&amp;nbsp;Other vaccines recognised in the WHO EUL account for about 2% of the total population who received at least 1 dose and about 1% of total population who completed the full regimen.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn4"&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 13px;"&gt;[4]&amp;nbsp;Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn5"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 13px;"&gt;[5]&amp;nbsp;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn6"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 13px;"&gt;[6]&amp;nbsp;Includes new cases added today.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Wed, 11 Aug 2021 14:08:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:5a8665c4-71d7-4edc-a950-abe797540524</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/61-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection_11_August_2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>61 New Cases of Locally Transmitted COVID-19 Infection</title><description>&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;1.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 11 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 61 new &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 33 are &lt;span class="bumpedfont15"&gt;linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 11 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 17 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 3 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;In addition, there are 2 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;upon arrival in Singapore&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;. Both were detected upon arrival in Singapore.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;In total, there are 63 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;div style="padding: 0in 0in 1pt; border-top: none; border-right: none; border-bottom-width: 1pt; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left: none;"&gt; &lt;p style="padding: 0in; border: none;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="padding: 0in; border: none;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;11 AUGUST 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Wed, 11 Aug 2021 09:23:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:976a0968-38ae-47b0-8ffd-05bc0616400f</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-government's-stock-of-sinovac-vaccine/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Update on Government's Stock of Sinovac Vaccine</title><description>&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Under the Special Access Route (SAR) framework, the Government has allocated 170,000 doses of the Government's stock of Sinovac-CoronaVac (Sinovac) COVID-19 vaccine to 31 approved private healthcare institutions for a total of 85,000 individuals to receive the vaccine free of charge, based on a two-dose regime per individual for full vaccination.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;The remaining 30,000 doses of the Government's stock of the Sinovac vaccine have been reserved for Singapore Citizens, Permanent Residents and Long-Term Pass Holders who had allergic reactions to the mRNA vaccines, and for other purposes. Individuals who are allergic to mRNA vaccines will continue to be able to receive Sinovac vaccination and the Ministry of Health (MOH) will separately contact these individuals to arrange for their vaccination appointments.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Based on our estimates, the approved private healthcare institutions would have already administered the first dose of vaccines to the 85,000 individuals by 12 August 2021. After ringfencing sufficient doses for individuals coming for second doses of the Sinovac vaccine, the stock for the 31 approved private healthcare institutions will be depleted.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH has been facilitating private healthcare institutions to order further Sinovac supplies, and we expect the stocks to arrive in the next four to six weeks.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Applications received from private providers to import WHO EUL COVID-19 vaccines under SAR&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;The Health Sciences Authority (HSA) has received further applications from private healthcare institutions to import the Sinovac vaccines via the SAR. HSA will continue to evaluate applications to import non-mRNA vaccines under SAR. Under SAR, these vaccines will not be subsidised or covered under the Vaccine Injury Financial Assistance Programme (VIFAP).&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Individuals who are not contraindicated to mRNA vaccines are strongly encouraged to take mRNA vaccines where possible, given the higher efficacy rates of the mRNA vaccines under our National Vaccination Programme. Eligible individuals aged 12 years and above can now walk in to any of the vaccination centres administering the Pfizer-BioNTech/Comirnaty and Moderna COVID-19 vaccines for vaccination, without a prior appointment.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;10 AUGUST 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;</description><pubDate>Tue, 10 Aug 2021 15:40:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:78fec25d-a333-4091-bf6a-4bddea3869e6</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-and-vaccination-progress-(10-aug-2021)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>UPDATE ON LOCAL COVID-19 SITUATION AND VACCINATION PROGRESS (10 AUG 2021)</title><description>&lt;table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"&gt;&lt;tbody&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="601" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of local situation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;· As of 10 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 53 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection and 1 imported case.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;· 508 cases are currently warded in hospital. Most are well and under observation. There are currently 32 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 11 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;· Over the last 28 days, the percentage of unvaccinated who became severely ill or died is 8.4%, while that for the fully vaccinated is 0.8%.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;· As of 9 August 2021, 72% of our population has completed their full regimen/ received two doses of COVID-19 vaccines, and 81% has received at least one dose.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Update on vaccination progress&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 9 August 2021, we have administered a total of 8,145,237 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme (Pfizer-BioNTech/ Comirnaty and Moderna), covering 4,373,550 individuals, with 3,897,650 individuals having completed the full vaccination regimen. In addition, 131,186 doses of other vaccines recognised in the World Health Organization’s Emergency Use Listing (WHO EUL) have been administered as of 9 August 2021, covering 80,459 individuals. In total, 72% of our population has completed their full regimen/ received two doses of COVID-19 vaccines, and 81% has received at least one dose.&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Total Population who Received At Least First Dose&lt;sup&gt;[1] &lt;/sup&gt;and Completed Full Regimen of NVP and WHO EUL Vaccines&lt;sup&gt;[2]&lt;br&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig1(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=8a0d4ef_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig1(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=8a0d4ef_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig1(10Aug21)" title="Fig1(10Aug21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 2: &lt;/strong&gt;Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose of NVP and WHO EUL Vaccines by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig2(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=b2bf0956_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig2(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=b2bf0956_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig2(10Aug21)" title="Fig2(10Aug21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 3:&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen of NVP and WHO EUL Vaccines by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig3(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=4e92afde_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig3(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=4e92afde_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig3(10Aug21)" title="Fig3(10Aug21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 4: &lt;/strong&gt;Total number of doses administered&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig4(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=e69ac7a2_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig4(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=e69ac7a2_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig4(10Aug21)" title="Fig4(10Aug21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of hospitalised cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;508 cases are currently warded in hospital. There are currently 32 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 11 in critical condition in the ICU. 6 amongst these 43 cases are fully vaccinated. Of those who have fallen very ill, 35 are seniors above 60 years, of whom 29 are completely unvaccinated or partially vaccinated.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 5:&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig5(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=ebbfc0c_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig5(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=ebbfc0c_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig5(10Aug21)" title="Fig5(10Aug21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig6(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=5c3d2f74_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig6(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=5c3d2f74_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig6(10Aug21)" title="Fig6(10Aug21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There is continuing evidence that almost all fully-vaccinated individuals do not suffer serious disease when infected, unless if they had underlying medical conditions that made them more susceptible. Over the last 28 days, the percentage of unvaccinated who became severely ill or died is 8.4%, while that for the fully vaccinated is 0.8%.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status &amp;amp; Severity of Condition&lt;sup&gt;[3]&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig7(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=fcce9ee9_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig7(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=fcce9ee9_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig7(10Aug21)" title="Fig7(10Aug21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;by Vaccination Status&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig8(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=eafef6e9_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig8(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=eafef6e9_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig8(10Aug21)" title="Fig8(10Aug21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;Locally transmitted COVID-19 cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are 53 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection today. 31 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 7 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 15 are currently unlinked.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There is 1 imported case, who was detected and isolated upon arrival in Singapore. In total, there are 54 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 9: &lt;/strong&gt;Number of Local Unlinked Cases and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance&lt;sup&gt;[4]&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig9(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=371935ee_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig9(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=371935ee_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig9(10Aug21)" title="Fig9(10Aug21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Overall, the number of new cases in the community has decreased from 799 cases in the week before to 481 cases in the past week. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also decreased from 238 cases in the week before to 138 cases in the past week. The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 49.0 and 19.7 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 10: &lt;/strong&gt;7 Day Moving Status&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig11(10aug21).png?sfvrsn=243a20f1_0"&gt;&lt;img &amp;nbsp;There are currently 118 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 1,149 infections.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 13:&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Hawker Centre and Taman Jurong Market are currently linked to this cluster.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Please refer to MOH’s daily Situation Report (&lt;a href="http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;10 AUGUST 2021&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br clear="all"&gt;&lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt;&lt;div id="ftn1"&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;sup&gt;[1] &lt;/sup&gt;Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;[2] &lt;/sup&gt;Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;[3]&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;nbsp;Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;[4]&lt;/sup&gt; Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;[5] &lt;/sup&gt;Includes new cases added today.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Tue, 10 Aug 2021 14:45:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:a63e2cdf-a0fc-4033-a627-1518ee6b217d</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/53-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection(10Aug2021)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>53 NEW CASES OF LOCALLY TRANSMITTED COVID-19 INFECTION</title><description>&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 10 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 53 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 31 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 7 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 15 are currently unlinked.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In addition, there is 1 imported case, who was detected and isolated upon arrival in Singapore.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In total, there are 54 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;10 AUGUST 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Tue, 10 Aug 2021 09:30:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:22f68700-4206-4c80-8271-82b154780450</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/clarifications-in-response-to-queries-on-(1)-eligibility-for-dining-in-f-b-outlets-and-(2)-recognition-of-the-world-health-organization-s-emergency-use-listing-(who-eul)-vaccines/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>CLARIFICATIONS IN RESPONSE TO QUERIES ON (1) ELIGIBILITY FOR DINING IN F&amp;B OUTLETS; AND (2) RECOGNITION OF THE WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION’S  EMERGENCY USE LISTING (WHO EUL) VACCINES</title><description>&lt;strong&gt;(1) Eligible diners for dining-in in F&amp;amp;B outlets&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;1.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;At the Multi-Ministry Task Force (MTF) press conference on 6 August 2021, the Multi-Ministry Taskforce announced that F&amp;amp;B establishments are permitted to seat&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;fully vaccinated diners in groups of up to 5 persons. “Fully vaccinated” means two weeks after receiving a full regimen of the Pfizer-BioNTech/Comirnaty or Moderna vaccines, or any of the vaccines on the WHO EUL listing, with the vaccination status updated in MOH’s national IT system as indicated in Section (2) below.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In addition, the following individuals are eligible to dine-in at F&amp;amp;B establishments if they:&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;a.&amp;nbsp; Have recovered from COVID-19 and have a valid Pre-Event Test (PET) exemption notice&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;; or&lt;br&gt;b. Have a negative PET result for the duration of his/her dine-in&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt; from an MOH-approved COVID-19 test provider within the last 24 hours; or&lt;br&gt;c.&amp;nbsp; Are children aged 12 years and below, so long as all children at a given table are from the same household.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH and ESG would like to clarify that &lt;strong&gt;F&amp;amp;B establishments are not allowed to accept any dine-in customers who do not meet the criteria in (a)-(c) above.&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp; Enforcement officers will be doing their checks, and will take strict enforcement actions against any F&amp;amp;B establishments and individuals who do not comply with these rules.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;U&lt;strong&gt;nvaccinated individuals who do not meet any of criteria (a)-(c) can dine in groups of up to 2 persons only at coffeeshops and hawker centres. &lt;/strong&gt;For now, the concession for unvaccinated persons to dine applies &lt;strong&gt;specifically to hawker centres and coffeeshops&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;sup&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt;. We encourage unvaccinated individuals who dine at such locations to vigilantly maintain hand hygiene, and not to linger after their meals, in order to reduce their risk of contracting COVID-19.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;(2) Updating and Verification of Vaccine Status&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;All Singapore residents who obtained their Pfizer-BioNTech/Comirnaty or&amp;nbsp; Moderna locally would automatically have their vaccination records updated in the National Immunisation Registry (NIR), and reflected on the TraceTogether and HealthHub Apps from 10 Aug 2021. This will also enable businesses using the SafeEntry (Business) App to easily verify the vaccination status of their customers.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Residents who received Sinovac locally will also be able to access their vaccination record on the HealthHub App from 10 Aug 2021, pending further updates to TraceTogether and the SafeEntry (Business) App.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Singaporeans, Permanent Residents and Long-Term Pass Holders (LTPHs) who have been fully vaccinated overseas (be it Pfizer-BioNTech/Comirnaty, Moderna, or any of the other vaccines under the WHO Emergency Use Listing) will have to provide documents showing proof of vaccination and take a serology test at an approved provider to confirm that the vaccination has been effective.&amp;nbsp; Upon a positive serology result, their vaccination record will be updated in the National Immunisation Registry (NIR), and reflected on their TraceTogether and HealthHub Apps.&amp;nbsp; More details on the process, including the list of the approved providers, can be found on MOH’s Post Vaccination Matters &lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/vaccination/faqs---post-vaccination-matters"&gt;website&lt;/a&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We will have a separate process for Short-Term Visitor Pass holders who were vaccinated overseas to update their vaccination status on the NIR. This is still being worked out, and details will be released soon.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;8.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Hard copies of overseas vaccination certificates will not be accepted for the vaccination-differentiated safe management measures. This is because it will be difficult for individual establishments to verify the authenticity of these certificates which are issued in different formats and languages.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We look forward to the cooperation of all Singaporeans as we strive towards a COVID-resilient Singapore.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;hr&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;Recovered individuals (within last 270 days) can obtain a PET Exemption Notice from any clinic offering ART or PCR testing services.&amp;nbsp; Refer to go.gov.sg/swabproviders for the list of MOH-approved COVID-19 test providers.&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;Unvaccinated individuals aged 13 or above must have a valid negative ART or PCR result from an MOH-approved COVID-19 test provider within the last 24 hours. Refer to go.gov.sg/swabproviders for the list of MOH-approved COVID-19 test providers. Self-administered ART (including those supervised by employers) are not recognised for vaccination-differentiated SMMs.&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;sup&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt;Coffee shops refer generally to F&amp;amp;B establishments with SFA coffee shop/ eating house/ canteen license.&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Mon, 09 Aug 2021 15:59:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:45e733c3-4aca-4fc6-853a-fae9b1bec44f</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/no-appointment-needed-at-pfizer-biontech-comirnaty-vaccination-centres/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>No Appointment Needed at Pfizer-BioNTech/Comirnaty Vaccination Centres</title><description>&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We have made good progress in our national COVID-19 vaccination programme thus far. As of 8 August 2021, 70% of the population have completed their full vaccination regimen under the national vaccination programme and 79% of the population have received at least one dose.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Since mid-July, seniors aged 60 and above have been allowed to walk into any vaccination centre, polyclinic or participating Public Health Preparedness Clinic to receive their vaccination without an appointment. From 2 August, all Singaporeans, Permanent Residents, and Long-Term Pass holders aged 18 years old and above have also been allowed to walk in to any of our 11 community vaccination centres offering the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine without a prior appointment.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; From 10 August 2021, to make it more convenient to get vaccinated, all Singaporeans, Permanent Residents, and Long-Term Pass holders aged 12 years old and above who have yet to come forward for their first dose will be able to walk in to any of the 26 vaccination centres offering the Pfizer-BioNTech/Comirnaty COVID-19 vaccine without a prior appointment.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Vaccination remains a key enabler in our fight against COVID-19. We urge all who are eligible to be vaccinated. Individuals can also continue to book appointments at&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.vaccine.gov.sg/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.vaccine.gov.sg&amp;amp;source=gmail&amp;amp;ust=1628609225229000&amp;amp;usg=AFQjCNGRZ-6cq1LZbOqtTIWGkwKhoKChrQ" style="color: rgb(17, 85, 204); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;http://www.vaccine.gov.sg&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;to get vaccinated.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;9 AUGUST 2021&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;</description><pubDate>Mon, 09 Aug 2021 15:30:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:d021e953-d664-46ca-b4e8-c27e91b8fcf8</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(9-aug)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Update on Local COVID-19 Situation (9 Aug)</title><description>&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 9 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 69 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 39 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 10 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 20 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 2 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are 3 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In total, there are 72 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Local Unlinked Cases and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-1-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=40813af9_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-1-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=40813af9_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 1 (9 Aug)" title="Fig. 1 (9 Aug)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 8 August 2021, 70% of our population has completed their full regimen/ received two doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme, and 79% has received at least one dose. In total, we have administered a total of 8,103,735 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme, covering 4,367,061 individuals, with 3,862,510 individuals having completed the full vaccination regimen. In addition, 131,497 doses of Sinovac vaccines have been administered as of 8 August 2021, covering 81,709 individuals.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration-line: underline;"&gt;Figure 2: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Percentage of Total Population who Received At Least First Dose&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt; and Completed Full Regimen&lt;sup&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-2-(9-aug).png?sfvrsn=1eddb31c_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-2-(9-aug).png?sfvrsn=1eddb31c_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 2 (9 Aug)" title="Fig. 2 (9 Aug)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration-line: underline;"&gt;Figure 3:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-3-(9-aug).png?sfvrsn=7e37a44c_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-3-(9-aug).png?sfvrsn=7e37a44c_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 3 (9 Aug)" title="Fig. 3 (9 Aug)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration-line: underline;"&gt;Figure 4: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-4-(9-aug).png?sfvrsn=de8cb3f2_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-4-(9-aug).png?sfvrsn=de8cb3f2_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 4 (9 Aug)" title="Fig. 4 (9 Aug)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 5:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Total number of doses administered&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-5-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=e93b966b_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-5-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=e93b966b_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 5 (9 Aug)" title="Fig. 5 (9 Aug)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;527 cases are currently warded in hospital.&amp;nbsp; Most are well and under observation. There are currently 35 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 10 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). 7 amongst these 45 cases are fully vaccinated. Of these, 5 require oxygen supplementation while 2 require ICU care as they have underlying medical conditions. 34 seniors above 60 years, of whom 28 are completely unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, have fallen very ill. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration-line: underline;"&gt;Figure 6: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-6-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=32a325c5_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-6-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=32a325c5_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 6 (9 Aug)" title="Fig. 6 (9 Aug)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration-line: underline;"&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-7-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=1af83262_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-7-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=1af83262_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 7 (9 Aug)" title="Fig. 7 (9 Aug)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 99 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 60 are unvaccinated, 28 are partially vaccinated and 11 are fully vaccinated.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 8: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status &amp;amp; Severity of Condition&lt;sup&gt;4&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-8-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=1417630d_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-8-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=1417630d_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 8 (9 Aug)" title="Fig. 8 (9 Aug)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration-line: underline;"&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Vaccination Status&lt;sup&gt;4&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-9-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=cc0f6f84_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-9-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=cc0f6f84_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 9 (9 Aug)" title="Fig. 9 (9 Aug)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Overall, the number of new cases in the community has decreased from 835 cases in the week before to 526 cases in the past week. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also decreased from 261 cases in the week before to 149 cases in the past week. The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 53.9 and 21.3 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; 7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases&lt;sup&gt;5&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-10-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=6898e8b9_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-10-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=6898e8b9_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 10 (9 Aug)" title="Fig. 10 (9 Aug)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration-line: underline;"&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 14 Days by Age Group and Vaccination Status&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-11-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=6433d073_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-11-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=6433d073_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 11 (9 Aug)" title="Fig. 11 (9 Aug)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;8.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are a total of 3 imported cases today. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 12:&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/strong&gt;Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/ Detected during SHN or Isolation&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-12-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=e9edc89_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-12-(9-aug).jpg?sfvrsn=e9edc89_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 12 (9 Aug)" title="Fig. 12 (9 Aug)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There is 1 new cluster today. In total, there are currently 131 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 1,148 infections.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration-line: underline;"&gt;Figure 13: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Number of Active Clusters&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span
