for details.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;9 AUGUST 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;hr&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;[1] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;[2] Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;[3]Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;[4] Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;[5] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;[6]&amp;nbsp;Includes new cases added today.&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Mon, 09 Aug 2021 14:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:dfbb2128-7d12-4234-a261-25d65bbcc857</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/69-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection-9-Aug-2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>69 New Cases of Locally Transmitted COVID-19 Infection</title><description>&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 9 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 69 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 39 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 10 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 20 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 2 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In addition, there are 3 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In total, there are 72 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif;"&gt;9 AUGUST 2021&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;</description><pubDate>Mon, 09 Aug 2021 09:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:6e6b8c62-a887-4c95-bec3-a211a5aa9900</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(8-aug)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Update On Local COVID-19 Situation (8 Aug)</title><description>&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 8 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 73 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 43 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 9 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 21 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 5 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; There are 5 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. All were detected upon arrival in Singapore.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; In total, there are 78 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Local Unlinked Cases and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance [1]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-17e61cca066484b048952dd0c3b2fb025.png?sfvrsn=c5298781_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 1" title="fig 1"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 7 August 2021, 69% of our population has completed their full regimen/ received two doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme, and 79% has received at least one dose. In total, we have administered a total of 8,042,596 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme, covering 4,359,495 individuals, with 3,807,652 individuals having completed the full vaccination regimen. In addition, 130,952 doses of Sinovac vaccines have been administered as of 7 August 2021, covering 81,612 individuals.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Total Population who Received At Least First Dose[2]&amp;nbsp;and Completed Full Regimen[3]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-278e25130d04f47099863db6db23f5385.png?sfvrsn=73ad16bc_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 2" title="fig 2"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 3:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose by Age Group&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-332de2d57779342578513e534e1e29d5a.png?sfvrsn=a04d6f5a_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 3" title="fig 3"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 4:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-48f00b99f49cf4626a0bb5c6cc0940983.png?sfvrsn=9acfff3a_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 4" title="fig 4"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 5:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Total number of doses administered&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-5373c2f4711804b7da0b5b090f8620708.png?sfvrsn=96bc6432_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 5" title="fig 5"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; 542 cases are currently warded in hospital.Most are well and under observation. There are currently 37 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 8 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). 6 amongst these 45 cases are fully vaccinated. Of these, 4 require oxygen supplementation while 2 require ICU care as they have underlying medical conditions. 34 seniors above 60 years, of whom 29 are completely unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, have fallen very ill.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-6ac8a7df1d6eb484d924f8e159de44058.png?sfvrsn=f46135e4_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 6" title="fig 6"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Age Group&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-7a9b4d40ff80a48ec969c09db81fb3289.png?sfvrsn=58be9c6a_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 7" title="fig 7"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 95 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 59 are unvaccinated, 27 are partially vaccinated and 9 are fully vaccinated.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status &amp;amp; Severity of Condition[4]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-80d0605526dbc4ef298072d98a93c22f9.png?sfvrsn=4dba4b59_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 8" title="fig 8"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Vaccination Status&lt;sup&gt;4&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-906d6c0f3bc6a47dc8bdf2736eff38fe9.png?sfvrsn=9dbc87c6_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 9" title="fig 9"&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Overall, the number of new cases in the community has decreased from 861 cases in the week before to 571 cases in the past week. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also decreased from 260 cases in the week before to 160 cases in the past week.&amp;nbsp;The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 58.7 and 22.9 respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; 7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases[5]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-10468c4f3198ae4765a8d09da84c369c7a.png?sfvrsn=4322082e_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 10" title="fig 10"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 14 Days by Age Group and Vaccination Status&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-11f9a6936640984e2099ac08a19266e1fe.png?sfvrsn=b13eddb8_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 11" title="fig 11"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;There are a total of 5 imported cases today. All were detected upon arrival in Singapore.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 12:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/ Detected during SHN or Isolation&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-1295a7ea709a024fd0bd3fb4cabca3cf88.png?sfvrsn=bba5a528_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 12" title="fig 12"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are 2 new clusters today. In total, there are currently 130 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 1,147 infections.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 13:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Clusters&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-131f439d6081564302979cf30a9b7fd0b8.png?sfvrsn=6d15deda_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 13" title="fig 13"&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 14:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; List of Active Clusters&lt;/p&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"&gt; &lt;thead&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Khoi Grill &amp;amp; Hotpot&lt;em&gt; &lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt; &lt;p&gt;* Yuhua Market &amp;amp; Hawker Centre and Taman Jurong Market are currently linked to this cluster.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div&gt; &lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt; &lt;div id="ftn1"&gt; &lt;p _rdeditor_exists="1"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn1"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[1] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn2"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[2] Based on National Immunisation Registry data. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn3"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[3] Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn4"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[4] Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[5] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[6] Includes new cases added today.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Sun, 08 Aug 2021 14:30:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:ff5118ee-51b8-4a75-970e-a11d30abd0a5</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/73-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection8AUG/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>73 New Cases of Locally Transmitted  COVID-19 Infection</title><description>&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 8 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 73 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 43 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 9 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 21 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 5 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In addition, there are 5 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. All were detected upon arrival in Singapore. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In total, there are 78 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;div&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;8 AUGUST 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Sun, 08 Aug 2021 10:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:c4c4a64d-1fba-4711-8518-76078dfb72f9</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(7-aug-2021)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Update On Local COVID-19 Situation (7 Aug) </title><description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 7 August&amp;nbsp;2021, 12pm, the&amp;nbsp;Ministry of Health (MOH)&amp;nbsp;has confirmed&amp;nbsp;and verified&amp;nbsp;that&amp;nbsp;there are 75&amp;nbsp;cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 50 are&amp;nbsp;linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 9 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 16 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 3 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&lt;br&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;2. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are 6 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore.&amp;nbsp;2 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 4 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;3. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In total, there are 81 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 1:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Number of Local Unlinked Cases and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig1_7augcdaa3d0bb6fb4f26ba8f5f70856766b4.png?sfvrsn=24517299_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig1_7augcdaa3d0bb6fb4f26ba8f5f70856766b4.png?sfvrsn=24517299_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig1_7Aug" title="Fig1_7Aug" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;4. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 6 August 2021, 68% of our population has completed their full regimen/ received two doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme, and 79% has received at least one dose. In total, we have administered a total of 7,971,889 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme, covering 4,351,541 individuals, with 3,744,802 individuals having completed the full vaccination regimen. In addition, 129,787 doses of Sinovac vaccines have been administered as of 6 August 2021, covering 81,555 individuals.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;nbsp;Percentage of Total Population who Received At Least First Dose&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt; and Completed Full Regimen&lt;sup&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig2_7aug.png?sfvrsn=49a46d0a_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig2_7aug.png?sfvrsn=49a46d0a_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig2_7Aug" title="Fig2_7Aug" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p align="center" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 3:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose by Age Group&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig3_7aug.png?sfvrsn=481a5ad_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig3_7aug.png?sfvrsn=481a5ad_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig3_7Aug" title="Fig3_7Aug" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;Figure 4:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p align="center" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig4_7aug.png?sfvrsn=689b6f10_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig4_7aug.png?sfvrsn=689b6f10_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig4_7Aug" title="Fig4_7Aug" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p align="center" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 5:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Total number of doses administered&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig5_7aug068c03a14f224f678619efaa0bce8433.png?sfvrsn=a6ae4cf5_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig5_7aug068c03a14f224f678619efaa0bce8433.png?sfvrsn=a6ae4cf5_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig5_7Aug" title="Fig5_7Aug" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;5. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; 529 cases are currently warded in hospital.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Most are well and under observation. There are currently 38 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 4 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). 5 amongst these 42 cases are fully vaccinated. Of these, 4 require oxygen supplementation while 1 requires ICU care as they have underlying medical conditions. 33 seniors above 60 years, of whom 29 are completely unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, have fallen very ill.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;6. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Case&amp;nbsp;65943, an 80 year-old female Singaporean, has passed away from complications due to COVID-19 infection on 7 August 2021. She had developed symptoms on 21 July, and was admitted to Tan Tock Seng Hospital on 23 July after testing positive for COVID-19 infection. She had not been vaccinated against COVID-19, and had a history of diabetes,&amp;nbsp;hypertension and atrial fibrillation. In total, 42 have passed away from complications due to COVID-19 infection.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig6_7aug.png?sfvrsn=ac3a2c2a_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig6_7aug.png?sfvrsn=ac3a2c2a_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig6_7Aug" title="Fig6_7Aug" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p align="center" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p align="center" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;figure 7:&lt;="" u=""&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Age Group&lt;u&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig7_7aug.png?sfvrsn=8fc45380_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig7_7aug.png?sfvrsn=8fc45380_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig7_7Aug" title="Fig7_7Aug" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;8. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Overall,&amp;nbsp;the number of new cases in the community has decreased from 868 cases in the week before to 611 cases in the past week. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also decreased from 256 cases in the week before to 170 cases in the past week.&amp;nbsp;The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 63.0 and 24.3 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases&lt;sup&gt;5&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig10_7aug.png?sfvrsn=9296d9bf_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig10_7aug.png?sfvrsn=9296d9bf_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig10_7Aug" title="Fig10_7Aug" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p align="center" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;Local Cases in the Last 14 Days by Age Group and Vaccination Status&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig11_7aug.png?sfvrsn=7a863573_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig11_7aug.png?sfvrsn=7a863573_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig11_7Aug" title="Fig11_7Aug" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;9. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are a total of 6 imported cases today.&amp;nbsp;2 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 4 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 12:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/&amp;nbsp;Detected during SHN or Isolation&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig12_7aug.png?sfvrsn=a3e636da_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig12_7aug.png?sfvrsn=a3e636da_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig12_7Aug" title="Fig12_7Aug" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;10. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There are 2 new clusters today. In total, there are currently 128 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 1,143 infections.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span HEALTH&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;7 AUGUST 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;sup&gt;1&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;2 &lt;/sup&gt;Based on National Immunisation Registry data&lt;sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;3&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;4&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;sup&gt;5&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/figure&gt;</description><pubDate>Sat, 07 Aug 2021 15:57:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:06fd7010-2979-43ef-a006-00d3825ba5fb</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/75-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection_7Aug2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>75 NEW CASES OF LOCALLY TRANSMITTED  COVID-19 INFECTION </title><description>&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 7 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 75 new&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 50 are&amp;nbsp;&lt;span class="bumpedfont15"&gt;linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 9 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 16 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 3 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;In addition, there are 6 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;upon arrival in Singapore&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;. 2 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 4 developed the illness during SHN or isolation&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; text-align: left; font-size: 16px;"&gt;In total, there are 81 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; text-align: left; font-size: 16px;"&gt;We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;7 AUGUST 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin-left: 0cm; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Sat, 07 Aug 2021 09:40:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:cfb155d8-0358-428e-b352-d33b276c2a74</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/community-surveillance-testing-at-556-ang-mo-kio-avenue-10_7August2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>COMMUNITY SURVEILLANCE TESTING AT  556 ANG MO KIO AVENUE 10</title><description>&lt;p class="Default" style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; The Ministry of Health (MOH)&amp;nbsp;monitors the local situation closely and ringfences infected cases in the community through contact tracing, testing and quarantine. Since the last community surveillance testing conducted at 556 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10 on 1 August 2021, there have been new cases of COVID-19 infection in the block.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;2. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In&amp;nbsp;order to detect cases who were still incubating the virus in the first round of testing and to prevent spread in the community, MOH will conduct&amp;nbsp;mandatory&amp;nbsp;COVID-19&amp;nbsp;testing for all residents of 556 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10.&amp;nbsp;Testing is optional for those who have tested negative for COVID-19 infection from 5 August onwards. Mandatory testing will be conducted on 8 August 2021 between 9am and 12pm, and 1pm and 4pm, at the Regional Screening Centre at 8 Ang Mo Kio Street 54 (former Da Qiao Primary School).&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;3. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; All residents are to bring along their NRIC for identification purposes.&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(0, 112, 192);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Leaflets have been distributed and SMS notifications have been sent to the residents to provide them with more information. Residents are reminded to keep to their appointment time.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Residents are also advised to monitor their health closely and consult a doctor immediately if they feel unwell. Those who are still awaiting their test results are advised to minimise social interactions as much as possible. They should continue to monitor their health and seek immediate medical attention if they feel unwell.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;7 AUGUST 2021&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Sat, 07 Aug 2021 09:15:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:111fec30-bcb0-49f1-b03b-aa476c3846bc</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(6-aug2021)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Update On Local COVID-19 Situation (6 Aug)</title><description>&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 6 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 93 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 56 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 8 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 29 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases is 1 senior above 70 years who is partially vaccinated, and is at risk of serious illness. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are 4 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. All were detected upon arrival in Singapore.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In total, there are 97 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Local Unlinked Cases and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance [1]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-181a4600a394b4e0daf9fb93b72370c1f.png?sfvrsn=1ef2e18_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="figure 1" title="figure 1"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 5 August 2021, 67% of our population has completed their full regimen/ received two doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme, and 78% has received at least one dose. In total, we have administered a total of 7,897,570 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme, covering 4,344,183 individuals, with 3,677,788 individuals having completed the full vaccination regimen. In addition, 120,665 doses of Sinovac vaccines have been administered as of 5 August 2021, covering 79,297 individuals.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Total Population who Received At Least First Dose[2]&amp;nbsp;and Completed Full Regimen [3]&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-2fbb29c8584a14e03b2ac85a73e9502fd.png?sfvrsn=fa13d27b_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="figure 2" title="figure 2"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 3:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose by Age Group&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-3f10c66e1d8ce4f8ba643d32bab48b548.png?sfvrsn=fac22922_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="figure 3" title="figure 3"&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 4:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-4de499092da84473a9b89a5be96489cd3.png?sfvrsn=a1cdd77b_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="figure 4" title="figure 4"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 5:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Total number of doses administered&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-5.png?sfvrsn=11a5aebc_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="figure 5" title="figure 5"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;546 cases are currently warded in hospital. Most are well and under observation. There are currently 38 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 7 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). 6 amongst these 45 cases are fully vaccinated. Of these, 5 require oxygen supplementation while 1 requires ICU care as they have underlying medical conditions. 35 seniors above 60 years, of whom 30 are completely unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, have fallen very ill.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Case 67716, a 63 year-old male Singaporean, has passed away from complications due to COVID-19 infection on 5 August 2021. He had developed a fever and cough on 3 August and was conveyed to Khoo Teck Puat Hospital on 5 August after collapsing at home. He was confirmed to have COVID-19 infection after his demise. He had not been vaccinated against COVID-19, and had a history of heart disease, stroke, diabetes mellitus, hypertension and hyperlipidaemia. In total, 41 have passed away from complications due to COVID-19 infection.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-695c66b20529a456ba798517b5ab6e964.png?sfvrsn=965c2e2f_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="figure 6" title="figure 6"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Age Group&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-76f0ff2d66e6645658f82f0fc37cf0f8d.png?sfvrsn=f169b73e_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="figure 7" title="figure 7"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 85 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 53 are unvaccinated, 24 are partially vaccinated and 8 are fully vaccinated. &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status &amp;amp; Severity of Condition [4]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-8dfdf50314c2c4214a6363650c6dfdfe5.png?sfvrsn=a5f312c0_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="figure 8" title="figure 8"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Vaccination Status&lt;sup&gt;4&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-92f743ee6f5d54f5cbd64d0dae98cc00b.png?sfvrsn=aa171b1_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="figure 9" title="figure 9"&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;8.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Overall, the number of new cases in the community has decreased from 878 cases in the week before to 671 cases in the past week. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also decreased from 244 cases in the week before to 203 cases in the past week.&amp;nbsp;The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 66.9 and 29.0 respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; 7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases [5]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-10c074fe81b1d04e599c698b97900ccc08.png?sfvrsn=faa4b0d0_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="figure 10" title="figure 10"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 14 Days by Age Group and Vaccination Status&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-11cd788e3cd06c4dcfa96918ee25ca43e5.png?sfvrsn=514c316_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="figure 11" title="figure 11"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;There are a total of 4 imported cases today. All were detected upon arrival in Singapore.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 12:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/ Detected during SHN or Isolation&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-127f394153dca34a53a561fa3b262dfee1.png?sfvrsn=599a0be1_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="figure 12" title="figure 12"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;10&lt;b&gt;.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;There are 5 new clusters today. In total, there are currently 127 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 1,134 infections. As there have been no more cases linked to Case 64599 cluster for the past two incubation periods (i.e. 28 days), the cluster has now been closed.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 13:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Clusters&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-13.png?sfvrsn=7aa37244_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="figure 13" title="figure 13"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 14:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;
