href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;1 AUGUST 2021&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;hr&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 10px;"&gt;&lt;sup&gt;1 &lt;/sup&gt;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;2 &lt;/sup&gt;Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;3 &lt;/sup&gt;Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;4 &lt;/sup&gt;Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;5 &lt;/sup&gt;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;6&lt;/sup&gt; Includes new cases added today.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Sun, 01 Aug 2021 15:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:9a1e1b3f-6cdb-4aee-b3c9-04768984602a</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/113-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>113 NEW CASES OF LOCALLY TRANSMITTED  COVID-19 INFECTION </title><description>&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 1 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 113 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 70 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 5 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 38 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 7 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In addition, there are 8 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 7 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In total, there are 121 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;1 AUGUST 2021&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Sun, 01 Aug 2021 10:28:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:43c7fa6a-3ff9-4067-83a8-f4122a4fccad</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(31-july)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Update on Local COVID-19 Situation (31 July)</title><description>&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 31 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 117 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 26 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 1 belongs to the KTV cluster. Of the 117 cases today, 67 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 8 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 42 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 7 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are 3 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In total, there are 120 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 1: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Number of Local Unlinked Cases and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance&amp;nbsp;&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-1-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=46750411_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-1-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=46750411_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 1 (31 Jul)" title="Fig. 1 (31 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 30 July 2021, 59% of our population has completed their full regimen/ received two doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme, and 77% has received at least one dose.&amp;nbsp; In total, we have administered a total of 7,504,554 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme, covering 4,299,667 individuals, with 3,327,272 individuals having completed the full vaccination regimen. In addition, 102,840 doses of Sinovac vaccines have been administered as of 30 July 2021, covering 73,793 individuals.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 2: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Percentage of Total Population who Received At Least First Dose&amp;nbsp; and Completed Full Regimen&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-2-(31-jul).png?sfvrsn=b765ad06_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-2-(31-jul).png?sfvrsn=b765ad06_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 2 (31 Jul)" title="Fig. 2 (31 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 3:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;nbsp;by Age Group&lt;sup&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-3-(31-jul).png?sfvrsn=5e10938f_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-3-(31-jul).png?sfvrsn=5e10938f_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 3 (31 Jul)" title="Fig. 3 (31 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 4: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-4-(31-jul).png?sfvrsn=812dcb4c_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-4-(31-jul).png?sfvrsn=812dcb4c_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 4 (31 Jul)" title="Fig. 4 (31 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 5: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Total number of doses administered&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-5-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=bac733c1_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-5-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=bac733c1_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 5 (31 Jul)" title="Fig. 5 (31 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; 604 cases are currently warded in hospital.&amp;nbsp; Most are well and under observation. There are currently 33 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 7 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). 3 amongst these 40 cases are fully vaccinated. Of these, 2 require oxygen supplementation while 1 requires ICU care as they have underlying medical conditions. 26 seniors above 60 years, of whom 24 are completely unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, have fallen very ill.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-6-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=3ab77d3a_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-6-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=3ab77d3a_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 6 (31 Jul)" title="Fig. 6 (31 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-7-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=96d9f2e4_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-7-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=96d9f2e4_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 7 (31 Jul)" title="Fig. 7 (31 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 49 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 28 are unvaccinated, 18 are partially vaccinated and 3 are fully vaccinated.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status &amp;amp; Severity of Condition&lt;sup&gt;4&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-8-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=c107dc31_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-8-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=c107dc31_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 8 (31 Jul)" title="Fig. 8 (31 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 9: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Vaccination Status&lt;sup&gt;4&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-9-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=6db1aea7_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-9-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=6db1aea7_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 9 (31 Jul)" title="Fig. 9 (31 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Overall, the number of new cases in the community has decreased from 1,027 cases in the week before to 868 cases in the past week. We are likely to continue to see high number of cases in the coming days as we step up efforts to detect them to contain their spread in the community. The number of unlinked cases in the community has increased from 99 cases in the week before to 273 cases in the past week. The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 85.0 and 39.0 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; 7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases&lt;sup&gt;5&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-10-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=bc06fb17_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-10-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=bc06fb17_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 10 (31 Jul)" title="Fig. 10 (31 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 11: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Local Cases in the Last 14 Days by Age Group and Vaccination Status&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-11-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=1f3813b8_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-11-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=1f3813b8_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 11 (31 Jul)" title="Fig. 11 (31 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;8.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are a total of 3 imported cases today. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 12: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/ Detected during SHN or Isolation&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-12-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=1a5cae9_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-12-(31-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=1a5cae9_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 12 (31 Jul)" title="Fig. 12 (31 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are 8 new clusters today. In total, there are currently 71 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 1,027 infections. MOH has been monitoring existing clusters for any further transmission. As there have been no more cases linked to the Changi General Hospital cluster for the past two incubation periods (i.e. 28 days), the cluster has now been closed.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 13:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Clusters&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64735&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64850&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;Khoi Grill &amp;amp; Hotpot&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;8&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64642&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64388&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;* Please refer to &lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/docs/librariesprovider5/pressroom/press-releases/annex-a-31-jul.pdf?sfvrsn=a5bd7128_0" title="Annex A"&gt;Annex A&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for the affected markets and food centres.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Collection of ART self-test kits for visitors to selected markets and food centres&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;10.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection involving markets and food centres which are likely seeded by fishmongers who visited Jurong Fishery Port to collect their stock and sell at the markets and food centres. As an added layer of ringfencing to help to identify cases and prevent further transmission, MOH is working with the People’s Association to distribute antigen rapid test (ART) self-test kits to individuals who had visited selected markets and food centres in the last 14 days, such as residents living in the vicinity of these centres. The collection will run from 1 to 2 August 2021 at Residents’ Committee Centres in the vicinity of the following locations:&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;ul&gt;&lt;li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr" role="presentation"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;497 Jurong West Street 41 Market; and&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr" role="presentation"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;Fajar Market (445 Fajar Rd)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;11.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Eligible persons are strongly encouraged to collect and perform self-testing using these ART kits. Please refer to&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="https://www.gowhere.gov.sg/art" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.gowhere.gov.sg/art&amp;amp;source=gmail&amp;amp;ust=1627834946625000&amp;amp;usg=AFQjCNHxx-1NdvMIhtU9Asn1yDs__nnWTg"&gt;https://www.gowhere.gov.sg/art&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;to check on the nearest Residents’ Committee Centre for self-collection.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;12.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Please refer to MOH’s daily Situation Report (&lt;a href="http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&amp;amp;source=gmail&amp;amp;ust=1627834946625000&amp;amp;usg=AFQjCNEqzlJt4YwNjjG_fubfxlJhtU98kg"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situa&lt;wbr&gt;tion-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;31 JULY 2021&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;hr&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[1] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;[2] Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&lt;br&gt;[3] Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;br&gt;[4] Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;[5] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;[6] Includes new cases added today.</description><pubDate>Sat, 31 Jul 2021 15:59:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:a6c1f420-ac14-4902-8b6a-ca4ee0679e99</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/117-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection-31-july-2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>117 New Cases of Locally Transmitted COVID-19 Infection</title><description>&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 31 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 117 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 26 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 1 belongs to the KTV cluster.&amp;nbsp;Of the 117 cases today, 67 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 8 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 42 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 7 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In addition, there are 3 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In total, there are 120 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;31 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Sat, 31 Jul 2021 10:30:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:42878b91-a03e-4b8c-a580-1adfbf554c19</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/community-surveillance-testing-at-556-ang-mo-kio-avenue-10-and-510-west-coast-drive_31July2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>COMMUNITY SURVEILLANCE TESTING AT  556 ANG MO KIO AVENUE 10 AND 510 WEST COAST DRIVE </title><description>&lt;p class="Default" style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Ministry of Health (MOH) is investigating likely COVID-19 transmission at 556 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10 and 510 West Coast Drive. So far,&amp;nbsp;seven cases of COVID-19 infection have been detected in five households at&amp;nbsp;556 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10. Separately, 10 cases of COVID-19 infection have been detected in five households at 510 West Coast Drive.&amp;nbsp;&lt;span&gt;Epidemiological investigations are ongoing to determine linkages and the source of transmission.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In&amp;nbsp;order to uncover community infection cases, MOH&amp;nbsp;will conduct mandatory&amp;nbsp;COVID-19&amp;nbsp;testing for all residents of 556 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10 and 510 West Coast Drive.&amp;nbsp;Testing is optional for those who have tested negative for COVID-19 infection from 27 July onwards.&amp;nbsp;Mandatory testing will be conducted&amp;nbsp;on 1 August&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;2021 between 9am and 4pm, at the&amp;nbsp;Regional Screening Centre&amp;nbsp;at 8 Ang Mo Kio Street 54 (former Da Qiao Primary School) and the pavilion beside 510 West Coast Drive, respectively.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;3. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; All residents are to bring along their NRIC for identification purposes.&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(0, 112, 192);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Leaflets have been distributed and SMS notifications have been sent to the residents to provide them with more information. Residents are reminded to keep to their appointment time. Residents are also advised to monitor their health closely and consult a doctor immediately if they feel unwell. Those who are still awaiting their test results are advised to minimise social interactions as much as possible. They should continue to monitor their health and seek immediate medical attention if they feel unwell.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;31 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Sat, 31 Jul 2021 09:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:8cdd2199-2e80-4bb9-afdd-7c5b54c3ce77</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/updates-on-border-measures-for-travellers-from-australia-and-jiangsu-province-mainland-china/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>UPDATES ON BORDER MEASURES FOR TRAVELLERS FROM AUSTRALIA AND JIANGSU PROVINCE, MAINLAND CHINA</title><description>&lt;p style=""&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;The Multi-Ministry Taskforce has been closely monitoring the local and global COVID-19 situation and regularly reviews Singapore’s border measures to manage the risk of importation from travellers and onward local transmission, taking into account the current situation in their source countries/ regions. We will be tightening our border measures in &lt;strong&gt;Australia&lt;/strong&gt; and &lt;strong&gt;Jiangsu Province, Mainland China&lt;/strong&gt;.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Travellers from Australia to serve 14-day SHN at dedicated SHN facilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As there has been a recent increase in cases reported by Australia, all travellers entering Singapore from &lt;strong&gt;2 August 2021, 2359 hours&lt;/strong&gt;, with travel history in the past 21 days to &lt;strong&gt;Australia&lt;/strong&gt; will be subjected to a 14-day Stay-Home Notice (SHN) at dedicated SHN facilities. Travellers will also be allowed to apply to opt out&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt; of dedicated SHN facilities before arrival and serve their 14-day SHN at their place of residence, if they fulfil the following criteria:&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;a) Travelled to no other country/region other than Australia&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;, in the last consecutive 21 days immediately prior to entry into Singapore; and&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;b) Are occupying their place of residence (i.e. residential address) alone, or only with household members who are also persons serving SHN with the same travel history and duration of SHN.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Travellers will be required to present a valid negative COVID-19 polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test taken within 72 hours before departure for Singapore. Travellers who arrive in Singapore without a valid negative test may be denied entry into Singapore. Permanent Residents (PRs) and long-term pass holders who fail to comply with the new requirement may have their permit or pass cancelled. Beyond the 14-day SHN, travellers will be subjected to the following tests:&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;a) On-arrival PCR test&lt;sup&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt; and PCR test on Day 14 of arrival; and&lt;br&gt;b) Self-administered ART test on Day 3, 7 and 11 of arrival&lt;sup&gt;4&lt;/sup&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Travellers from Jiangsu Province, Mainland China to Serve a 7-Day SHN at Place of Residence&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We had earlier announced that travellers from Mainland China will be allowed to go about their activities in Singapore, without a need to serve SHN, if their on-arrival COVID-19 PCR test results are negative.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Given the increased cases observed in Jiangsu province, we will be tightening border control measures for travellers with travel history to Jiangsu province.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;From &lt;strong&gt;2 August 2021, 2359 hours&lt;/strong&gt;:&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;a) Singapore Citizens (SCs), Permanent Residents (PRs) and Long-Term Pass holders entering Singapore with travel history to Jiangsu province, Mainland China within the last 21 days before departure for Singapore, will be subject to an on-arrival COVID-19 PCR test, a 7-day SHN at their place of residence and a COVID-19 test before the end of the SHN period.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;b) Short-term travellers holding an Air Travel Pass (ATP) with travel history to Jiangsu province, Mainland China within the last 21 days before departure for Singapore, will not be allowed to enter Singapore.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;All other travellers departing from Mainland China who have been in Mainland China (excluding Jiangsu province) in the last 21 days prior to travel will continue to be subject to a COVID-19 test upon arrival at the airport in lieu of their SHN.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;8.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As the global situation evolves, we will continue to adjust our border measures to manage the risk of importation and transmission to the community. Any changes to border measures will be updated on the &lt;a href="http://safetravel.ica.gov.sg"&gt;SafeTravel website&lt;/a&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;31 JULY 2021&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt; Singapore Citizens and PRs may apply to opt out of dedicated SHN facilities via &lt;a href="http://go.gov.sg/scproptout"&gt;https://go.gov.sg/scproptout&lt;/a&gt;, 3 days before arrival. Other travellers may apply for opt-out during the entry application process.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt; Including the following countries/regions: Brunei Darussalam, Hong Kong, Israel, Macao, Mainland China, New Zealand and Taiwan.&amp;nbsp; (correct as of 31 July 2021).&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;nbsp;To expedite the COVID-19 PCR test at the checkpoints, travellers are strongly encouraged to register and pre-pay for their on-arrival COVID-19 PCR test prior to departing for Singapore at &lt;a href="http://safetravel.changiairport.com"&gt;https://safetravel.changiairport.com&lt;/a&gt;/ (for Changi Airport) and &lt;a href="https://t.2c2p.com/express/parkwayshenton"&gt;https://t.2c2p.com/express/parkwayshenton&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;(for Tanah Merah Ferry Terminal).&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;4 &lt;/sup&gt;Only applies to travellers serving SHN in dedicated SHN facilities.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Sat, 31 Jul 2021 07:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:fa0023fe-601b-4856-97f2-576784562ad7</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/updates-on-local-covid-19-situation_30_July_2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Updates on Local COVID-19 Situation</title><description>&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;1.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 30 July&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt; 2021, 12pm, the &lt;/span&gt;Ministry of Health (MOH) &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;has confirmed &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;and verified &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;that &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;there are 131 &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 28 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 1 belongs to the KTV cluster.&amp;nbsp;Of the 131 cases today, 64 are &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span class="bumpedfont15"&gt;linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 15 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 52 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases is 1 senior above 70 years who is partially vaccinated, and is at risk of serious illness&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span class="bumpedfont15"&gt;. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span class="bumpedfont15"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;There are 8 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;2 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 6 developed the illness during SHN or isolation&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;In total, there are 139 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt; Number of Local Unlinked Cases and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance [1]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-143e6da635a254be19b0c17cc4e10e68c.png?sfvrsn=ec3910e_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-143e6da635a254be19b0c17cc4e10e68c.png?sfvrsn=ec3910e_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 1" title="Figure 1" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext;"&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;571 cases are currently warded in hospital. Most are well and under observation. There are currently 26 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 7 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). 2 amongst these 33 cases are fully vaccinated. Of these, 1 requires oxygen supplementation while 1 requires ICU care as they have underlying medical conditions. 23 seniors above 60 years, of whom 22 are completely unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, have fallen very ill.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-209310931dd3d42678804cc934c3f46d0.png?sfvrsn=180c4b86_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-209310931dd3d42678804cc934c3f46d0.png?sfvrsn=180c4b86_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 2" title="Figure 2" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 3:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;by Age Group&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-3afa969644a474ae5b21d78d5db3bde53.png?sfvrsn=9dee23d2_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-3afa969644a474ae5b21d78d5db3bde53.png?sfvrsn=9dee23d2_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 3" title="Figure 3" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 43 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 25 are unvaccinated, 16 are partially vaccinated and 2 are fully vaccinated.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 4:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt; Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status &amp;amp; Severity of Condition [2]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-4be6c1afe008a45fc809bad938557d849.png?sfvrsn=13e65f4b_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-4be6c1afe008a45fc809bad938557d849.png?sfvrsn=13e65f4b_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 4" title="Figure 4" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 5:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;by Vaccination Status&lt;/span&gt;2&lt;/span&gt;&lt;sup&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-532967136526548ea97e8145be0c18d6c.png?sfvrsn=74f339b0_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-532967136526548ea97e8145be0c18d6c.png?sfvrsn=74f339b0_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 5" title="Figure 5" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;Overall, &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;the number of new cases in the community has decreased from 961 cases in the week before to 878 cases in the past week. We are likely to continue to see high number of cases in the coming days as we step up efforts to detect them to contain their spread in the community. The number of unlinked cases in the community has increased from 83 cases in the week before to 257 cases in the past week.&amp;nbsp;The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 88.7 and 36.7 respectively.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt; 7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases [3]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-63d63a5c0a8974cbfb34fa3b96e992fdf.png?sfvrsn=36f4e9a0_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-63d63a5c0a8974cbfb34fa3b96e992fdf.png?sfvrsn=36f4e9a0_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 6" title="Figure 6" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;br&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt; Local Cases in the Last 14 Days by Age Group and Vaccination Status&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-7.png?sfvrsn=78bf9c5b_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-7.png?sfvrsn=78bf9c5b_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 7" title="Figure 7" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;There are a total of 8 imported cases today. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;2 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 6 developed the illness during SHN or isolation&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt; In total, there are currently 63 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 999 infections.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;MOH has been monitoring existing clusters for any further transmission. As there have been no more cases linked to the 105 Henderson Crescent cluster for the past two incubation periods (i.e. 28 days), the cluster has now been closed&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;6&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;Case 65231 &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;4&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;Case 64599 &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;6&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;Case 64782&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;Case 64850&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;Khoi Grill &amp;amp; Hotpot&lt;em&gt; &lt;/em&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;8&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;Case 64642&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;Case 64388 &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;Changi General Hospital&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;20&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br clear="all"&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt; &lt;div id="ftn1"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: justify; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;* Please refer to &lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/docs/librariesprovider5/default-document-library/annex-a86a29721a97d444891e5cc14e35d7573.pdf?sfvrsn=e3dfd31a_0" title="Annex A"&gt;Annex A&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for the affected markets and food centres.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext;"&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext;"&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;As of 29 July 2021, &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;we have administered a total of 7,429,918 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme. The total number of doses administered was 7,429,918, covering 4,290,278 individuals. 3,261,603 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 121,963 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 3,139,640 who received their second dose&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;. In addition, 99,919 doses of&amp;nbsp;Sinovac&amp;nbsp;vaccines have been administered as of 29&amp;nbsp;July 2021, covering&amp;nbsp;73,053 individuals&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt; Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-11901f588cc577485bbd1425095b65ef92.png?sfvrsn=70681045_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-11901f588cc577485bbd1425095b65ef92.png?sfvrsn=70681045_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 11" title="Figure 11" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;and Completed Full Regimen [6]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-1208d4f084edac43bfb8ccebfa7b40ae05.png?sfvrsn=e78b33e_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-1208d4f084edac43bfb8ccebfa7b40ae05.png?sfvrsn=e78b33e_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 12" title="Figure 12" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-143fd4b994ac1d47188748aeb3fd59c83a.png?sfvrsn=3dc9feb6_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-143fd4b994ac1d47188748aeb3fd59c83a.png?sfvrsn=3dc9feb6_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 14" title="Figure 14" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt; (&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;
