width="115"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;Case 64850&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;Khoi Grill &amp;amp; Hotpot&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;8&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;Case 64642&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;Case 64388&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;105 Henderson Crescent&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;22&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;Changi General Hospital&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;20&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;Case 64478&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;div&gt;* Please refer to &lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/docs/librariesprovider5/default-document-library/annex-ad60ba4385d8d4ae1adb90abd92497a8e.pdf?sfvrsn=8186ee57_0" title="Annex A"&gt;Annex A&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for the affected markets and food centres.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;em&gt;Closure of Home’s Favourite Pte Ltd&lt;/em&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection involving individuals who worked in Home’s Favourite Pte Ltd (15 Jalan Tepong, #04-08 and #04-09). To date, we have detected 6 cases linked to the cluster, and our epidemiological investigations have found that there is likely ongoing transmission at the premises. To break the chain of transmission and enable deep cleaning of the premises, Home’s Favourite Pte Ltd will be closed to all members of the public from 29 July to 12 August 2021. All staff will be placed on quarantine, and will be tested during quarantine.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;em&gt;Community surveillance testing for visitors to Taman Jurong Market &amp;amp; Food Centre&lt;/em&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;10.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection involving markets and food centres which are likely seeded by fishmongers who visited Jurong Fishery Port to collect their stock and sell at the markets and food centres. To uncover any community infection cases, we will extend free COVID-19 testing to members of the public who had visited Taman Jurong Market &amp;amp; Food Centre (3 Yung Sheng Road) between 13 July and 27 July. Please refer to &lt;a href="http://go.gov.sg/tj-testing"&gt;https://go.gov.sg/tj-testing&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for details on the testing operations.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;11.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;All visitors to the affected premises are advised to monitor their health closely, and minimise social interactions as far as possible, for 14 days from their date of visit or interaction. They are encouraged to see a doctor immediately if they feel unwell.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;12.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 27 July 2021, we have administered a total of 7,305,300 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme. The total number of doses administered was 7,305,300, covering 4,267,577 individuals. 3,158,737 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 121,014 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 3,037,723 who received their second dose. In addition, 91,712 doses of Sinovac vaccines have been administered as of 27 July 2021, covering 70,712 individuals.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 12: &lt;/strong&gt;Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig12(28jul).png?sfvrsn=5a3bfbe9_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig12(28jul).png?sfvrsn=5a3bfbe9_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig12(28Jul)" title="Fig12(28Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 13: &lt;/strong&gt;Percentage of Total Population who Received At Least First Dose&lt;sup&gt;[5] &lt;/sup&gt;and Completed Full Regimen&lt;sup&gt;[6]&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig13(28jul).png?sfvrsn=72e60c71_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig13(28jul).png?sfvrsn=72e60c71_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig13(28Jul)" title="Fig13(28Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 14:&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig14(28jul).png?sfvrsn=a4248fc5_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig14(28jul).png?sfvrsn=a4248fc5_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig14(28Jul)" title="Fig14(28Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 15:&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fug15(28jul).png?sfvrsn=d32d3a22_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fug15(28jul).png?sfvrsn=d32d3a22_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fug15(28Jul)" title="Fug15(28Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;13.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Please refer to MOH’s daily Situation Report (&lt;a href="http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;28 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt;&lt;div id="ftn1"&gt;&lt;p&gt;[1] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[2] Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[3] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[4] Includes new cases added today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[5] Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[6] Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Wed, 28 Jul 2021 15:55:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:44b3431b-65bd-40e1-bd25-48dc52c0a6c5</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/community-surveillance-testing-at-438-ang-mo-kio-avenue-10-and-430-445a-clementi-avenue-3/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>COMMUNITY SURVEILLANCE TESTING AT 438 ANG MO KIO AVENUE 10 AND 430/445A CLEMENTI AVENUE 3</title><description>&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; The Ministry of Health (MOH) is investigating likely COVID-19 transmission at Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10 and Clementi Avenue 3. So far, 10 cases of COVID-19 infection have been detected in six households at 438 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10. Separately, 10 cases of COVID-19 infection have been detected in seven households at 430 Clementi Avenue 3, and three cases in three households at 445A Clementi Avenue 3. Most of these cases are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster. Epidemiological investigations are ongoing.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;438 ANG MO KIO AVENUE 10&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In order to uncover community infection cases, MOH will conduct mandatory COVID-19 testing for all residents of 438 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10. Testing is optional for those who have tested negative for COVID-19 infection from 24 July onwards. Mandatory testing will be conducted at the void deck of 438 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10 on 29 July 2021 between 9am and 4pm.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;To detect possible asymptomatic cases in the community, MOH will also conduct voluntary COVID-19 testing for visitors and those who have interacted with residents of 438 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10 between 13 July and 27 July 2021. We encourage these individuals to come forward for testing. Testing will be conducted by appointment only at designated Regional Screening Centres from 29 July to 30 July 2021 between 9am and 4pm. To book an appointment and for information on the alternate test locations, please visit &lt;a href="http://go.gov.sg/438-amk-appt"&gt;https://go.gov.sg/438-amk-appt&lt;/a&gt;, or call 1800 333 9999 if you have any queries.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;430 &amp;amp; 445A CLEMENTI AVENUE 3&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH will conduct mandatory COVID-19 testing for all residents of 430 and 445A Clementi Avenue 3. Testing is optional for those who have tested negative for COVID-19 infection from 24 July onwards. Mandatory testing will be conducted at the void deck of 430 Clementi Avenue 3 from 29 July to 30 July 2021 between 9am and 4pm.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH will also conduct voluntary COVID-19 testing for visitors and those who have interacted with residents of 430 and 445A Clementi Avenue 3 between 13 July and 27 July 2021. Testing will be conducted by appointment only at designated Regional Screening Centres, and at the void deck of 321 Clementi Avenue 5 from 29 July to 31 July 2021 between 9am and 4pm. To book an appointment and for information on the alternate test locations, please visit &lt;a href="http://go.gov.sg/430-445a-clementi-appt "&gt;https://go.gov.sg/430-445a-clementi-appt &lt;/a&gt;or call 1800 333 9999 if you have any queries.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;All residents are to bring along their NRIC for identification purposes. Leaflets have been distributed and SMS notifications have been sent to the residents to provide them with more information. Residents are reminded to keep to their appointment time. Residents are also advised to monitor their health closely and consult a doctor immediately if they feel unwell. Those who are still awaiting their test results are advised to minimise social interactions as much as possible. They should continue to monitor their health and seek immediate medical attention if they feel unwell.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;28 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;</description><pubDate>Wed, 28 Jul 2021 12:30:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:ffc8ace4-eb5e-4669-a2d5-31af7a325825</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/updates-to-eligibility-for-covid-19-vaccination-28jul2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>UPDATES TO ELIGIBILITY FOR COVID-19 VACCINATION</title><description>With the international roll-out of COVID-19 vaccination, accrued data has shown that vaccination is safe and can provide protection against infection and severe disease among immunocompromised persons, who are at increased risk of complications from COVID-19. As such, the Expert Committee on COVID-19 Vaccination now recommends that persons who are severely immunocompromised can be vaccinated.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2. To help ensure that they are vaccinated when their immune systems are better able to respond to the vaccination, the following groups of patients should obtain a memo on their suitability from their treating specialist and present it to the vaccination provider before being vaccinated:&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;a. Patients with active cancer on treatment (chemotherapy, immunotherapy or radiotherapy), defined as treatment in the last three months or planned in the next two months;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;b. Patients with recent transplants within the past three months (solid organ or stem cell); and&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;c. Patients on aggressive immunotherapy for non-cancer conditions.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3. People living with HIV can also now be vaccinated regardless of their CD4 count, without a need for a memo.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4. The above groups can be vaccinated in the hospital setting or in a community vaccination site.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;5. The effectiveness of vaccines in persons who are immunocompromised may be reduced. As such, it is important for them to take precautions against infection, including avoiding crowded places and practicing good hand hygiene. Household members and persons around immunocompromised persons are urged to be vaccinated to reduce the risk of being infected and transmitting COVID-19 to them.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6. Separately, recovered persons who have not completed COVID-19 vaccination can do so, and are recommended to receive a single dose of vaccine under the national vaccination programme at least three months after the date of infection. This is a reduction from the previous six-month restriction.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7. COVID-19 vaccination is important to protect oneself and those around us from COVID-19 infection and severe disease. With the change in recommendations, more vulnerable persons can be vaccinated. The Expert Committee encourages all eligible persons to be vaccinated, especially with the current surge in local COVID-19 cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;EXPERT COMMITTEE ON COVID-19 VACCINATION&lt;br&gt;28 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;</description><pubDate>Wed, 28 Jul 2021 10:35:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:e7114e46-e942-41ab-a04b-166e4c1181a1</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/130-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection(28jul)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>130 NEW CASES OF LOCALLY TRANSMITTED COVID-19 INFECTION</title><description>&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 28 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 130 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 27 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 2 belong to the KTV cluster. Of the 130 cases today, 61 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 21 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 48 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 3 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In addition, there are 6 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 2 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 4 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In total, there are 136 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;28 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;</description><pubDate>Wed, 28 Jul 2021 10:25:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:bab8810c-986c-455f-84e0-e6362e84e4e9</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/speech-by-mr-ong-ye-kung-minister-for-health-at-the-virtual-2021-healthcare-scholarships-award-ceremony-28-july-2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>SPEECH BY MR ONG YE KUNG, MINISTER FOR HEALTH, AT THE VIRTUAL 2021 HEALTHCARE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARD CEREMONY, 28 JULY 2021</title><description>Distinguished Guests,&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Scholarship Recipients,&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Parents,&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Ladies and Gentlemen,&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; I am delighted to join you this afternoon at the 2021 Healthcare Scholarships Award Ceremony. My heartiest congratulations to all 164 scholarship recipients.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We are awarding the healthcare scholarships today amidst a global pandemic crisis. Last Thursday, we had to dial back our social distancing posture to Phase 2 (Heightened Alert).&amp;nbsp; For many, this means no more dining in restaurants.&amp;nbsp; Many people are naturally very upset.&amp;nbsp; F&amp;amp;B operators are in despair.&amp;nbsp; It has been a very difficult time for them.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; The Multi-Ministry Taskforce explained why the move was necessary.&amp;nbsp; It was not because of the KTV Clusters, but a far bigger one – five times as large – which is the Jurong Fishery Port cluster.&amp;nbsp; And the Jurong Fishery Port cluster is still growing.&amp;nbsp; Yesterday it registered another 36 more infections, whereas the KTV cluster registered two.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; But there is a deeper underlying reason why we had to throttle back to Phase 2 (Heightened Alert), which we have not explained in a very detailed way in public, and that is to protect our healthcare system.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; The Jurong Fishery Port cluster was spawning clusters in many markets, which have to be closed.&amp;nbsp; There is a risk that it transmits far and wide in our community, especially to seniors who frequent the markets.&amp;nbsp; A quarter of them remain unvaccinated and they are at risk of falling very ill if they are infected with COVID-19.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Against this risk, we look at our hospital capacity for COVID-19 patients.&amp;nbsp; Since the beginning of the pandemic last year, Singapore has prepared various bed types in the hospitals and community to manage COVID-19 patients. For ICU beds, which are required for the critically ill COVID-19 patients, we can open up to around 1,000 such beds if needed. Today, even though we have only a handful of ICU beds are occupied by COVID-19 patients, we have already opened up close to 70 beds, which is double from two weeks ago and we are preparing to open up more ICU beds these few weeks.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; For isolation type beds in our hospitals, we have we have already ramped up about 1,000 beds, just for COVID-19 patients and about 80% of these beds are currently occupied for COVID-19 patients, including those under investigations for suspected COVID-19 infection.&amp;nbsp; If number of COVID-19 hospitalisation goes up further, we will need to discharge more patients to community care facilities, repurpose more beds for COVID-19 operations, and even defer care and scale back beds for patients with non-COVID conditions. Thus, the odds of a large surge in cases are stacked against us: we knew that when a cluster grows uncontrollably, infection numbers would double every seven to ten days, which meant that hospital beds could fill up in a week. Beyond that, we could be overwhelmed.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;8.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; This has happened in many countries around the world.&amp;nbsp; Hospitals could not take in patients anymore.&amp;nbsp; Very sick people had to be turned away, or lie along the corridors.&amp;nbsp; Hospitals ran out of oxygen.&amp;nbsp; Doctors had to choose who lives and who dies.&amp;nbsp; That is why, in a pandemic like this, we protect our healthcare system robustly.&amp;nbsp; We cannot let a human tragedy like this happen in Singapore.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Throughout the pandemic, the integrity of our healthcare system weighs heavily on our minds, and anchors many of our public health decisions.&amp;nbsp; It is a life and death consideration.&amp;nbsp; That is how important our healthcare system is.&amp;nbsp; And that is where all of you will be working in.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;10.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; It is a difficult time for all healthcare workers.&amp;nbsp; Many have not had a proper rest for the past 20 months.&amp;nbsp; But it is also times like this that you see a profession’s true colours – how they unite, dedicate to their cause, take care of their patients, of each other.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;11.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As you spend more years in your career, you will realise that what makes you stay in a workplace or vocation is not just the pay or work-life balance (both of which are important), but these intangibles – pride, professionalism, teamwork, courage and camaraderie.&amp;nbsp; If that is what you are looking for, congratulations to you for choosing the right profession!&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;12.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Let me relate the backgrounds of three of our scholarship recipients today.&amp;nbsp; First is Ms Tang Li Ern.&amp;nbsp; She comes from a family of healthcare professionals. Her mother works as a Clinic Coordinator, and her elder sister is a Staff Nurse. When the pandemic struck, she was inspired by how brave and steadfast her family members were, and the difference they made to the lives of others.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;During her internship at Raffles Medical, Li Ern joined a hospital team to set up Antigen Rapid Testing in the polytechnics and universities. Li Ern will be receiving the Healthcare Merit Award to study Diagnostic Radiography at the Singapore Institute of Technology.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;13.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Another recipient is Mr Yap Zhe Wei.&amp;nbsp; Four years ago, Zhe Wei lost his father, who was the family’s sole bread winner, to a heart attack. The family went through a difficult period and received help from various community organisations. Today, Zhe Wei is paying it forward, and is actively involved in community projects. Through his engagements with the elderly, he realised that many face difficulties performing simple tasks.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;14.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Zhe Wei is one of our mid-term Community Care Scholars, and is studying Physiotherapy at the Singapore Institute of Technology. MOHH launched this scholarship in 2020, recognizing the need for us to shift healthcare away from acute hospital beds, into the community, in forms such as health promotion, preventive medicine and chronic disease management.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;15.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;A third recipient is an in-service scholar – Ms Nurulhuda Idris Angullia. After graduating from ITE, Nurulhuda joined Changi General Hospital as an Enrolled Nurse, before heading to Farrer Park Hospital to take up a position as a Senior Enrolled Nurse. She is currently pursuing her nursing diploma at Nanyang Polytechnic.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;16.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; She has recently decided to focus on community nursing.&amp;nbsp; This is after she had attended a course at one of the community hospitals, where she saw how community nurses play an important role in helping elderly patients recover and stay healthy.&amp;nbsp;Nurulhuda has been awarded the Community Nursing Scholarship, and will have the opportunity to enrol in SIT’s nursing degree programme after graduating from NYP.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;17.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; I tell these three stories, to illustrate the diversity amongst the scholarship recipients today.&amp;nbsp; You come from different backgrounds, and are going into different areas of expertise, contributing to different parts of the healthcare system.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;18.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We have former students from ITE, Polytechnics and Junior Colleges.&amp;nbsp; We have&amp;nbsp; younger scholars who are fresh out of school, and also mid-career ones like Nurulhuda.&amp;nbsp; It is very important that scholarships are not just for the very young.&amp;nbsp; All of us need to continue to learn throughout our lives and careers, hone our skills and knowledge, and reinvent ourselves from time to time, and we will support you to do so.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;19.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Congratulations once again, and I wish you a fulfilling and challenging career ahead.&amp;nbsp;</description><pubDate>Wed, 28 Jul 2021 09:12:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:94c9801c-ea7a-4792-9532-435a7ca891f6</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(27-july)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Update On Local COVID-19 Situation (27 July)</title><description>&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 27 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 136 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 36 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 2 belong to the KTV cluster.&amp;nbsp;Of the 136 cases today, 59 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 22 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 55 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 3 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There are 3 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 2 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 1 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In total, there are 139 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Community Unlinked Cases, and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance, and Dormitory Resident Cases [1]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-114d9a1d71c55490288fd769db741c7fd.png?sfvrsn=7e8ce828_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 1" title="Figure 1"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;545 cases are currently warded in hospital.Most are well and under observation. There are currently 21 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 2 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). 1 amongst these 23 cases is fully vaccinated, but requires oxygen supplementation as she has underlying medical conditions. 13 seniors above 60 years, of whom 12 are completely unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, have fallen very ill.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-2efb870ece1614f24a1bf9de5314a4ed5.png?sfvrsn=93d93f1d_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 2" title="Fig 2"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 3:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Age Group&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-31af9b5cbdb624bd8903ab833db14e12c.png?sfvrsn=799bfe3f_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 3" title="Fig 3"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 27 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 14 are unvaccinated,12 are partially vaccinated and 1 is fully vaccinated. &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 4:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status &amp;amp; Severity of Condition[2]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-48ad4d7cb5d00459e94c4263d0c14fbc4.png?sfvrsn=f1d49291_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 4" title="Fig 4"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 5:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Vaccination Status&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-5c689cfdb7c684440a3aa48be97c823b0.png?sfvrsn=f2e18b2b_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 5" title="Fig 5"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Overall, the number of new cases in the community has increased from 642 cases in the week before to 967 cases in the past week. We are likely to continue to see high number of cases in the coming days as we step up efforts to detect them to contain their spread in the community. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also increased from 46 cases in the week before to 182 cases in the past week.&amp;nbsp;The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 112.1 and 26 respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; 7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases [3]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-60e0f4c4b3a9c49189af45aae543d11fb.png?sfvrsn=6e9305a8_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 6" title="Fig 6"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Community Unlinked and Linked Cases in the Last 14 Days, by Detection Method&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-7aa4367443d374cf098b59f154cb5a43b.png?sfvrsn=8742b8f_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 7" title="Fig 7"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 14 Days by Age Group and Vaccination Status&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-82c1e00466ebf43c6a37ca3b7f50a180d.png?sfvrsn=e1a1438d_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 8" title="Fig 8"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;7.&lt;b&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;There are a total of 3 imported cases today. 2 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 1 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/ Detected during SHN or Isolation&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-92519cf4ace074fa3be210abec989a818.png?sfvrsn=e11e80f1_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 9" title="Fig 9"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;8.&amp;nbsp;&lt;b&gt; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;There are 4 new clusters today. In total, there are currently 39 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 902 infections.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Clusters&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-104d9a023394d64a8ca76a3369bffd1ae4.png?sfvrsn=ea4c485b_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 10" title="Fig 10"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; List of Active Clusters&lt;/p&gt;&lt;table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"&gt; &lt;thead&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Cluster&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;New Cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Total[1]&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;28 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;KTV lounges/clubs&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;2&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 65972&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 65979&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 65132&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 66168&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 65846 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 65791&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 65342 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 65484 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;5&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 65365 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64735&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;6&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 65231 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64599 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;6&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64752&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;7&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;PSC Express Pte Ltd&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64782&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64850&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Khoi Grill &amp;amp; Hotpot&lt;em&gt; &lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;8&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64642&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64388 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;105 Henderson Crescent&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;22&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Changi General Hospital&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;20&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64478&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br clear="all"&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;*Please refer to &lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/docs/librariesprovider5/default-document-library/annex-af9c88d4f441b4c9b813a5a16cf913d13.pdf?sfvrsn=e7d3c1c7_0" title="Annex A"&gt;Annex A&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for the affected markets and food centres.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;u&gt;Collection of ART self-test kits for visitors to selected markets and food centres&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection involving markets and food centres which are likely seeded by fishmongers who visited Jurong Fishery Port to collect their stock and sell at the markets and food centres. As an added layer of ringfencing to help to identify cases and prevent further transmission, MOH is working with the People’s Association to distribute antigen rapid test (ART) self-test kits to individuals who had visited selected markets and food centres in the last 14 days, such as residents living in the vicinity of these centres. The collection will run from 28 to 29 July 2021 at Residents’ Committee Centres in the vicinity of the following locations:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt;&lt;li&gt;Teban Gardens Market &amp;amp; Food Centre (37A Teban Gardens Road); and&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;216 Bedok Food Centre and Market (216 Bedok North Street 1).&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;10.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Eligible persons are strongly encouraged to collect and perform self-testing using these ART kits. Please refer to &lt;a href="https://www.gowhere.gov.sg/art"&gt;https://www.gowhere.gov.sg/art&lt;/a&gt; to check on the nearest Residents’ Committee Centre for self-collection.&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;11.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 26 July 2021, we have administered a total of 7,256,331 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme. The total number of doses administered was 7,256,331, covering 4,254,789 individuals. 3,122,180 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 120,638 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 3,001,542 who received their second dose. In addition, 89,047 doses of&amp;nbsp;Sinovac&amp;nbsp;vaccines have been administered as of 26&amp;nbsp;July 2021, covering&amp;nbsp;69,769 individuals.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 12:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-12b2e85636fd394d90aa0690f8fd52ba08.png?sfvrsn=dfd11bae_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 12" title="fig 12"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 13:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Total Population who Received At Least First Dose [5]&amp;nbsp;and Completed Full Regimen [6]&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-13.png?sfvrsn=c4de60f_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 13" title="fig 13"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 14:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose by Age Group&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-14.png?sfvrsn=7964f4e8_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 14" title="fig 14"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 15:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-15.png?sfvrsn=81810bba_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="fig 15" title="fig 15"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Please refer to MOH’s daily Situation Report (&lt;a href="http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;br clear="all"&gt; &lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt; &lt;div id="ftn1"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[1] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn2"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[2] Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn3"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[3] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn4"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="file:///C:/Users/Vimita/Downloads/Press%20Release-Confirmed%20cases%2066405%20to%2066554-Draft%2027Jul%202350h%20(Final)%20(1).docx#_ftnref4" name="_ftn4"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;[5] Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn6"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[6] Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Tue, 27 Jul 2021 15:59:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:63f016eb-6f10-46f5-9a1d-be2cf442442d</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/psychotic-disorder-amongst-singaporeans-and-permanent-residents_27Jul2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Psychotic Disorder Amongst Singaporeans and Permanent Residents</title><description>&lt;h2 style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Dr Wan Rizal&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;MP for Jalan Besar GRC&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Question No. 1179&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;To ask the Minister for Health (a) what is the current number of Singaporeans and permanent residents with psychotic disorders; (b) what is the breakdown according to occupations; and (c) what are the plans to protect them from being attacked or harassed on social media in our effort to end public stigmatisation.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;h6 style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Written Answer&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h6&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Based on data from the Singapore Mental Health Study 2016, the lifetime prevalence of psychotic disorders in Singapore is estimated to be 2.3%[1]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;However, IMH did not collect data on specific occupations of those who had psychotic disorders.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;There is a need to increase mental health literacy and awareness.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;This will also help reduce the stigma of&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;mental health conditions. Since 2018, the National Council of Social Service has been driving the Beyond the Label campaign.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Health Promotion Board is also developing a one-stop portal on mental health resources to provide curated and accurate information on mental health conditions.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Under the Ministry of Education’s refreshed Character and Citizenship Education curriculum, students are taught the importance of respect and empathy for others, how to protect themselves against cyberbullying, to help look out for their peers, and to speak up against and report bullying to school authorities.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;The Institutes of Higher Learning have also strengthened their cyber wellness curricula to enhance the teaching of digital well-being and online ethics. The Media Literacy Council has also been educating the public on cyber wellness and the avenues available for help when facing online harassment.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;The Protection from Harassment Act (POHA) can be used to protect&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;individuals with mental health conditions from being attacked or harassed on social media. Harassers may be charged under the Act, and victims may also obtain a Protection Order under POHA to restrain persons from publishing harassing communications about them.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%" style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;div id="ftn1"&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 13px;"&gt;[1] Mythily Subramaniam et al. Lifetime Prevalence and Correlates of Schizophrenia and Other Psychotic Disorders in Singapore.&amp;nbsp;Frontiers in Psychiatry. March 2021 | Volume 12 | Article 650674&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Tue, 27 Jul 2021 10:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:b40e18d2-8d2a-497a-a073-160789f82bf6</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/support-for-new-and-expectant-mothers_27Jul2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Support for new and expectant mothers </title><description>&lt;h2 style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Dr Wan Rizal&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MP for Jalan Besar GRC&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Question No. 1178&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;To ask the Minister for Health (a) whether, under the Ministry’s new Child and Maternal Health and Well-being Strategy, mental health screening and support for new and expectant mothers can be made a mandatory part of pregnancy health check-ups in the public and private sectors; and (b) whether support can also be extended to fathers, especially for mothers experiencing post-partum depression.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Written Answer&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Currently, there is support for the mental health of expectant mothers and their spouses. Obstetricians in both the public and private sectors already provide mental health screening and support for expectant mothers. This helps to identify the mental health concerns such as antenatal and postnatal depression symptoms.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Since 2007, the KK Women’s and Children’s Hospital (KKH) and National University Hospital (NUH) have been screening and providing early intervention for perinatal mental health conditions. Under the postnatal intervention programmes, the hospitals provide depression and severe anxiety screening at 2-8 weeks postpartum, during outpatient postnatal reviews at the specialist clinics.&amp;nbsp;The programmes also accept referrals from the private sector. As at December 2020, more than 165,000 women have benefitted from the programmes.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;In addition, the Singapore General Hospital (SGH) has a psychiatry clinic located within the obstetric-gynaecology specialist outpatient clinic, which will support women with antenatal and postnatal depression symptoms.&amp;nbsp;Women with depression will be managed by a multidisciplinary team comprising a psychiatrist, case manager, occupational therapist and psychologist. The women and their family members will be given useful contacts and information on managing their emotional health.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Hospitals may also assess the spouses for signs of distress, tiredness, difficulty in coping with the pregnancy, or paternal postnatal depression. Where appropriate, the affected spouse is offered a referral to the polyclinic or mental health professionals. Within the community, initiatives such as KidSTART, led by the Early Childhood Development Agency, actively screens for paternal depression during home visits and directs appropriate individuals to polyclinics for further assessment. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;We will continue to review the need for further mental health screening at existing service touchpoints in both public and private healthcare sectors, to support new and expectant parents. In that regard, MOH is formulating a Child and Maternal Health and Well-being Strategy, which will include ways to better support the mental well-being of new and expectant mothers and their spouses.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Tue, 27 Jul 2021 10:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:4e4b7ce1-8126-464c-a690-33c1d2f2c065</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-community-health-assessment-team-(chat)-services_27Jul2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Update on Community Health Assessment Team (CHAT) services</title><description>&lt;h2 style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Name and Constituency of Member of Parliament&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: medium; text-align: left;"&gt;Mr Leon Perera&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: medium; text-align: left;"&gt;MP for Aljunied GRC&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;h2&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Question No. 1411&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p style="font-size: medium; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; text-align: justify;"&gt;To ask the Minister for Health (a) what is the take-up rate for the Community Health Assessment Team's (CHAT) services since the pandemic began; (b) whether the CHAT experience can be applied to mental health care for the wider community; (c) what is the number of referrals generated by the community mental health outreach teams set up by the Agency for Integrated Care together with community service partners in 2020; and (d) what is the strategy to ensure that older Singaporeans are accessing the mental health care.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;h6&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Written Answer&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h6&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;This question for oral reply has been addressed by written answer to Oral Questions 49 and 50, taken on 26 July 2021.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Tue, 27 Jul 2021 10:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:c3a1ea7d-f173-46ec-a5d4-dc55a008e15c</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/singapore's-reliance-on-filipino-nurses/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Singapore's Reliance on Filipino nurses</title><description>&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;Ms Foo Mee Har&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;MP for West Coast GRC&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Question No.&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;1357&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin-right: 0cm; margin-left: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;To ask the Minister for Health (a) whether the Ministry can quantify the current extent of Singapore’s reliance on Filipino nurses; and (b) what is the impact on the Singapore healthcare system by Philippines’ move to suspend permits for nurses to work overseas.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;h6 style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 14pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: normal; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Answer&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h6&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;According to Singapore Nursing Board’s 2019 report, about 7,600 (or 18%) of our nursing workforce are Filipino.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;The Ministry of Health is closely monitoring the impact of the Philippines’ suspension of permits. We are working with healthcare employers to ensure the adequacy and sustainability of our nursing workforce. Healthcare employers should also diversify their recruitment sources.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Meanwhile, our local supply of nurses has grown. In 2020, there were around 1,400 new registrations from locals, compared to around 1,200 in 2019. This is a result of our past efforts to grow the nursing intake in our institutes of higher learning. We will continue to enhance the attractiveness of the nursing profession. And I hope more Singaporeans will join this noble profession especially those considering a mid-career switch.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Tue, 27 Jul 2021 10:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:287168d0-b49a-4a18-8fda-9fc2ec0d4a19</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/136-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection27Jul/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>136 New Cases of Locally Transmitted  COVID-19 Infection </title><description>&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 27 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 136 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 36 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 2 belong to the KTV cluster.&amp;nbsp;Of the 136 cases today, 59 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 22 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 55 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 3 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In addition, there are 3 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 2 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 1 developed the illness during SHN or isolation. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In total, there are 139 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;27 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Tue, 27 Jul 2021 09:23:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:085108f5-a8f1-4563-9f13-606d847d9784</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(26-july-2021)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>UPDATE ON LOCAL COVID-19 SITUATION (26 JULY 2021)</title><description>As of 26 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 129 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 61 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 6 belong to the KTV cluster. Of the 129 cases today, 76 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 25 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 28 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases is 1 senior above 70 years who is partially vaccinated, and is at risk of serious illness.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2. There are 6 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 3 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 3 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3. In total, there are 135 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Community Unlinked Cases, and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance, and Dormitory Resident Cases&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure1_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=f63a996a_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure1_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=f63a996a_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure1_26jul2021" title="Figure1_26jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4. 551 cases are currently warded in hospital.&amp;nbsp; Most are well and under observation. There are currently 18 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 2 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). None amongst these 20 cases is fully vaccinated. 12 seniors above 60 years, who are completely unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, have fallen very ill.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure2_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=6c67d75e_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure2_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=6c67d75e_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure2_26jul2021" title="Figure2_26jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 3:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure3_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=ebbfe7ab_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure3_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=ebbfe7ab_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure3_26jul2021" title="Figure3_26jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;5. There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 21 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 10 are unvaccinated,11 are partially vaccinated and none was fully vaccinated.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 4:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status &amp;amp; Severity of Condition&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;br&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure4_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=a6516952_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure4_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=a6516952_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure4_26jul2021" title="Figure4_26jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 5:&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/strong&gt;Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;by Vaccination Status&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure5_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=fcdef5d6_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure5_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=fcdef5d6_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure5_26jul2021" title="Figure5_26jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6. Overall, the number of new cases in the community has increased from 479 cases in the week before to 1,021 cases in the past week. We are likely to continue to see high number of cases in the coming days as we step up efforts to detect them to contain their spread in the community. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also increased from 35 cases in the week before to 143 cases in the past week. The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 125.4 and 20.4 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; 7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases&lt;sup&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure6_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=aa429792_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure6_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=aa429792_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure6_26jul2021" title="Figure6_26jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Community Unlinked and Linked Cases in the Last 14 Days, by Detection Method&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure7_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=d856d261_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure7_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=d856d261_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure7_26jul2021" title="Figure7_26jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/strong&gt;Local Cases in the Last 14 Days by Age Group and Vaccination Status&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure8_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=974531f3_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure8_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=974531f3_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure8_26jul2021" title="Figure8_26jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7. There are a total of 6 imported cases today. 3 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 3 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/ Detected during SHN or Isolation&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure9_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=b422b3d4_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure9_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=b422b3d4_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure9_26jul2021" title="Figure9_26jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;8. There are 10 new clusters today. In total, there are currently 35 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 858 infections.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Clusters&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure10_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=12eb3fe5_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure10_26jul2021.png?sfvrsn=12eb3fe5_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure10_26jul2021" title="Figure10_26jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;td width="558"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 65979 &lt;em&gt;(new cluster)&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="558"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 65132 &lt;em&gt;(new cluster)&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="558"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 66168 &lt;em&gt;(new cluster)&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;td width="558"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64697&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;70 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="558"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 65360 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt;
