href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/docs/librariesprovider5/default-document-library/annex-a(25jul21).pdf?sfvrsn=e8ef04d1_0" title="Annex A"&gt;Annex A&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for the affected markets and food centres.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;em&gt;Collection of ART self-test kits for visitors to selected markets and food centres&amp;nbsp;&lt;/em&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection involving markets and food centres which are likely seeded by fishmongers who visited Jurong Fishery Port to collect their stock and sell at the markets and food centres. As an added layer of ringfencing to help to identify cases and prevent further transmission, MOH is working with the People’s Association to distribute antigen rapid test (ART) self-test kits to individuals who had visited selected markets and food centres in the last 14 days, such as residents living in the vicinity of these centres. The collection will run from 26 to 27 July 2021 at Residents’ Committee Centres in the vicinity of the following locations:&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;• Geylang Bahru Market and Food Centre (69 Geylang Bahru); and&lt;br&gt;• 146 Teck Whye Avenue Market (146 Teck Whye Lane).&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;10.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Eligible persons are strongly encouraged to collect and perform self-testing using these ART kits. Please refer to &lt;a href="http://www.gowhere.gov.sg/art "&gt;https://www.gowhere.gov.sg/art &lt;/a&gt;to check on the nearest Residents’ Committee Centre for self-collection.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;11. As of 24 July 2021, we have administered a total of 7,130,781, doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme. The total number of doses administered was 7,130,781, covering 4,230,379 individuals. 3,020,766 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 120,364 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 2,900,402 who received their second dose. In addition, 82,422 doses of Sinovac vaccines were administered as of 24 July 2021, covering 67,743 individuals.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 12: &lt;/strong&gt;Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig12(25jul21).png?sfvrsn=e8341d2c_0"&gt;&lt;img data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;12. Please refer to MOH’s daily Situation Report (&lt;a href="http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;25 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt;&lt;div id="ftn1"&gt;&lt;p&gt;[1] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;[2]&amp;nbsp;Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;[3]&amp;nbsp;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;[4] Includes new cases added today.&lt;br&gt;[5] Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;[6] Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Sun, 25 Jul 2021 15:55:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:090faef3-e55f-4344-98d8-a4ee26916fb7</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/117-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection(25July2021)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>117 NEW CASES OF LOCALLY TRANSMITTED  COVID-19 INFECTION </title><description>&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 25 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 117 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 46 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 5 belong to the KTV cluster. Of the 117 cases today, 43 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 36 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 38 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 2 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In addition, there are 8 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 4 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 4 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In total, there are 125 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;25 JULY 2021&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Sun, 25 Jul 2021 09:15:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:e6041f5a-1758-4271-939a-718d88ef8da3</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(24-july-2021)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>UPDATE ON LOCAL COVID-19 SITUATION (24 JULY 2021)</title><description>As of 24 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 127 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 75 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 5 belong to the KTV cluster. Of the 127 cases today, 69 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 29 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 29 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 6 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2. There are 3 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3. In total, there are 130 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Community Unlinked Cases, and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance, and Dormitory Resident Cases&lt;sup&gt;1&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure1_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=42eda85b_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure1_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=42eda85b_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure1_24jul2021" title="Figure1_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4. 490 cases are currently warded in hospital.&amp;nbsp; Most are well and under observation. There are currently 12 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 1 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). None amongst these 13 cases is fully vaccinated. 9 seniors above 60 years, who are completely unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, have fallen very ill.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;5. Case 64342, an 83 year-old female Singaporean, has passed away from complications due to COVID-19 infection on 24 July 2021. She resided at Bukit Merah View, and was linked to the 121 Bukit Merah View cluster. She developed symptoms on 16 June but did not seek medical attention until she was conveyed to National University Hospital on 18 June. She had not been vaccinated against COVID-19, and had a history of hypertension and hyperlipidaemia. In total, 37 have passed away from complications due to COVID-19 infection.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure2_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=f460502d_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure2_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=f460502d_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure2_24jul2021" title="Figure2_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 3: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure3_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=4a14171_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure3_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=4a14171_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure3_24jul2021" title="Figure3_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6. There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 11 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 6 are unvaccinated, 5 are partially vaccinated and none was fully vaccinated.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 4:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status &amp;amp; Severity of Condition&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure4_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=7e3b7953_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure4_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=7e3b7953_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure4_24jul2021" title="Figure4_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 5:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Vaccination Status&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure5_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=a782df04_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure5_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=a782df04_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure5_24jul2021" title="Figure5_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7. Overall, the number of new cases in the community has increased from 238 cases in the week before to 1,027 cases in the past week. We are likely to continue to see high number of cases in the coming days as we step up efforts to detect them to contain their spread in the community. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also increased from 17 cases in the week before to 120 cases in the past week. The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 129.6 and 17.1 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/strong&gt;7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases&lt;sup&gt;3&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure6_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=68484c07_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure6_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=68484c07_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure6_24jul2021" title="Figure6_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Community Unlinked and Linked Cases in the Last 14 Days, by Detection Method&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure7_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=95677bbb_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure7_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=95677bbb_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure7_24jul2021" title="Figure7_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 14 Days by Age Group and Vaccination Status&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure8_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=ea1d0cdc_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure8_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=ea1d0cdc_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure8_24jul2021" title="Figure8_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;8. There are a total of 3 imported cases today. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/ Detected during SHN or Isolation&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure9_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=d4a4896d_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure9_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=d4a4896d_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure9_24jul2021" title="Figure9_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;9. There are 2 new clusters today. In total, there are currently 26 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 741 infections. MOH has been monitoring existing clusters for any further transmission. As there have been no more cases linked to the Case 64184 and Case 64264 clusters for the past two incubation periods (i.e. 28 days), the clusters have now been closed.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Clusters&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure10_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=bb9f6055_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure10_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=bb9f6055_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure10_24jul2021" title="Figure10_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="558"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64394&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="558"&gt; &lt;p&gt;119 Bukit Merah View&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;8&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;br clear="all"&gt; &lt;div id="ftn1"&gt;&amp;nbsp;* Please refer to &lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/docs/librariesprovider5/pressroom/press-releases/annex-a---24-jul-2021.pdf?sfvrsn=c88f1513_2" title="Annex A"&gt;Annex A&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for the affected markets and food centres.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Closure of Samy’s Curry Restaurant&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;10. MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection involving individuals who visited Samy’s Curry Restaurant (25 Dempsey Road). To date, we have detected 8 cases linked to the cluster, and our epidemiological investigations have found that there is likely ongoing transmission at the restaurant. To break the chain of transmission and enable deep cleaning of the premises, Samy’s Curry Restaurant will be closed to all members of the public from 25 July to 8 August 2021.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;11. All individuals who work in the restaurant have been placed on quarantine, and will be tested during quarantine. To quickly uncover any community infection cases, we will also extend free COVID-19 testing to members of the public who had visited Samy’s Curry Restaurant between 19 July and 23 July 2021. Please refer to &lt;a href="https://go.gov.sg/samy-testing"&gt;https://go.gov.sg/samy-testing&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for details on the testing operations.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;12. All visitors to the Dempsey area are advised to monitor their health closely, and minimise social interactions as far as possible, for 14 days from their date of visit or interaction. They are encouraged to see a doctor immediately if they feel unwell.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;13. As of 23 July 2021, we have administered a total of 7,060,589, doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme. The total number of doses administered was 7,060,589, covering 4,217,627 individuals. 2,963,275 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 120,313 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 2,842,962 who received their second dose. In addition, 81,227 doses of Sinovac vaccines were administered as of 23 July 2021, covering 67,373 individuals.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 12:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure12_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=156c43ef_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure12_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=156c43ef_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure12_24jul2021" title="Figure12_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 13:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Total Population who Received At Least First Dose&amp;nbsp;and Completed Full Regimen&lt;sup&gt;5&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure13_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=56d859d4_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure13_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=56d859d4_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure13_24jul2021" title="Figure13_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 14:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose&amp;nbsp;by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure14_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=46ee6be5_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure14_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=46ee6be5_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure14_24jul2021" title="Figure14_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 15:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen&lt;sup&gt;6&lt;/sup&gt; of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure15_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=d8d1d083_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure15_24jul2021.png?sfvrsn=d8d1d083_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure15_24jul2021" title="Figure15_24jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;14. Please refer to MOH’s daily Situation Report (&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[1] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[2] Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[3] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[4] Includes new cases added today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[5] Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[6] Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Sat, 24 Jul 2021 15:59:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:1427d9ee-a4b7-4bce-aea0-449171abbfc4</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/community-surveillance-testing-at-ang-mo-kio-avenue-10-and-clementi-avenue-5_24Jul2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>COMMUNITY SURVEILLANCE TESTING AT  ANG MO KIO AVENUE 10 AND CLEMENTI AVENUE 5</title><description>&lt;p class="Default" style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;The Ministry of Health (MOH) is investigating likely COVID-19 transmission at 456 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10 and 340 Clementi Avenue 5. So far, eight cases of COVID-19 infection have been detected in four households at&amp;nbsp;456 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10. Separately, 12 cases of COVID-19 infection have been detected in four households at 340 Clementi Avenue 5. Most of these cases are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster.&amp;nbsp;&lt;span&gt;Epidemiological investigations are ongoing.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class="Default" style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class="Default" style="margin: 0cm; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span&gt;456 ANG MO KIO AVENUE 10&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In&amp;nbsp;order to uncover community infection cases, MOH&amp;nbsp;will conduct mandatory&amp;nbsp;COVID-19&amp;nbsp;testing for all residents of 456 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10; as well as owners and staff of commercial units at the same block.&amp;nbsp;Testing is optional for those who have tested negative for COVID-19 infection from 20 July onwards.&amp;nbsp;Mandatory testing will be conducted&amp;nbsp;at the pavilion at 460A Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10&lt;span style="color: red;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;from 25 July to 26 July 2021 between 9am and 4pm.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;3.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;To detect possible asymptomatic cases in the community, MOH will also conduct voluntary COVID-19 testing for visitors and those who have interacted with residents of 456 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10 between 9 July and 23 July 2021. We encourage these individuals to come forward for testing.&amp;nbsp;Testing will be conducted by appointment only at designated Regional Screening Centres&amp;nbsp;from&amp;nbsp;25 July to 27 July 2021 and at the pavilion at 460A Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10 from 26 July to 27 July 2021,&amp;nbsp;between 9am and 4pm.To book an appointment and for information on the alternate test locations, please&amp;nbsp;visit&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="https://go.gov.sg/456-amk-appt" style="color: rgb(149, 79, 114);"&gt;https://go.gov.sg/456-amk-appt&lt;/a&gt;, or call&amp;nbsp;1800 333 9999 if you have any queries.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;340 CLEMENTI AVENUE 5&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;6.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All residents are to bring along their NRIC for identification purposes.&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(0, 112, 192);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Leaflets have been distributed and SMS notifications have been sent to the residents to provide them with more information. Residents are reminded to keep to their appointment time. Residents are also advised to monitor their health closely and consult a doctor immediately if they feel unwell. Those who are still awaiting their test results are advised to minimise social interactions as much as possible. They should continue to monitor their health and seek immediate medical attention if they feel unwell.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;24 JULY 2021&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm;"&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Sat, 24 Jul 2021 13:30:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:61a10574-eb4c-46e9-a7cb-a91c158fa840</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/127-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection-24jul2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>127 NEW CASES OF LOCALLY TRANSMITTED COVID-19 INFECTION</title><description>As of 24 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 127 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 75 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 5 belong to the KTV cluster. Of the 127 cases today, 69 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 29 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 29 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 6 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In addition, there are 3 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In total, there are 130 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.</description><pubDate>Fri, 23 Jul 2021 16:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:63eba2c5-7e2a-4cb8-a1f6-7ae1cefc1abd</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(23-july)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title> UPDATE ON LOCAL COVID-19 SITUATION (23 JULY)</title><description>&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 23 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 130 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 78 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 6 belong to the KTV cluster. Of the 130 cases today, 64 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 37 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 29 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 2 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;There are 3 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;3.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In total, there are 133 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 1&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;:&amp;nbsp;Number of Community Unlinked Cases, and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance, and Dormitory Resident Cases&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-1_23-jul.png?sfvrsn=225c5a33_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/fig-1_23-jul.png?sfvrsn=225c5a33_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 1_23 Jul" title="Fig 1_23 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;div id="ftn1"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;447 cases are currently warded in hospital.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Most are well and under observation. There are currently 11 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 2 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). None amongst these 13 cases is fully vaccinated. 11 seniors above 60 years, who are completely unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, have fallen very ill. &amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-2_23-jul.png?sfvrsn=2b2b1676_2"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-2_23-jul.png?sfvrsn=2b2b1676_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 2_23 Jul" title="Fig 2_23 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p align="center" style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial, Verdana, sans-serif; text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;5.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 10 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 8 are unvaccinated, 2 are partially vaccinated and none was fully vaccinated.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p align="center" style="margin: 0px 0px 18px; Severity of Condition&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; padding: 0px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 13px; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;6&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Overall, the number of new cases in the community has increased from 178 cases in the week before to 961 cases in the past week. We are likely to continue to see high number of cases in the coming days as we step up efforts to detect them to contain their spread in the community. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also increased from 18 cases in the week before to 97 cases in the past week. The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 123.4 and 13.9 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;94&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64478&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64394&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;4&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64264&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;8&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;119 Bukit Merah View&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;8&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64184&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;14&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 14px;"&gt;* Please refer to &lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/docs/librariesprovider5/default-document-library/annex-a9c17ac4e85594bffb6a8f9b47c9dad1e.pdf?sfvrsn=e04ee7af_0" title="Annex A"&gt;Annex A&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for the affected markets and food centres.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Collection of ART self-test kits for visitors to selected markets and food centres&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;9. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH is investigating cases of&amp;nbsp;COVID-19 infection&amp;nbsp;involving markets and food centres which are likely seeded by fishmongers who visited Jurong Fishery Port to collect their stock and sell at the markets and food centres. As an added layer of ringfencing to help to identify cases and prevent further transmission, MOH is working with the People’s Association to distribute antigen rapid test (ART) self-test kits to individuals who had visited selected markets and food centres in the last 14 days, such as residents living in the vicinity of these centres. The collection will run from 24 to 25 July 2021 at Residents’ Committee Centres in the vicinity of the following locations:&lt;br&gt;- &amp;nbsp;Admiralty Wet Market (678 Woodlands Avenue 6); and&lt;br&gt;- &amp;nbsp;Bukit Timah Market &amp;amp; Food Centre (51 Upper Bukit Timah Road).&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;10. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Eligible persons are strongly encouraged to collect and perform self-testing using these ART kits. Please refer to&lt;a href="https://www.gowhere.gov.sg/art"&gt;&amp;nbsp;https://www.gowhere.gov.sg/art&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;to check on the nearest Residents’ Committee Centre for self-collection.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;11. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 22 July 2021, we have administered a total of 6,978,317 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme. The total number of doses administered was 6,978,317, covering 4,201,110 individuals.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;2,897,480 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 120,273 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 2,777,207 who received their second dose. In addition, 76,411 doses of Sinovac vaccines were administered as of 22 Jul 2021, covering 65,877 individuals.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 12:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-12_23-jul.png?sfvrsn=c570fd7a_2"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-12_23-jul.png?sfvrsn=c570fd7a_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 12_23 Jul" title="Fig 12_23 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style="font-size: 12px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 14:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen&lt;sup&gt;6&lt;/sup&gt; of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-14_23-jul.png?sfvrsn=f3c42b3d_2"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-14_23-jul.png?sfvrsn=f3c42b3d_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 14_23 Jul" title="Fig 14_23 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;12. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Please refer to&amp;nbsp;MOH’s daily Situation Report&amp;nbsp;(&lt;a href="http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;sup&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;23 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;4&lt;/sup&gt;Includes new cases added today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;sup&gt;5&lt;/sup&gt;Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;sup&gt;6&lt;/sup&gt;Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Fri, 23 Jul 2021 15:59:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:9a6383a3-c681-42e4-9664-0aa31ef174db</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/130-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection_23Jul2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>130 New Cases of Locally Transmitted COVID-19 Infection</title><description>&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 23 July 2021, 12pm, &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; text-align: justify; font-family: Arial;"&gt;the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 130 new&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font face="Arial" size="3"&gt;cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 78 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 6 belong to&amp;nbsp;the KTV cluster. Of the 130 cases today, 64 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 37 are linked to previous cases and were detected through&amp;nbsp;surveillance. 29 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 2 seniors above 70 years who are&amp;nbsp;unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;span class="bumpedfont15" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;In addition, there are 3 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;upon arrival in Singapore&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;In total, there are 133 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;font size="3"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;strong style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;23&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;JULY 2021&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Fri, 23 Jul 2021 09:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:0413a089-12af-4fd3-b549-595e6b97e03b</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(22-july-2021)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>UPDATE ON LOCAL COVID-19 SITUATION (22 JULY 2021)</title><description>&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 22 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 162 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 87 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 5 belong to the KTV cluster. Of the 162 cases today, 59 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 51 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 52 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 6 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There are 8 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 5 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 3 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In total, there are 170 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today. There are currently 7 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 1 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU).&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 1: &lt;/strong&gt;Number of Community Unlinked Cases, and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance, and Dormitory Resident Cases[1]&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig1(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=99edad8d_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig1(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=99edad8d_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig1(22Jul21)" title="Fig1(22Jul21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/strong&gt; Community Unlinked and Linked Cases in the Last 14 Days, by Detection Method&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig2(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=6ce4dab7_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig2(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=6ce4dab7_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig2(22Jul21)" title="Fig2(22Jul21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 3: &lt;/strong&gt;Local Cases in the Last 14 Days by Age Group and Vaccination Status&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig3(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=c3a58a6f_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig3(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=c3a58a6f_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig3(22Jul21)" title="Fig3(22Jul21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Overall, the number of new cases in the community has increased from 127 cases in the week before to 883 cases in the past week. We are likely to continue to see high number of cases in the coming days as we step up efforts to detect them to contain their spread in the community. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also increased from 16 cases in the week before to 105 cases in the past week. The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 111.4 and 14.7 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 4:&lt;/strong&gt; 7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases[2]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;a data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There are a total of 8 imported cases today. 5 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 3 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 5: &lt;/strong&gt;Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/&amp;nbsp;Detected during SHN or monitoring&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There are currently 28 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 560 align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;10&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;119 Bukit Merah View&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;8&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;Case 64359&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;6&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;Case 64135&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;ION Orchard&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;5&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;Case 64184&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;14&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;Case 64374&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;* Please refer to &lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/docs/librariesprovider5/default-document-library/annex-a5228b349de9b4ec286e83cb3f0f081c5.pdf?sfvrsn=b0b3fd4e_0" title="Annex A"&gt;Annex A&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for the affected markets and food centres.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;em&gt;Closure of Boon Lay Place Food Village&lt;/em&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection involving markets and food centres which are likely seeded by fishmongers who visited Jurong Fishery Port to collect their stock and sell at the markets and food centres. We have detected 7 cases amongst individuals who worked in or visited Boon Lay Place Food Village. To break the chain of transmission and enable deep cleaning of the premises, Boon Lay Place Food Village (221B Boon Lay Place) will be closed to all members of the public from 23 July to 6 August 2021.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;em&gt;Community surveillance testing for visitors to selected markets &amp;amp; food centres&lt;/em&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;8.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;To uncover any community infection cases, we will extend free COVID-19 testing to members of the public who had visited Boon Lay Place Food Village and&amp;nbsp; Chong Pang Market &amp;amp; Food Centre between 8 July and 22 July. Please refer to &lt;a href="https://go.gov.sg/mkt-testing"&gt;https://go.gov.sg/mkt-testing&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for details on the testing operations.&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;415 cases are currently warded in hospital.&amp;nbsp; Most are well and under observation. There are currently 7 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 1 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). None amongst these 8 cases is fully vaccinated.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig8(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=c58dedc5_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig8(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=c58dedc5_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig8(22Jul21)" title="Fig8(22Jul21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;by Age Group&lt;div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig9(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=b81f2437_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig9(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=b81f2437_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig9(22Jul21)" title="Fig9(22Jul21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;10.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 7 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 6 are unvaccinated, 1 is partially vaccinated and none was fully vaccinated.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 10: &lt;/strong&gt;Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status &amp;amp; Severity of Condition[4]&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig10(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=5b131c1a_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig10(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=5b131c1a_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig10(22Jul21)" title="Fig10(22Jul21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 11: &lt;/strong&gt;Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;by Vaccination Status[4]&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig11(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=5a23eb7f_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig11(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=5a23eb7f_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig11(22Jul21)" title="Fig11(22Jul21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;11.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 21 July 2021, we have administered a total of 6,911,740 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme. The total number of doses administered was 6,911,740, covering 4,184,559 individuals.&amp;nbsp; 2,847,397 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 120,216 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 2,727,181 who received their second dose. In addition, 74,052 doses of Sinovac vaccines were administered as of 21 Jul 2021, covering 64,982 individuals.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 12: &lt;/strong&gt;Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig12(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=1addc56e_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig12(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=1addc56e_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig12(22Jul21)" title="Fig12(22Jul21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 13:&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose by Age Group[5]&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig13(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=9d771bb7_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig13(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=9d771bb7_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig13(22Jul21)" title="Fig13(22Jul21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 14:&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen[6] of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig14(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=8f4a1a80_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig14(22jul21).png?sfvrsn=8f4a1a80_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig14(22Jul21)" title="Fig14(22Jul21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;12.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Please refer to MOH’s daily Situation Report (&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;22 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt;&lt;div id="ftn1"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;[1] Includes new cases added today.&lt;br&gt;[2] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.[3] Includes new cases added today.&lt;br&gt;[4] Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;[5] Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;[6] Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Thu, 22 Jul 2021 15:55:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:3669535b-8c4e-499a-8fa9-7ac487b549d8</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/162-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection(22jul)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>162 NEW CASES OF LOCALLY TRANSMITTED COVID-19 INFECTION </title><description>&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 22 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 162 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 87 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 5 belong to the KTV cluster.&amp;nbsp;Of the 162 cases today, 59 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 51 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 52 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 6 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In addition, there are 8 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 5 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 3 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In total, there are 170 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;22 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;</description><pubDate>Thu, 22 Jul 2021 09:30:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:257b726d-d250-4313-a1d8-539f9fb64387</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/community-surveillance-testing-at-sims-avenue_22July2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>COMMUNITY SURVEILLANCE TESTING AT SIMS AVENUE</title><description>&lt;p align="center" style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; text-align: left;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; The Ministry of Health (MOH) is investigating likely COVID-19 transmission at 842, 844, 846 and 848 Sims Avenue,&amp;nbsp;which are located near Geylang Serai Market. COVID-19 viral fragments have been detected in wastewater samples collected from the blocks.&amp;nbsp;Epidemiological investigations are ongoing to determine linkages and the source of transmission.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In&amp;nbsp;order to quickly uncover community infection cases, MOH&amp;nbsp;will conduct mandatory&amp;nbsp;COVID-19&amp;nbsp;testing for all residents at 842, 844, 846 and 848 Sims Avenue; as well as owners and staff of commercial units at the same blocks.&amp;nbsp;Testing is optional for those who have tested negative for COVID-19 infection from 17 July onwards.&amp;nbsp;Mandatory testing will be conducted at the pavilion at 3 Geylang Serai from 22 July to 23 July 2021 between 9am and 4pm.&amp;nbsp;In the event that a positive&amp;nbsp;COVID-19&amp;nbsp;case is detected, MOH will isolate the case, identify all close contacts, test and quarantine them to protect the community from further transmission.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;3.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;To detect possible asymptomatic cases in the community, MOH will also conduct voluntary COVID-19 testing for visitors and those who have interacted with residents at&amp;nbsp;842, 844, 846 and 848 Sims Avenuebetween 6 July and 20 July 2021. We encourage these individuals to come forward for testing.&amp;nbsp;Testing will be conducted by appointment only at designated Regional Screening Centres from 22 July&amp;nbsp;to 24 July 2021 and at the pavilion at 3 Geylang Serai from 23 July to 24 July 2021,&amp;nbsp;between 9am and 4pm.&amp;nbsp;To book an appointment and for information on the alternate test locations, please visit&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;a href="https://file.go.gov.sg/sims-ave-appt.pdf" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="https://go.gov.sg/sims-ave-appt" style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;https://go.gov.sg/sims-ave-appt&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;or call 1800 333 9999 if you have any queries.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;4.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All residents are to bring along their NRIC for identification purposes.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Leaflets have been distributed and SMS notifications have been sent to the residents to provide them with more information. Residents are reminded to keep to their appointment time. Residents are also advised to monitor their health closely and consult a doctor immediately if they feel unwell. Those who are still awaiting their test results are advised to minimise social interactions as much as possible. They should continue to monitor their health and seek immediate medical attention if they feel unwell.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;22 JULY 2021&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Thu, 22 Jul 2021 04:30:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:54e1b8e1-71a4-480f-9b78-2116a601d2e9</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/updates-on-local-covid-19-situation-(21-july-2021)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>UPDATES ON LOCAL COVID-19 SITUATION (21 July 2021)</title><description>&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 21 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 179 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection of which 130 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 8 belong to the KTV cluster. Of the 179 cases today, 80 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 69 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 30 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 4 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are 2 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. Both developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In total, there are 181 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today. There are currently 7 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 1 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU).&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Community Unlinked Cases, and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance, and Dormitory Resident Cases&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure01_21jul.png?sfvrsn=bf833d0b_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure01_21jul.png?sfvrsn=bf833d0b_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure01_21Jul" title="Figure01_21Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/strong&gt; Community Unlinked and Linked Cases in the Last 14 Days, by Detection Method&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure02_21jul.png?sfvrsn=93a0a015_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure02_21jul.png?sfvrsn=93a0a015_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure02_21Jul" title="Figure02_21Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 3: &lt;/strong&gt;Local Cases in the Last 14 Days by Age Group and Vaccination Status&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure03_21jul.png?sfvrsn=9ea67c1f_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure03_21jul.png?sfvrsn=9ea67c1f_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure03_21Jul" title="Figure03_21Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Overall, the number of new cases in the community has increased from 88 cases in the week before to 766 cases in the past week. We are likely to continue to see high number of cases in the coming days as we step up efforts to detect them to contain their spread in the community. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also increased from 14 cases in the week before to 82 cases in the past week. The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 97.7 and 11.7 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 4:&lt;/strong&gt; 7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure04_21jul.png?sfvrsn=90c49471_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure04_21jul.png?sfvrsn=90c49471_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure04_21Jul" title="Figure04_21Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are a total of 2 imported cases today. Both developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 5: &lt;/strong&gt;Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/Detected during SHN or Isolation&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure05_21jul.png?sfvrsn=7737f5db_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure05_21jul.png?sfvrsn=7737f5db_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure05_21Jul" title="Figure05_21Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are 2 new clusters today. In total, there are currently 28 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 454 infections.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 6: &lt;/strong&gt;Number of Active
