font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;6&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64135&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;4&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;ION Orchard&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;5&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64184&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;14&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64374&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;90 Redhill Close&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;4&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64233&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Collection of ART self-test kits for visitors of selected markets and food centres&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/u&gt;7.&lt;span style="font-stretch: normal;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;MOH is investigating cases of&amp;nbsp;COVID-19 infection&amp;nbsp;involving markets and food centres which are likely seeded by fishmongers who visited Jurong Fishery Port to collect their stock and sell at the markets and food centres. There are currently clusters detected at Hong Lim Market &amp;amp; Food Centre and Chong Boon Market &amp;amp; Food Centre. We have also detected cases amongst fishmongers working at Albert Centre Market &amp;amp; Food Centre, Ang Mo Kio Central Market &amp;amp; Food Centre, 630 Bedok Reservoir Road Market 7 Food Centre, 497 Jurong West Street 41 Market, 505 Jurong West Street 52 Market, Kim Keat Palm Market &amp;amp; Food Centre, Mayflower Wet Market &amp;amp; Food Centre, Teck Ghee Market &amp;amp; Food Centre,&amp;nbsp;146 Teck Whye Avenue Market and&amp;nbsp;Tekka Centre.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;8.&lt;span style="font-stretch: normal;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;We are closely monitoring the situation and taking action to quickly contain and manage the cases, including contact tracing, quarantine and aggressive testing. As an added layer of ringfencing to help to identify cases and prevent further transmission, MOH is working with the People’s Association to distribute antigen rapid test (ART) self-test kits to individuals who had visited selected markets and food centres in the last 14 days, such as residents living in the vicinity of these centres. The collection will run from 20 to 21 July 2021 at Residents’ Committee Centres in the vicinity of the following locations:&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;ul style=""&gt;&lt;li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr" role="presentation"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Cheng San Market &amp;amp; Cooked Food Centre (527 Ang Mo Kio Ave 10);&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr" role="presentation"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Chong Boon Market &amp;amp; Food Centre (453A Ang Mo Kio Ave 10);&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr" role="presentation"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Geylang Serai Market and Food Centre (1 Geylang Serai); and&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"&gt;&lt;p dir="ltr" role="presentation"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Haig Road Market &amp;amp; Food Centre (14 Haig Rd).&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;p style="margin-left: 0in; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;9.&lt;span style="font-stretch: normal;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;Eligible persons are strongly encouraged to collect and perform self-testing using these ART kits. Please refer to&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="https://www.gowhere.gov.sg/art" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;amp;q=https://www.gowhere.gov.sg/art&amp;amp;source=gmail&amp;amp;ust=1626799512389000&amp;amp;usg=AFQjCNEGj327xepRrdEGnMJjKHAyRjyTsA" style="color: rgb(17, 85, 204);"&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;https://www.gowhere.gov.sg/art&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;to check on the nearest Residents’ Committee Centre for self-collection.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Ongoing transmission at KTV clubs/lounges&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;10.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection amongst social hostesses who had frequented KTV lounges or clubs currently operating as F&amp;amp;B outlets, and their close social contacts. Our epidemiological investigations have found that there is likely ongoing transmission at Dynasty Classic KTV (1 Sophia Road) and True Love (211 Geylang Road).&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin-left: 0in; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;11.&lt;span style="font-stretch: normal;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;All visitors to the affected premises are advised to monitor their health closely, and minimise social interactions as far as possible, for 14 days from their date of visit or interaction. They are encouraged to see a doctor immediately if they feel unwell. We also advise all visitors to markets and food centres to avoid crowds and to do your marketing during off-peak hours, or at supermarkets, and to strictly observe the safe management measures.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style=""&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext;"&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;12.&lt;span style="font-stretch: normal;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;289 cases are currently warded in hospital.&amp;nbsp; Most are well and under observation. There are currently 5 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 1 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). None amongst these 6 cases is fully vaccinated.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-weight: 700; text-decoration-line: underline;"&gt;Figure 6:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-6-(19-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=5f13305f_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-6-(19-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=5f13305f_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 6 (19 Jul)" title="Fig. 6 (19 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;by Age Group&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-7-(19-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=7643febf_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-7-(19-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=7643febf_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 7 (19 Jul)" title="Fig. 7 (19 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: justify;"&gt;13.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: justify; font-stretch: normal;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: justify;"&gt;There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 12 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 8 are unvaccinated, 4 are partially vaccinated and none was fully vaccinated.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status and Severity of Condition&lt;/span&gt;&lt;a name="m_-5685113725669929359__Ref76577300" style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;sup&gt;5&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-8-(19-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=c4738bc3_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-8-(19-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=c4738bc3_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 8 (19 Jul)" title="Fig. 8 (19 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;strong style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;by Vaccination Status&lt;/span&gt;&lt;sup style="text-align: center;"&gt;5&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin-bottom: 8pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-9-(19-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=2353954e_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-9-(19-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=2353954e_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig. 9 (19 Jul)" title="Fig. 9 (19 Jul)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin-bottom: 8pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin-top: 0in; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong style=""&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext;"&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;14.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 18 July 2021,&amp;nbsp;we have administered a total of 6,794,394, doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme. The total number of doses administered was 6,794,394, covering 4,153,143 individuals. 2,747,489 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 106,238 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 2,641,251 who received their second dose.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-10-(19-jul).jpg?sfvrsn=939f719d_0"&gt;&lt;img data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;15.&lt;span style="font-stretch: normal;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;Please refer to&amp;nbsp;MOH’s daily Situation Report&amp;nbsp;(&lt;a href="http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report" target="_blank" OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong style="text-align: left;"&gt;19 JULY 2021&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;hr&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="font-size: small; text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div id="m_-5685113725669929359ftn1" style=""&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;[1]&amp;nbsp;This is updated from the afternoon press release as 9 more cases have been linked to previous cases following epidemiological investigations.&lt;br&gt;[2]&lt;span style="text-align: left;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;[3]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;[4]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left;"&gt;Includes new cases added today.&lt;br&gt;[5]&lt;/span&gt;&amp;nbsp;Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;[6] Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&lt;br&gt;[7]&amp;nbsp;Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Mon, 19 Jul 2021 15:58:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:f20a6d8d-3d92-4b4a-a875-35992004dff1</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/163-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection-19-jul-2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>163 New Cases of Locally Transmitted COVID-19 Infection</title><description>&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 19 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 163 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 106 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster and 19 belong to the KTV cluster.&amp;nbsp;Of the 163 cases today, 66 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 71 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 26 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases is 1 senior above 70 years who is unvaccinated, and is at risk of serious illness.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In addition, there are 9 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 4 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 5 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In total, there are 172 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;19 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;</description><pubDate>Mon, 19 Jul 2021 09:30:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:ebfd91ed-fb13-4a0d-8285-5e3e4842a80d</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/updates-on-local-covid-19-situation_18_July_2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Updates on Local COVID-19 Situation</title><description>&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;1.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 18 July&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt; 2021, 12pm, &lt;/span&gt;Ministry of Health (MOH) &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;has confirmed &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;and verified &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;that &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;there are 88 &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 25 belong to the KTV cluster and 42 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster.&amp;nbsp;Of the 88 cases today, 30 are &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span class="bumpedfont15"&gt;linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 48 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 10 are currently unlinked.[1] Amongst the&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span class="bumpedfont15"&gt;cases are 4 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.&lt;span&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span class="bumpedfont15"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; text-align: left;"&gt;There are 4 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 3 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;In total, there are 92 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today. There are currently 5 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 1 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU).&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt; Number of Community Unlinked Cases, and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance, and Dormitory Resident Cases[2]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-1.png?sfvrsn=f6077186_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-1.png?sfvrsn=f6077186_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 1" title="Figure 1" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;Overall, &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;the number of new cases in the community has increased from 17 cases in the week before to 325 cases in the past week. We are likely to see rising cases in the coming days as we step up efforts to detect them to contain their spread in the community. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also increased from 8 cases in the week before to 31 cases in the past week.&amp;nbsp;The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 42.0 and 4.4 respectively.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt; font-family: Arial;"&gt;There are a total of 4 imported cases today. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 3 developed the illness during SHN or isolation&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Total[4]&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/thead&gt; &lt;tbody&gt;&lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;ION Orchard&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;5&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64184&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;14&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64374&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;90 Redhill Close&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64233&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;121 Bukit Merah View&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;5&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;Additional cases linked to &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;u&gt;Jurong Fishery Port cluster&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: none;"&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;MOH is investigating COVID-19 cases involving markets and food centres which are likely seeded by fishmongers who visited Jurong Fishery Port to collect their stock and sell at the markets and food centres. There are currently clusters detected at Hong Lim Market &amp;amp; Food Centre and Chong Boon Market &amp;amp; Food Centre. On 17 July, MOH also announced cases detected amongst fishmongers working at Amoy Street Food Centre, 527 Ang Mo Kio Market, Chong Pang Market &amp;amp; Food Centre, Bukit Timah Wet Market, Geylang Bahru Market, Geylang Serai Malay Market, Redhill Market, Taman Jurong Market, Telok Blangah Crescent Block 11, 726 West Coast Wet Market and Whampoa Wet Market. Today, we have detected additional cases amongst fishmongers working at Haig Road Market and Cooked Food Centre, Jurong Central Plaza and Shunfu Mart.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;8.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;We are closely monitoring the situation and taking action to quickly contain and manage the cases, including contact tracing, quarantine and aggressive testing. To better enable contact tracing to ringfence cases, from 19 July, the National Environment Agency &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;and Town Councils will be progressively implementing access control with interim fencing and mandatory SafeEntry check-in at markets where COVID-19 cases have been detected amongst stallholders or stall assistants&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;u style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Ongoing transmission at KTV clubs/lounges&lt;/u&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection amongst social hostesses who had frequented KTV lounges or clubs currently operating as F&amp;amp;B outlets, and their close social contacts. O&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;ur epidemiological investigations have found that there is likely ongoing transmission at the following &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;KTV lounges/clubs&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;ul style="list-style-type: disc;"&gt;&lt;li&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;Maze Club (2 Aliwal Street);&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;China Doll (1 Sophia Road);&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;Club Myth (&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;1 Coleman Street); and&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;Martell W Ktv Chivas (6 Foch Road). &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;10.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;All visitors to the affected premises are advised to monitor their health closely, and minimise social interactions as far as possible, for 14 days from their date of visit or interaction. They are encouraged to see a doctor immediately if they feel unwell. We also advise all visitors to markets and food centres to avoid crowds and to do your marketing during off-peak hours, or at supermarkets, and to strictly observe the safe management measures.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext;"&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;11.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;243 cases are currently warded in hospital. Most are well and under observation. There are currently 5 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 1 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). None amongst these 6 cases is fully vaccinated.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-6ac6e1d52632b4043a6e1d5f316cc88a0.png?sfvrsn=1a455db1_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-6ac6e1d52632b4043a6e1d5f316cc88a0.png?sfvrsn=1a455db1_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 6" title="Figure 6" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;by Age Group&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-7007fe5a5fff048f788b24965a0ebe20f.png?sfvrsn=b68fad5d_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-7007fe5a5fff048f788b24965a0ebe20f.png?sfvrsn=b68fad5d_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 7" title="Figure 7" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;12.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 11 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 7 are unvaccinated, 4 are partially vaccinated and none was fully vaccinated.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt; Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status and Severity of Condition[5]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration-line: none;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-886f4c1631edf435fa229720aa3381279.png?sfvrsn=ea2b8245_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-886f4c1631edf435fa229720aa3381279.png?sfvrsn=ea2b8245_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 8" title="Figure 8" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;by Vaccination Status&lt;/span&gt;&lt;sup style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;5&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-9be972b4a39d6455cabd2a838710e0576.png?sfvrsn=2f416e60_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-9be972b4a39d6455cabd2a838710e0576.png?sfvrsn=2f416e60_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 9" title="Figure 9" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext;"&gt;13.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;As of 17 July 2021, &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;we have administered a total of 6,726,540, doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme. The total number of doses administered was 6,726,540, covering 4,136,551 individuals. 2,676,171 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 86,182 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 2,589,989 who received their second dose&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt; Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-10.png?sfvrsn=5caac09a_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-10.png?sfvrsn=5caac09a_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 10" title="Figure 10" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt; Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose by Age Group[6]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-11.png?sfvrsn=d42980f4_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-11.png?sfvrsn=d42980f4_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 11" title="Figure 11" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 12:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt; Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen[7]&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-12.png?sfvrsn=584ca761_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure-12.png?sfvrsn=584ca761_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 12" title="Figure 12" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;13.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;Please refer to &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;MOH’s daily Situation Report&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt; (&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;) for details.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="margin-left: 0in; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; text-align: left;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div style="padding: 0in 0in 1pt; border-top: none; border-right: none; border-bottom-width: 1pt; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left: none;"&gt; &lt;p style="padding: 0in; border: none;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;18 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br clear="all"&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt; &lt;div id="ftn1"&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;[1] This is updated from the afternoon press release as 7 more cases have been linked to previous cases following epidemiological investigations. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn2"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;[2]&amp;nbsp;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn3"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;[3] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn4"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;[4] Includes new cases added today.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn5"&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;[5] Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn6"&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;[6] Based on National Immunisation Registry data. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn7"&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;[7] Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Sun, 18 Jul 2021 15:58:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:b1d47917-1a06-4fc5-b8f3-4ec0ea7d7f5e</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/further-precautionary-measures-to-protect-our-vulnerable-elderly-from-covid-19-surge/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Further Precautionary Measures To Protect Our Vulnerable Elderly From COVID-19 Surge</title><description>&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Over the past weekend, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has uncovered clusters in wet markets and hawker food centres, likely seeded by fishmongers and stallholders who visited the Jurong Fishery Port to collect their stock and sell at these markets and food centres.&amp;nbsp; We have found clusters at two markets - Hong Lim Market &amp;amp; Food Centre and Chong Boon Market &amp;amp; Food Centre - as well as cases at Amoy Street Food Centre and Chong Pang Market &amp;amp; Food Centre. In addition, persons at Whampoa Wet Market, Telok Blangah Crescent Block 11, Taman Jurong Market, Redhill Market, Geylang Serai Malay Market, Geylang Bahru Market, 527 Ang Mo Kio Market, 726 West Coast Wet Market and Bukit Timah Wet Market have tested positive via Antigen Rapid Tests (ART). All of them have since been confirmed to be positive for COVID-19 infection with polymerase chain reaction (PCR) testing.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In today's testing, we have uncovered more cases, linked to the above markets as well as other markets. Further details will be announced in the regular MOH media release later.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;While we have conducted aggressive public health actions to detect such cases, we are concerned that there remain cryptic transmission chains which might continue to spread within our community. The porous nature of wet markets makes contact tracing and isolation less straightforward. We are particularly concerned that these wet markets serve a range of customers, including the vulnerable elderly, some of whom remain unvaccinated. They might be infected, and could suffer severe symptoms.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;The Multi-Ministry Taskforce is taking quick action to contain and manage these clusters, including contact tracing, quarantining of close contacts, and an aggressive testing strategy.&amp;nbsp; Group sizes will be limited to 2 persons for hawker centres, food courts, and coffeeshops as a default from&amp;nbsp;19 July 2021.&amp;nbsp; We will also tighten up measures to better manage access to the affected wet markets from 19 July 2021 onwards.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;NEA and the Town Councils will be progressively implementing access control with interim fencing and mandatory SafeEntry check-in at markets where COVID-19 cases have been detected amongst stallholders or stall assistants.&amp;nbsp; This includes the seven markets&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;nbsp;where MOH has recently detected COVID-19 cases amongst stallholders and stall assistants. The added access control will better enable contact tracing to ringfence cases.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There are already another 13 popular markets&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt; with access control in place since the start of the Circuit Breaker where patrons are not allowed to enter once the number of patrons in each market reaches the stipulated allowable capacity.&amp;nbsp;This is to avoid over-crowding and ensure that effective safe distancing and enforcement can be carried out to ensure everyone's safety.&amp;nbsp;Eleven of the 13 markets also have mandatory SafeEntry check-in implemented, which will be rolled out progressively to the rest of the markets with access control.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As announced by MTF on 15 July 2021, we will be implementing vaccination-differentiated safe management measures in higher-risk indoor mask-off activities such as F&amp;amp;B dine-in and gyms/fitness studios. The default group size will be reduced from 5 persons to 2 persons. However, we will allow individuals to continue in groups of up to 5 persons in these settings provided they are (i) fully vaccinated, or (ii) recovered or (iii) have a valid negative pre-event test result for the duration of their activity. Children aged 12 years and below who are not eligible for the vaccines will also receive this concession. These measures will proceed as originally planned, from 19 July through to 8 August 2021.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;8.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;However, given the heightened concerns over the potential for community spread, we strongly advise unvaccinated individuals, especially the elderly, to stay home as much as possible over the next few weeks. We urge members of the public to reach out to your elderly relatives or neighbours who remain unvaccinated to see what assistance they may require, e.g. to buy daily necessities. With the upcoming public holiday on 20 July, individuals should continue to limit their overall number of social gatherings to not more than 2 per day, whether it is to another household, or to meet with friends and family members in a public place.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Even those who are vaccinated but have unvaccinated elderly at home, should avoid crowded places or extensive social interactions. Vaccinated persons may still get infected with the virus, although most will typically experience mild or no symptoms. They may then inadvertently bring the virus home to seniors.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;10.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We continue to urge everyone who is eligible - in particular our seniors, who are most at risk of developing serious symptoms - to get vaccinated as soon as possible. Seniors can walk in to any vaccine centre for their vaccinations. They can also book an appointment through the&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;a href="http://vaccine.gov.sg/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=http://vaccine.gov.sg&amp;amp;source=gmail&amp;amp;ust=1626708101591000&amp;amp;usg=AFQjCNHBHwis7b7ukaQiItCErU4U2cdnbQ" style="color: rgb(17, 85, 204); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;vaccine.gov.sg&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;website. We also urge partially vaccinated individuals to bring forward their second dose appointments so they can be fully protected earlier. We remind all to observe prevailing safe management measures - see a doctor if unwell, and get tested as early as possible if they feel ill, even if they have been vaccinated.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;11.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We have made significant progress in reopening and vaccinating the Singapore population since the start of this year and we must not lose our momentum. Any further steps towards reopening will only be possible if everyone stays vigilant, gets vaccinated, and continues to adhere to the safe management measures.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;18 JULY 2021&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;hr&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;[1] Block 69 Geylang Bahru market; Block 79 Redhill Lane market; Block 11 Telok Blangah market; Block 92 Whampoa Drive market; Bukit Timah Market; Taman Jurong Market and Block 726 Clementi West St 2 market.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;[2] Block 105 Hougang Avenue 1 market; Block 209 Hougang Street 21 market; Block 335 Smith Street market; Block 341 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 1 market; Block 409 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10 market; Block 453A Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10 market; Block 527 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10 market; Block 665 Buffalo Road market; Block 254 Jurong East Street 24 market; Geylang Serai Market; Block 104/105 Yishun Ring Road (Chong Pang Market); Block 20/21 Marsiling Lane market; Block 505 Jurong West Street 52 market&lt;/span&gt;</description><pubDate>Sun, 18 Jul 2021 15:15:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:8970d5fa-0892-49c5-934a-ed12bbb9df2b</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/88-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection_18_July_2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>88 New Cases of Locally Transmitted COVID-19 Infection</title><description>&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;1.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 18 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 88 new &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 23 belong to the KTV cluster and 37 are linked to the Jurong Fishery Port cluster.&amp;nbsp;Of the 88 cases today, 30 are &lt;span class="bumpedfont15"&gt;linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 41 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 17 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 4 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;In addition, there are 4 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;upon arrival in Singapore&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 3 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;In total, there are 92 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div style="padding: 0in 0in 1pt; border-top: none; border-right: none; border-bottom-width: 1pt; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left: none;"&gt; &lt;p style="padding: 0in; border: none;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;18 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Sun, 18 Jul 2021 09:57:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:9fac9034-691d-487c-aeb5-7cb15d54d630</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-precautionary-measures-for-stallholders/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Update on Precautionary Measures for Stallholders</title><description>&lt;p class="Default"&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;1.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As announced by the Ministry of Health (MOH) on 17 July 2021, COVID-19 clusters have been uncovered involving fishmongers who visited the Jurong Fishery Port to collect their stock and sell at the markets.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p class="Default"&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;As a precautionary measure, fresh fish and seafood stallholders at markets managed by the National Environment Agency (NEA) or NEA-appointed operators were disallowed from operating this morning in order to prevent any further transmission.&amp;nbsp;These stallholders have or will be receiving an SMS Health Risk Warning (HRW) from MOH.&amp;nbsp;The HRW means that the person is required by law to get a Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) test at designated testing centres.&amp;nbsp;Until tested negative, the person is required to self-isolate and not leave their home.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Affected fish and seafood stallholders can also walk in to specified Regional Screening Centres (&lt;/span&gt;&lt;u style="color: windowtext; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/docs/librariesprovider5/default-document-library/annexebc4b8a5bee349c4bf041af54cfd5201.pdf?sfvrsn=4f27f160_0" title="Annex"&gt;Annex&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;) today&amp;nbsp;should they wish to get their PCR tests done as soon as possible. Stallholders who receive a negative PCR test result are able to resume business immediately.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;In addition to the PCR test, fresh fish and seafood stallholders will be issued with self-test Antigen Rapid Test (ART) kits and are required to self-administer an ART test on the seventh day from the last exposure. They will also be required to undergo another PCR test at designated testing centres around the 14&lt;/span&gt;&lt;sup style="color: windowtext; font-family: Arial;"&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt; day from their date of last known exposure.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;MOH has also arranged with NEA to conduct COVID-19 testing for all&amp;nbsp;stallholders and stall assistants of market stalls and cooked food stalls at hawker centres and markets managed by NEA or NEA-appointed operators. These stallholders and stall assistants will receive an SMS notification with details of the scheduled test. Stalls not selling fresh fish or seafood can remain in operation while the testing of stallholders is taking place over the next few days. We urge all stallholders and stall assistants to get tested, for their benefit and that of their patrons.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: windowtext; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;We advise all visitors to the markets and food centres to avoid crowds, to visit during off-peak hours where possible, and to strictly observe safe management measures.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; text-align: left;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;NATIONAL ENVIRONMENT AGENCY&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;div style="padding: 0in 0in 1pt; border-top: none; border-right: none; border-bottom-width: 1pt; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left: none;"&gt; &lt;p style="margin-left: 0in; padding: 0in; border: none;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;18 JULY 2021&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Sun, 18 Jul 2021 07:25:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:15140ce6-02bd-44f0-9dc5-d5714718980e</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(17-july-2021)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>UPDATE ON LOCAL COVID-19 SITUATION (17 JULY 2021)</title><description>As of 17 July 2021, 12pm, Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 60 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 29 belong to the KTV cluster. Of the 60 cases today, 33 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 25 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 2 are currently unlinked.&lt;sup&gt;1&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt; There are 8 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 7 developed the illness during SHN or isolation. In total, there are 68 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today. There are currently 5 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 1 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU).&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/strong&gt;Number of Community Unlinked Cases, and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance, and Dormitory Resident Cases&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure1_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=beb63b4_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure1_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=beb63b4_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure1_17jul2021" title="Figure1_17jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2. Overall, the number of new cases in the community has increased from 17 cases in the week before to 239 cases in the past week. We are likely to see rising cases in the coming days as we step up efforts to detect them to contain their spread in the community. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also increased from 8 cases in the week before to 22 cases in the past week. The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 31.0 and 3.1 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/strong&gt;7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases&lt;sup&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure2_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=3a52e976_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure2_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=3a52e976_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure2_17jul2021" title="Figure2_17jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3. There are a total of 8 imported cases today. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 7 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 3: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/ Detected during SHN or Isolation&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure3_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=474fc219_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure3_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=474fc219_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure3_17jul2021" title="Figure3_17jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4. There are 3 new clusters today. In total, there are currently 29 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 148 infections. MOH has been monitoring existing clusters for any further transmission. As there have been no more cases linked to the Case 64263 cluster for the past two incubation periods (i.e. 28 days), the cluster has now been closed.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 4: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Number of Active Clusters&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure4_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=e13bdb0f_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure4_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=e13bdb0f_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure4_17jul2021" title="Figure4_17jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 5:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;6&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="558"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64135&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="558"&gt; &lt;p&gt;ION Orchard&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt;
