&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;14&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="558"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64374&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="558"&gt; &lt;p&gt;90 Redhill Close&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="558"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64233&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="558"&gt; &lt;p&gt;121 Bukit Merah View&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="172" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;5&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;br clear="all"&gt; &lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Additional measures to ringfence clusters&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;5. We have uncovered clusters involving markets and food centres. These clusters are likely seeded by fishmongers who visited the Jurong Fishery Port to collect their stock and sell at the markets. We announced the cluster at Hong Lim Market &amp;amp; Food Centre yesterday, and MOH is now investigating 2 cases who work in or visited Chong Boon Market &amp;amp; Food Centre (453A Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10), with 3 more cases pending confirmation. To break the chain of transmission and enable deep cleaning of the premises, Chong Boon Market &amp;amp; Food Centre will be closed to all members of the public from 18 July to 1 August 2021. All individuals who work in the market and food centre will be placed on quarantine, and tested during quarantine.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6. MOH has also detected cases amongst fishmongers working at Amoy Street Food Centre, Chong Pang Market &amp;amp; Food Centre, Whampoa Wet Market, Telok Blangah Crescent Block 11, Taman Jurong Market, Redhill Market, Geylang Serai Malay Market, Geylang Bahru Market, 527 Ang Mo Kio Market, 726 West Coast Wet Market and Bukit Timah Wet Market.&amp;nbsp; Most are tested positive via Antigen Rapid Tests (ART) and are being confirmed with polymerase chain reaction (PCR) testing. Our epidemiological investigations found that they are likely to have been infected through contact with stallholders at Jurong Fishery Port.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7. Testing of fishmongers is still ongoing. As there is risk of transmission to other markets and food centres, we are conducting aggressive contact tracing, quarantine and testing to ringfence the cases and prevent further spread. Fishmongers from all markets will receive an SMS Health Risk Warning on 18 July, and will be required under the law to get tested at&amp;nbsp; designated testing centres and self-isolate until they receive a negative test from their first PCR test. They will be issued with self-test ART kits and are required to self-administer an ART test on the seventh day from the last exposure. They will also be required to undergo another PCR test at designated testing centres around the 14th day from their date of last known exposure.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;8. MOH therefore advises all visitors to the markets and food centres to avoid crowds and to do your marketing during off-peak hours, or at supermarkets, and to strictly observe the safe management measures.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Ongoing transmission at KTV clubs/lounges&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;9. MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection amongst social hostesses who had frequented KTV lounges or clubs currently operating as F&amp;amp;B outlets, and their close social contacts. Our epidemiological investigations have found that there is likely ongoing transmission at the following KTV lounges/clubs:&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;• Quinn KTV (207A Syed Alwi Road);&lt;br&gt;• Club AURA (442 Orchard Road);&lt;br&gt;• Club Ion (271 Bukit Timah Road);&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;• Icon II (35 Selegie Road);&lt;br&gt;• Club Lucky Thai (5001 Beach Road); and&lt;br&gt;• M. Sakhon (5001 Beach Road).&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;10. All visitors to the affected premises are advised to monitor their health closely, and minimise social interactions as far as possible, for 14 days from their date of visit or interaction. They are encouraged to see a doctor immediately if they feel unwell.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;11. 196 cases are currently warded in hospital.&amp;nbsp; Most are well and under observation. There are currently 5 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 1 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU). None amongst these 6 cases is fully vaccinated.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure6_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=7ea7bb8b_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure6_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=7ea7bb8b_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure6_17jul2021" title="Figure6_17jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure7_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=1d51c054_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure7_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=1d51c054_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure7_17jul2021" title="Figure7_17jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;12. There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 14 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 10 are unvaccinated, 4 are partially vaccinated and none was fully vaccinated.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 8: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status and Severity of Condition&lt;sup&gt;5&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure8_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=4109a455_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure8_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=4109a455_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure8_17jul2021" title="Figure8_17jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;by Vaccination Status&lt;sup&gt;5&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure9_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=c23cb05_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure9_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=c23cb05_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure9_17jul2021" title="Figure9_17jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;13. As of 16 July 2021, we have administered a total of 6,650,677, doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme. The total number of doses administered was 6,650,677, covering 4,118,334 individuals. 2,609,367 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 77,024 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 2,532,343 who received their second dose.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure10_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=9a087f2_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure10_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=9a087f2_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure10_17jul2021" title="Figure10_17jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose by Age Group&lt;sup&gt;6&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure11_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=be05403b_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure11_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=be05403b_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure11_17jul2021" title="Figure11_17jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 12:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen&lt;sup&gt;7&lt;/sup&gt; of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure12_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=e66bd1f5_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/figure12_17jul2021.png?sfvrsn=e66bd1f5_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure12_17jul2021" title="Figure12_17jul2021" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;14. Please refer to MOH’s daily Situation Report (&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;[1]&amp;nbsp; This is updated from the afternoon press release as 3 more cases have been linked to previous cases following epidemiological investigations.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[2] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[3] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;[4] Includes new cases added today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[5] Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[6] Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[7] Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Sat, 17 Jul 2021 15:59:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:c04e6de1-6c94-4e4b-941d-3b003cefb0b8</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection-at-jurong-fishery-port/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Update on Cases of Locally Transmitted COVID-19 Infection at Jurong Fishery Port </title><description>&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH is investigating seven cases of infection among individuals at the Jurong Fishery Port as of 16 July 2021. The premises has been closed for deep cleaning till 31 July.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; All who worked at the Jurong Fishery Port between 3 July to 16 July have already been placed on quarantine. Special Testing Ops are ongoing for all visitors to the Port during that period.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;However, there has been spread from the Jurong Fishery Port to Hong Lim Market, and there is a &amp;nbsp;risk of transmission of the virus to other markets. As a precautionary measure, MOH has arranged with the National Environment Agency to test fishmongers from all markets at our test centres and distribute Antigen Rapid Test kits to them, so that they can continue to monitor themselves. Details on this will be released shortly.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We understand that there is now a rush to buy fish. MOH advises all visitors to the wet markets to avoid crowds and to do your marketing during off-peak hours, or at supermarkets. Please be mindful of safe management measures, by keeping a 1-metre distance from one another and wearing your masks properly while marketing.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;17 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Sat, 17 Jul 2021 07:55:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:b7b3a9a3-a46c-4b79-9602-edf2f632c3ee</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/60-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection-17jul2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>60 NEW CASES OF LOCALLY TRANSMITTED COVID-19 INFECTION</title><description>As of 17 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 60 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 29 belong to the KTV cluster. Of the 60 cases today, 33 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 22 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 5 are currently unlinked.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In addition, there are 8 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 7 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; In total, there are 68 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.</description><pubDate>Fri, 16 Jul 2021 16:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:e33f9fb2-7c64-46d7-92ae-a0571a59bf22</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(16-july)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title> UPDATE ON LOCAL COVID-19 SITUATION (16 JULY)</title><description>&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 16 July 2021, 12pm, Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 53 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 32 belong to the KTV cluster. Of the 53 cases today, 24 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 24 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 5 are currently unlinked.&lt;sup&gt;[1]&lt;/sup&gt; There are 8 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 2 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 6 developed the illness during SHN or isolation. In total, there are 61 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today. There are currently 7 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 1 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 1: &lt;/strong&gt;Number of Community Unlinked Cases, and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance, and Dormitory Resident Cases &lt;sup&gt;[2]&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-1-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=d3a8cc15_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-1-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=d3a8cc15_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 1 16 Jul" title="Fig 1 16 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; Overall, the number of new cases in the community has increased from 21 cases in the week before to 179 cases in the past week. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also increased from 9 cases in the week before to 20 cases in the past week. The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 22.7 and 2.9 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 2: &lt;/strong&gt;7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases &lt;sup&gt;[3]&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-2-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=d5f3e1ec_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-2-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=d5f3e1ec_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 2 16 Jul" title="Fig 2 16 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;3.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; There are a total of 8 imported cases today. 2 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 6 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 3:&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/Detected During SHN or Isolation&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-3-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=620b4db7_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-3-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=620b4db7_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 3 16 Jul" title="Fig 3 16 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;4.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; There are two new clusters today. In total, there are currently 27 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 120 infections.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 4: &lt;/strong&gt;Number of Active Clusters&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-4-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=8f21675_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-4-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=8f21675_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 4 16 Jul" title="Fig 4 16 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 5: &lt;/strong&gt;List of Active Clusters&lt;/p&gt;&lt;table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64735&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64599 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;5&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64388 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;105 Henderson Crescent&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;21&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Changi General Hospital&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;20&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;115 Bukit Merah View Market &amp;amp; Food Centre&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;94&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64478&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64394&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64444&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64264&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;8&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64349&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;10&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;119 Bukit Merah View&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;8&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64359&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;6&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64135&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;ION Orchard&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;5&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64184&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;14&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64374&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;90 Redhill Close&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64233&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;121 Bukit Merah View&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;5&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64263&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Community surveillance testing and closure of affected premises&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;u&gt;Closure of Hong Lim Market &amp;amp; Food Centre and Jurong Fishery Port&lt;/u&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;5.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection amongst individuals who worked in or visited Hong Lim Market &amp;amp; Food Centre (531A Upper Cross St) and Jurong Fishery Port. There are so far 7 cases linked to the cluster. To break the chain of transmission and enable deep cleaning of the premises, Hong Lim Market &amp;amp; Food Centre and Jurong Fishery Port will be closed to all members of the public from 17 July to 31 July 2021.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;6.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; To quickly uncover any community infection cases, mandatory COVID-19 testing will be conducted for all visitors to Jurong Fishery Port between 3 July and 16 July 2021. We will also extend free COVID-19 testing to members of the public who had visited Hong Lim Market &amp;amp; Food Centre between 2 July and 16 July 2021. Please refer to&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="https://go.gov.sg/hlm-testing" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://go.gov.sg/hlm-testing&amp;amp;source=gmail&amp;amp;ust=1626536158346000&amp;amp;usg=AFQjCNGr0vKIPfIGBMownPjDBbBko9luZA"&gt;https://go.gov.sg/hlm-testing&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for details on the testing operations.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;7.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; All visitors to the premises are advised to monitor their health closely, and minimise social interactions as far as possible, for 14 days from their date of visit or interaction. They are encouraged to see a doctor immediately if they feel unwell.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;u&gt;Closure of Khoi Grill &amp;amp; Hotpot&lt;/u&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;8.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection amongst individuals who work in or visited Khoi Grill &amp;amp; Hotpot (283 Jalan Besar). There are so far 7 cases linked to the cluster. To break the chain of transmission and enable deep cleaning of the premises, Khoi Grill &amp;amp; Hotpot has been closed to all members of the public from 16 July to 30 July 2021. All individuals who work in or visited the restaurant have been placed on quarantine, and will be tested during quarantine.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;9.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; 184 cases are currently warded in hospital.&amp;nbsp; Most are well and under observation. There are currently 7 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 1 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU).&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 6: &lt;/strong&gt;Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-6-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=d9511e81_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-6-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=d9511e81_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 6 16 Jul" title="Fig 6 16 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Age Group&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-7-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=ad8cdd72_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-7-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=ad8cdd72_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 7 16 Jul" title="Fig 7 16 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;10.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 17 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 13 are unvaccinated, 4 are partially vaccinated and none was fully vaccinated.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 8: &lt;/strong&gt;Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status and Severity of Condition &lt;sup&gt;[5]&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-8-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=96974d51_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-8-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=96974d51_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 8 16 Jul" title="Fig 8 16 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Vaccination Status &lt;sup&gt;[5]&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-9-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=b1fbafdc_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-9-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=b1fbafdc_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 9 16 Jul" title="Fig 9 16 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt; &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;11.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; As of 15 July 2021, we have administered a total of 6,570,666 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme. The total number of doses administered was 6,570,666, covering 4,096,705 individuals. 2,545,838 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 71,877 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 2,473,961 who received their second dose.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/strong&gt; Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-10-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=83bd4b2_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-10-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=83bd4b2_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 10 16 Jul" title="Fig 10 16 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 11: &lt;/strong&gt;Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose by Age Group &lt;sup&gt;[6]&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-11-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=f1c84f3_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-11-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=f1c84f3_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 11 16 Jul" title="Fig 11 16 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 12: &lt;/strong&gt;Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen&lt;sup&gt; [7]&lt;/sup&gt; of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-12-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=a6592146_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-12-16-jul.png?sfvrsn=a6592146_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 12 16 Jul" title="Fig 12 16 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;12.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; Please refer to MOH’s daily Situation Report (&lt;a href="http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&amp;amp;source=gmail&amp;amp;ust=1626536158347000&amp;amp;usg=AFQjCNEJSrDPmaUlG2eNLGhZih5tVR8J-A"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/&lt;wbr&gt;situation-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;16 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;hr&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;sup&gt;1&amp;nbsp; &lt;/sup&gt;This is updated from the afternoon press release as 4 more cases have been linked to previous cases following epidemiological investigations.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;2&amp;nbsp; &lt;/sup&gt;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;3&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt; Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;4&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt; Includes new cases added today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;5&amp;nbsp; &lt;/sup&gt;Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;6&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;nbsp; Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&lt;br&gt;7&amp;nbsp; Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Fri, 16 Jul 2021 15:36:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:eaa5b6bf-780a-4325-a94c-95025e83125a</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/updates-on-phase-3-(heightened-alert)-measures/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Updates on Phase 3 (Heightened Alert) Measures</title><description>&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; The Multi-Ministry Taskforce (MTF) had earlier announced a calibrated path for resumption of more economic and social activities under Phase 3 (Heightened Alert) from &lt;strong&gt;12 July 2021&lt;/strong&gt; onwards. It will depend heavily on our population vaccination rate, and we aim to have two-thirds of our population complete the vaccination regimen by National Day. However, the new infection clusters that emerged in this past week have been a setback to the efforts of our people in the battle against COVID-19. We have to act quickly now to contain the spread of the virus in our community, but recognising that a good proportion of our population are now fully vaccinated. While this setback will delay our re-opening plans, the significant and continuing progress made in our vaccination efforts will put us in a strong position to safely re-open our economy and society once the latest situation is contained.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Suspension of All Pivoted Nightlife Establishments&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Within the community, we detected a number of clusters in multiple KTV lounges or nightclubs that had pivoted to operate as Food &amp;amp; Beverage (F&amp;amp;B) establishments. To break potential chains of transmission, we have undertaken testing operations for staff and those who have visited these identified premises. Even as we do so, we are identifying more cases and clusters in such similar settings.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Since October 2020, nightlife establishments have not been allowed to operate but, upon representation by the industry, have been allowed to pivot into F&amp;amp;B operations. Regrettably, several errant establishments have abused the system by operating clandestine and illegal activities. Three such F&amp;amp;B establishments have since had their licenses to serve food revoked by the Singapore Food Agency. We will continue to take strict enforcement actions against all F&amp;amp;B operators who breach the safe management measures (SMMs).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In addition, we will implement a two-week suspension of operations from &lt;strong&gt;16 July 2021 through 30 July 2021 for&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;strong&gt;all nightlife establishments that had pivoted into F&amp;amp;B establishments. &lt;/strong&gt;There are over 400 such establishments, and they will be individually notified about the suspension. During this period, we will test all the staff of these establishments. We will also inspect the SMM protocols in these establishments, and ensure these are properly implemented, before they are allowed to resume F&amp;amp;B operations.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Aggressive Ringfencing Around Cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;5.&lt;b&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;To mitigate the risk of wider, undetected community transmission, we will aggressively ringfence cases emerging around the KTV cluster through the use of SafeEntry (SE) data:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;ul&gt;&lt;li&gt;Individuals who have been identified to have visited hotspots at the same time as a confirmed COVID-19 case will receive an SMS “Health Risk Warning”. &lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;These individuals will be required under the law to get tested at a designated testing centre and self-isolate until they receive a negative test from their first polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test. &lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;As such individuals who test negative could still be incubating the virus, they should still limit their interactions with others as an added precaution for 14 days from their last exposure and only undertake essential activities during this period. &lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;These individuals will also be issued with self-test Antigen Rapid Test (ART) kits when they come forward to do their first PCR test. They will be required to self-administer an ART test on the 7&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt; day from the last exposure to confirm that they are not infected. &lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;They will also be required to undergo another PCR test at designated testing centres around the 14&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt; day from their date of last known exposure for assurance that they are not incubating the virus. &lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;If these individuals should develop any acute respiratory infection (ARI) symptoms, such as cough, runny nose, or fever, they should see their doctor immediately.&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;p&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We will also be sending a “Health Risk Alert” via SMS to individuals who have visited the locations where these nightlife establishments operating as F&amp;amp;B establishments are located in, or at other similar establishments flagged out by the Singapore Police Force: &lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;a. Unlike “Health Risk Warning”, these individuals are not subject to actions required by the law. However, they should monitor their health and limit their interactions with others for 14 days from their last exposure as an added precaution.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;b. They are encouraged to also purchase self-test ART kits from retail pharmacies and do self-tests regularly over the 14 days.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; Individuals who have recently visited such nightlife establishments now operating as F&amp;amp;B establishments, and/or interacted with social hostesses in any settings between &lt;strong&gt;29 June 2021&lt;/strong&gt; to &lt;strong&gt;15 July 2021&lt;/strong&gt; are to come forward for a free swab test [1]. They may also go to a private clinic and pay for tests. Similarly, individuals who develop any ARI symptoms, such as cough, runny nose or fever, should see their doctor immediately.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Tightening of Selected Safe Management Measures in Phase 3 (Heightened Alert) from 19 July 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;8.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; To mitigate further community spread, we will tighten community SMMs for higher-risk indoor, mask-off settings with effect from &lt;strong&gt;19 July 2021&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;strong&gt;through 8 August 2021 &lt;/strong&gt;(both dates inclusive). Please refer to &lt;u&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/docs/librariesprovider5/default-document-library/annex-a91cf05db079a473e85e033bb8f9cb428.pdf?sfvrsn=a55542cd_0" title="Annex A"&gt;Annex A&lt;/a&gt; &lt;/u&gt;for full details on the updated SMMs.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;u&gt;Dining-In at Food &amp;amp; Beverage (F&amp;amp;B) establishments&lt;/u&gt; &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Dining-in at F&amp;amp;B establishments will be dialled back to&lt;strong&gt; groups of up to 2 persons&lt;/strong&gt;, i.e. a decrease from the groups of up to 5 persons allowed currently.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;10.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As fully-vaccinated individuals have good protection against infection and severe illness, and are also less likely to infect others as compared to unvaccinated individuals, &lt;strong&gt;we will allow fully-vaccinated &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;individuals to continue to dine-in in groups of up to 5 persons, at participating F&amp;amp;B establishments that have put in place systems to check the status of such individuals&lt;/strong&gt;. An individual is considered fully-vaccinated two weeks after he or she has received two doses of Pfizer-BioNTech/ Comirnaty or Moderna vaccines. Unvaccinated individuals with a valid negative pre-event test (PET) result or recovered individuals are of similarly lower risk, and may also join in such groups of 5.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;11.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Children below the age of 12 are currently ineligible for any COVID-19 vaccine in our national vaccination programme. It is also more challenging to swab these young children for PET. We will therefore allow a concession for members of the same household to dine together with their unvaccinated children aged 12 years and below, without the need for PET for the children. This whole group should not exceed 5 persons. If the children are not from the same household, then they should constitute not more than half the dine-in group.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;12.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In summary, the following individuals will be eligible to dine-in in a group of up to five persons in an F&amp;amp;B establishment&lt;strong&gt;:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;ol&gt;&lt;li&gt;A fully vaccinated person;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;A person who has recovered from COVID-19 (within 270 days);&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;An unvaccinated person who has a valid negative PET result for the duration of his dining-in[2]; or&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;A child aged 12 years and below.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ol&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/docs/librariesprovider5/default-document-library/annex-b26e603847daf404a99c4f73cb79600fc.pdf?sfvrsn=ac494332_0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;u&gt;Annex B&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/a&gt; illustrates different scenarios involving such dine-in groups.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;13.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Individual F&amp;amp;B establishments have the flexibility to decide whether to introduce the vaccination-differentiated group sizes, depending on their own operating model and clientele, and their ability to check the status of dining-in individuals.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;14.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As hawker centres, food courts and coffee shops have a more porous setting and generally do not impose mandatory SE check-in, it would be very challenging to check the status of individuals before they seat themselves at a table. Hence, group sizes will be limited to 2 persons for hawker centres, food courts, and coffee shops as a default. &lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;15.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As dining-in in F&amp;amp;B establishments remains a high-risk activity because many people will be unmasked and in close proximity with each other, &lt;strong&gt;entertainment such as live performances, recorded music and videos/TV screening, will continue to be prohibited&lt;/strong&gt; at F&amp;amp;B establishments.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;16.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Patrons to F&amp;amp;B establishments are also reminded to adhere to all SMMs and keep their masks on at all times except when eating or drinking.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;u&gt;Wedding Receptions&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;17.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Wedding receptions will continue at the current group size of up to 5 persons per table, without the requirement for all individuals in the group to be fully vaccinated. There will be no change to the PET requirement, i.e. up to 250 persons with PET and 50 persons with PET only for the wedding party.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;18.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We acknowledge that wedding couples have faced significant uncertainties over the past few months. Hence, we will allow this key life event to continue at current numbers and PET provisions, so that couples do not need to revise their wedding plans again.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;u&gt;Indoor, High-Intensity Mask-off Sports/Exercise activities&lt;/u&gt;. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;u&gt;19.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Outdoor activities (mask-on and mask-off) and indoor mask-on activities&lt;/u&gt;: These can continue in groups of no more than 5 persons, in classes of up to &lt;strong&gt;50&lt;/strong&gt; persons including the instructor, subject to the venue’s capacity limit, whichever is lower. This is irrespective of vaccination or test status.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;u&gt;20.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Indoor high-intensity mask-off activities&lt;/u&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;a) We will be &lt;strong&gt;reducing the group size to no more than 2 persons&lt;/strong&gt;, in classes of up to &lt;strong&gt;30&lt;/strong&gt; persons including the instructor, without the need for testing or vaccination. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;b) These activities can continue in groups of up to 5 persons in classes of up to 30 persons provided all individuals in the class are fully vaccinated, or are a recovered patient, or have a valid negative COVID-19 test result covering the duration of the class. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;c)&amp;nbsp; However, for activities that involve children aged 12 years and below who are not vaccinated, the group size limit will remain at 2 persons, in classes of up to 30 persons. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;d)&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;The class size of up to 30 persons is also subject to the venue’s capacity limit, whichever is lower.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;21.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;SportSG will release more details on this.&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;u&gt;Social gatherings at the workplace&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;22.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Work-from-home will continue to remain the default arrangement so as to reduce overall interaction within workplaces and on public transport. Employers are reminded to adhere to the practice. Employees who need to come to the workplace must continue to stagger their start times and observe flexible working hours.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;23.&amp;nbsp;&lt;strong&gt; &amp;nbsp; Social and recreational gatherings at the workplace will be disallowed &lt;/strong&gt;and work-related events (e.g. product launches, townhalls) should continue to not serve F&amp;amp;B at the event itself.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Targeted Support Measures&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;24.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In view of the tightened safe management measures of various activities until 8 August, the Government will extend the 10% Jobs Support Scheme (JSS) for the affected sectors from &lt;strong&gt;26 July 2021&lt;/strong&gt; to &lt;strong&gt;8 August 2021&lt;/strong&gt;. This will provide support to licensed F&amp;amp;B businesses, gyms, fitness studios, performing arts organisations and arts education centres. Please refer to &lt;u&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/docs/librariesprovider5/default-document-library/annex-c0d34fb8350704a39b05295665dce7bf2.pdf?sfvrsn=c844b148_0" title="Annex C"&gt;Annex C&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/u&gt; for details.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;25.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; To provide targeted support to hawkers who are self-employed, the Government will extend the rental waivers and subsidies for fees for table-cleaning and centralised dishwashing services by one month for stallholders in centres managed by the National Environment Agency (NEA) or NEA-appointed operators.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Towards a COVID-19 Endemic Singapore&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;26.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We have made significant progress in reopening and vaccinating the Singapore population since the start of this year and we must not lose our momentum. Any further steps towards reopening and a Singapore with endemic COVID-19 will only be possible when everyone stays vigilant and continue to adhere to the SMMs, and we are able to protect more of the population through vaccination.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;27.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We urge everyone who is eligible, in particular our seniors, to step forward and get vaccinated as soon as possible. We encourage all to register their interest via &lt;a href="file:///C:/Users/nataliexxgoh/Documents/Comms/Press%20Releases/10%20May%202021/31%20May%202021%20-%20P2HA%20update,%20ART,%20vacc,%20maybe%20HH%20contacts%20of%20PUQs/vaccine.gov.sg"&gt;vaccine.gov.sg&lt;/a&gt; and book their appointments.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;div&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;16 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;br clear="all"&gt; &lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt; &lt;div id="ftn1"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[1] Sites where individuals can be swabbed can be found at: go.gov.sg/ktv-testing&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn2"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[2] The PET must have been taken in the past 24 hours before the expected end of the event.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Fri, 16 Jul 2021 10:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:ed737005-8154-4370-8b32-0843c2442496</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/53-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection_16Jul/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>53 NEW CASES OF LOCALLY TRANSMITTED  COVID-19 INFECTION </title><description>&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 16 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 53 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 32 belong to the KTV cluster. Of the 53 cases today, 24 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 20 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 9 are currently unlinked.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2. In addition, there are 8 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 2 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 6 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3. In total, there are 61 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4. We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;16 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Fri, 16 Jul 2021 08:30:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:0c2214a7-c767-4337-adc8-15f4111ed885</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation(15-july)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title> UPDATE ON LOCAL COVID-19 SITUATION (15 JULY)</title><description>&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 15 July&amp;nbsp;2021, 12pm,&amp;nbsp;Ministry of Health (MOH)&amp;nbsp;has confirmed&amp;nbsp;and verified&amp;nbsp;that&amp;nbsp;there are 42&amp;nbsp;cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 34 belong to the KTV cluster.&amp;nbsp;Of the 42 cases today, 17 are&amp;nbsp;linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 21 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 4 are currently unlinked.&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt; &amp;nbsp;There are 6 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice&amp;nbsp;(SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore.&amp;nbsp;4 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation. In total, there are 48 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p align="center" style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;Number of Community Unlinked Cases, and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance, and Dormitory Resident Cases&lt;/span&gt;&lt;sup&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;2&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-1-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=83326f30_2"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-1-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=83326f30_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 1 _15 Jul" title="Fig 1 _15 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin-left: 0cm; text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;2. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Overall,&amp;nbsp;the number of new cases in the community has increased from 23 cases in the week before to 127 cases in the past week. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also increased from 9 cases in the week before to 16 cases in the past week.&amp;nbsp;The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 15.9 and 2.3 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 2&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;:&amp;nbsp;7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases&lt;sup&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-2-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=be65c95d_2"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-2-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=be65c95d_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 2 _15 Jul" title="Fig 2 _15 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin-left: 0cm; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are a total of 6 imported cases today.&amp;nbsp;4 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;:&amp;nbsp;Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/&amp;nbsp;Detected During SHN or Isolation&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-3-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=d344628a_2"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-3-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=d344628a_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 3 _15 Jul" title="Fig 3 _15 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;4. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There are currently 25 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 94 infections.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 4:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;Number of Active Clusters&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-4-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=b2cd91f9_2"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-4-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=b2cd91f9_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 4 _15 Jul" title="Fig 4 _15 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 5:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;List of Active Clusters&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"&gt;&lt;thead&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Cluster&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;New Cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Total&lt;sup&gt;4&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/thead&gt;&lt;tbody&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;KTV lounges/clubs&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;34&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;88&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64697&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;14&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64752&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;1&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;6&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Case 64642&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width="372"&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;
