font-size: 16px;"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt;&lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;4&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;Community surveillance testing and closure of affected premises&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline; font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;Closure of&amp;nbsp;ComfortDelGro Driving Centre&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;5. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection amongst&amp;nbsp;individuals who work in&amp;nbsp;or visited ComfortDelGro Driving Centre (205 Ubi Avenue 4).&amp;nbsp;There are so far 6 cases linked to the cluster.&amp;nbsp;To break the chain of transmission and enable deep cleaning of the premises,&amp;nbsp;ComfortDelGro Driving Centre&amp;nbsp;has been closed to all members of the public from 15 July to 29 July 2021.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; To quickly uncover any community infection cases,&amp;nbsp;we will be conducting special testing operations for all staff of&amp;nbsp;ComfortDelGro Driving Centre. We will also extend free COVID-19 testing to members of the public who had visited the driving centre between&amp;nbsp;6 July and 15 July 2021.&amp;nbsp;Please refer to&amp;nbsp;https://go.gov.sg/cdc-testing&amp;nbsp;for details on the testing operations.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Closure of Las Vegas KTV and Tuberose KTV&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection amongst social hostesses who had frequented KTV lounges or clubs currently operating as F&amp;amp;B outlets, and their close social contacts.&amp;nbsp;Our epidemiological investigations have found that there is likely ongoing transmission at&amp;nbsp;Las Vegas KTV (35 Selegie Road)&amp;nbsp;and&amp;nbsp;Tuberose KTV (35 Selegie Road). &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;8. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;To break any potential chain of transmission and enable deep cleaning, these premises will be closed to all members of the public from 16 July to&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;30 July 2021. We will also extend free COVID-19 testing to members of the public who had:&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;i) &amp;nbsp; Visited the following premises between&amp;nbsp;29 June and 15 July 2021:&lt;br&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;- &amp;nbsp;Las Vegas KTV (35 Selegie Road)&amp;nbsp;or&amp;nbsp;Tuberose KTV (35 Selegie Road); or&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;- &amp;nbsp;Similar&amp;nbsp;KTV lounges or clubs operating as F&amp;amp;B outlets.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; ii) &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Interacted with social hostesses of any nationality in any setting between 29 June and 15 July 2021.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Please refer to&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="https://go.gov.sg/ktv-testing"&gt;https://go.gov.sg/ktv-testing&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for details on the testing operations.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;9. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;All visitors to&amp;nbsp;ComfortDelGro Driving Centre, as well as&amp;nbsp;Las Vegas KTV and Tuberose KTV and similar settings,and those who had interacted with social hostesses of any nationality, are advised to monitor their health closely, and minimise social interactions as far as possible, for 14 days from their date of visit or interaction. They are encouraged to see a doctor immediately if they feel unwell.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;10. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; 180 cases are currently warded in hospital.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Most are well and under observation. There are currently 7 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 1 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU).&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-6-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=5b8e214a_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 6 _15 Jul" title="Fig 6 _15 Jul" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Age Group&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-7-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=878e8dd1_2"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-7-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=878e8dd1_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 7 _15 Jul" title="Fig 7 _15 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;11. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 17 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 13 are unvaccinated, 4 are partially vaccinated and none was fully vaccinated.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;F&lt;span style="font-size: 12px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;igure 8:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status and Severity of Condition&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-8-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=ee812d16_2"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-8-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=ee812d16_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 8 _15 Jul" title="Fig 8 _15 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline; font-family: Arial; font-size: 12px;"&gt;F&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;igure 9:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation,&amp;nbsp;by Vaccination Status&lt;sup&gt;4&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-9-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=60f88ee4_2"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-9-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=60f88ee4_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 9 _15 Jul" title="Fig 9 _15 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;12. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 14 July 2021, we have administered a total of 6,504,568 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme.&amp;nbsp;The total number of doses administered was 6,504,568, covering 4,075,822 individuals.&amp;nbsp;2,480,287 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 51,541 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 2,428,746 who received their second dose.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 10:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-10-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=5d62eea5_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 10 _15 Jul" title="Fig 10 _15 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p align="center" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose by Age Group&lt;sup&gt;6&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left; font-family: Arial; font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-11-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=62e8d690_2"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-11-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=62e8d690_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 11 _15 Jul" title="Fig 11 _15 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p align="center" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12px;"&gt;&lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 12:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen&lt;sup&gt;7&lt;/sup&gt; of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-12-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=62275af2_2"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig-12-_15-jul.png?sfvrsn=62275af2_2" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig 12 _15 Jul" title="Fig 12 _15 Jul" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true" style="float: left;"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;13. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Please refer to&amp;nbsp;MOH’s daily Situation Report&amp;nbsp;(&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;15 JULY 2021&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;sup&gt;&lt;font size="2"&gt;--------------------------&lt;br&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;br&gt;1&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;This is updated from the afternoon press release as 1 more case has been linked to the KTV cluster following epidemiological investigations. &lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;2 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;3 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;4 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;Includes new cases added today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;5&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;6&amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;Based on National Immunisation Registry data.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;sup&gt;7 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/sup&gt;Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;</description><pubDate>Thu, 15 Jul 2021 14:50:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:f05bf263-fd3b-45c1-8f60-faee605358d1</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/community-surveillance-testing-at-rowell-road_15July2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>COMMUNITY SURVEILLANCE TESTING AT ROWELL ROAD </title><description>&lt;p align="center" style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; The Ministry of Health (MOH) is investigating likely COVID-19 transmission at 639 Rowell Road. So far, 12 cases of COVID-19 infection have been detected in two households at 639 Rowell Road.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;"&gt;Epidemiological investigations are ongoing to determine linkages and the source of transmission.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In&amp;nbsp;order to uncover community infection cases, MOH&amp;nbsp;will conduct mandatory&amp;nbsp;COVID-19&amp;nbsp;testing for all residents of 639 Rowell Road.&amp;nbsp;Testing is optional for those who have tested negative for COVID-19 infection from 11 July onwards. In the event that a positive&amp;nbsp;COVID-19&amp;nbsp;case is detected, MOH will isolate the case, identify all close contacts, test and quarantine them to protect the community from further transmission.&amp;nbsp;Mandatory testing will be conducted at the pavilion at 636 Veerasamy Road on 16 July 2021 between 9am and 4pm.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;3.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;To detect possible asymptomatic cases in the community, MOH will also conduct voluntary COVID-19 testing for visitors and those who have interacted with residents of 639 Rowell Road between 30 June and 14 July 2021. We encourage these individuals to come forward for testing.&amp;nbsp;Testing will be conducted by appointment only at designated Regional Screening Centres&amp;nbsp;from&amp;nbsp;16 to 17 July 2021&amp;nbsp;between 9am and 4pm.To book an appointment and for information on the alternate test locations, please visit&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="https://go.gov.sg/639-rr-covid-19-testing" style="color: rgb(149, 79, 114);"&gt;go.gov.sg/639-rr-covid-19-testing&lt;/a&gt;,&amp;nbsp;or call 1800 333 9999 if you have any queries.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;4.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All residents are to bring along their NRIC for identification purposes.&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="color: rgb(0, 112, 192);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Leaflets have been distributed and SMS notifications have been sent to the residents to provide them with more information. Residents are reminded to keep to their appointment time. Residents are also advised to monitor their health closely and consult a doctor immediately if they feel unwell. Those who are still awaiting their test results are advised to minimise social interactions as much as possible. They should continue to monitor their health and seek immediate medical attention if they feel unwell.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;15 JULY 2021&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Thu, 15 Jul 2021 13:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:63c1fe87-cd72-40c3-99ef-8179c1013638</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/updates-on-vaccination-records/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Updates on Vaccination Records</title><description>&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;1.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We have made good progress in our national COVID-19 vaccination programme thus far. As of 14 July 2021, we have administered around 6.5 million doses of COVID-19 vaccine. Around 4 million individuals have received at least the first dose of the vaccine, of whom about 2.4 million have completed the full vaccination regimen.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Updates of Vaccination Records for Singapore Citizens, Permanent Residents or Long-Term Pass Holders Vaccinated Overseas&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="margin-left: 0in; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; text-align: left;"&gt;As vaccinations grow in availability worldwide, there are also many Singapore Citizens, Permanent Residents, and Long-Term Pass Holders who have returned from overseas with vaccinations done abroad and would like their vaccination records updated in Singapore.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;From 14 July 2021, such individuals who have received COVID-19 vaccinations overseas with COVID-19 vaccines &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;authorised by the Heath Sciences Authority under the Pandemic Special Access Route (PSAR)[1] or&amp;nbsp;listed on the World Health Organization’s Emergency Use Listing (WHO EUL) can have their vaccination records updated in the National Immunisation Registry when they return to Singapore. To do so, they should have documentation to show proof of their overseas vaccination and a positive serology test result in Singapore. The positive serology test provides an additional means to validate the vaccination status of an individual by detecting that antibodies have been mounted against the virus.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;To update their vaccination records in Singapore, individuals can visit a private healthcare provider onboard this initiative[2] with&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;their overseas COVID-19 vaccination documentation. Upon positive serology test result, the individual’s vaccination records will subsequently be reflected on HealthHub after a few days. For Singapore residents who received their COVID-19 vaccination in Singapore, serology testing is not required.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Keeping our Community Safe&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;Vaccination remains a key enabler in our fight against COVID-19 and its ability to help Singapore re-open safely can only be felt when we can collectively achieve a high level of population coverage for vaccination. We encourage those who still have not done so, to register their interest via vaccine.gov.sg and book their vaccinations and get vaccinated.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="margin-left: 0in; text-align: justify;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;div style="padding: 0in 0in 1pt; border-top: none; border-right: none; border-bottom-width: 1pt; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left: none;"&gt; &lt;p style="padding: 0in; border: none;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt; &lt;strong&gt;15 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;&lt;br clear="all"&gt; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt; &lt;div id="ftn1"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;[1] PSAR approved vaccines are Pfizer-BioNTech/Comirnaty and Moderna vaccines&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn2"&gt; &lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;"&gt;[2] Details on the providers can be found at: &lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/vaccination/faqs/faqs---post-vaccination-matters"&gt;&lt;span style="color: black;"&gt;https://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/vaccination/faqs/faqs---post-vaccination-matters&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Thu, 15 Jul 2021 09:22:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:1cb966f5-4af0-47dc-8b4e-db6ade5f1a9e</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/42-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection_15July2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>42 NEW CASES OF LOCALLY TRANSMITTED  COVID-19 INFECTION </title><description>&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 15 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 42 new&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 33 belong to the KTV cluster.&amp;nbsp;Of the 42 cases today, 17 are&amp;nbsp;&lt;span class="bumpedfont15"&gt;linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 20 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 5 are currently unlinked.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;2. &amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;In addition, there are 6 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;upon arrival in Singapore&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;. 4 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3. &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;In total, there are 48 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px;"&gt;4. &amp;nbsp; We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong style="font-family: Arial;"&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial;"&gt;15 JULY 2021&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Thu, 15 Jul 2021 08:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:be37aff5-4a01-4ac4-9ade-9a6c65aeb630</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/bringing-covid-19-vaccination-to-the-heartlands-for-seniors/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Bringing COVID-19 Vaccination to the Heartlands for Seniors</title><description>&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; The government will be intensifying our outreach to encourage the rest of our seniors to be vaccinated. This is critical as seniors are the most vulnerable group and at higher risk of becoming dangerously ill if infected with COVID-19. With age and possibly underlying health conditions, their immune system is weaker. Without vaccination, they may not be able to fight off the virus.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; Currently about 7 in 10 seniors aged 70 and above have completed at least their first vaccination dose.&amp;nbsp; To enhance convenience for seniors, the Ministry of Health (MOH) will launch up to 10 mobile vaccination teams to the heartlands. These mobile vaccination teams will be deployed at locations near where many seniors live, such as at selected Community Clubs/Centres (CCs) that are not already being used as Vaccination Centres, or at the Residents’ Committee centres at residential blocks. The mobile vaccination team deployment will be done in phases, and has started with Anchorvale CC on 7 July 2021. It will be progressively deployed at Kallang, Whampoa, Changi Simei and Paya Lebar Kovan CCs in the coming weeks.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The mobile vaccination teams will be deployed at each location for a few days to a week, before moving to other locations, and returning to the original location to administer the second vaccination dose. This is to ensure that those who had receive the first dose will get their second dose at the same location.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; The deployment location and schedule of the mobile vaccination teams in are as follows:&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;table&gt;&lt;tbody&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;strong&gt;Date (for 1&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;sup&gt;st&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;dose)&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Location&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;7 July to 13 July&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;Anchorvale CC&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;14 July to 21 July&lt;/span&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;(closed on 20 July for Hari Raya Haji)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;Kallang CC&lt;br&gt;&amp;nbsp;Whampoa CC&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;22 July to 28 July&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;Changi Simei CC&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;29 July to 4 August&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;Paya Lebar Kovan CC&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: 16px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;5. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;MOH will also call on our primary care providers, including private general practitioners and polyclinics, to help in this national effort. First, we will expand the number of Public Health Preparedness Clinics (PHPCs) providing COVID-19 vaccination as part of the national vaccination programme, starting with Bedok, Bukit Merah, Hougang and Tampines in the coming weeks. All primary care providers have also been called on to help persuade seniors who are their regular patients, to go for their COVID-19 vaccination if they have not done so yet.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Staff and volunteers from the PA and AIC’s outreach arm, Silver Generation Office (SGO) will also intensify their ground outreach efforts. They will reach out to the unvaccinated seniors through house visits and engagement dialogues to address any queries or concerns they might have. They will also provide advice on the nearest vaccination locations and assist those who require help in getting to the vaccination centres, or arrange for them to be vaccinated at home if they are homebound.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;We strongly urge seniors to be vaccinated by these mobile vaccination teams as they are deployed to a location near to them, to protect themselves, their senior friends and their loved ones. Seniors aged 60 years old and above may also walk into any of the existing Vaccination Centres with their Identity Card to receive their first dose of vaccination, without any prior appointment needed, or visit their doctors at any of the participating PHPCs or polyclinics. Homebound persons can also directly request to receive their vaccination at home, by calling the SGO hotline at 1800-650-6060. To target this service to seniors who really need it, this service will be strictly reserved for those who are homebound.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;8. &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Vaccination remains a key enabler in our fight against COVID-19. Together, we can help Singapore to re-open safely if we each contribute to achieve a high level of population vaccination coverage. We encourage all who have yet to be vaccinated, to register your interest via&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="http://vaccine.gov.sg/" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=http://vaccine.gov.sg&amp;amp;source=gmail&amp;amp;ust=1626419897222000&amp;amp;usg=AFQjCNHIqjAWCNrnUXSjEZQcugVLO2aDBw"&gt;vaccine.gov.sg&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;and book your appointment to get vaccinated. &amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;15 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;</description><pubDate>Thu, 15 Jul 2021 07:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:9c72dae8-0078-4d00-9efa-00ba925417cd</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/concord-international-hospital-to-resume-provision-of-healthcare-services/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>CONCORD INTERNATIONAL HOSPITAL TO RESUME PROVISION OF HEALTHCARE SERVICES</title><description>The Ministry of Health (MOH) has approved the resumption of healthcare services by Concord International Hospital (19 Adam Road) as a licensed acute hospital under the Private Hospitals and Medical Clinics (PHMC) Act.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2. Concord International Hospital was ordered to temporarily stop the provision of all healthcare services from 19 December 2020, following the detection of significant regulatory lapses. These included multiple life-saving/ patient use equipment and medications that were either not maintained or not available in the critical areas of the hospital such as the Intensive Care Unit and the Operating Theatre. There was also a lack of infection control processes generally in the hospital and quality control processes in the laboratory, which posed significant risks to patient safety and well-being.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3. Since 19 December 2020, MOH has worked closely with the hospital to review the lapses and processes. The hospital has since taken steps to address the lapses.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4. Subsequent inspections conducted by MOH showed that the hospital has met the licensing requirements under the PHMC Act. This includes having the necessary equipment and facilities (including critical emergency equipment and facilities) at all clinical areas, quality control checks for clinical laboratory facilities, preventive maintenance performed for all equipment and proper infection prevention and control practices in place. The hospital was also assessed to have put in place appropriate follow-up actions to ensure safe and proper provision of care to patients prior to resumption of operations.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;5. As Concord International Hospital has fully addressed the regulatory lapses and met the licensing requirements, it has received approval to resume the provision of healthcare services, with effect from 16 June 2021. The licence for the hospital is for a period of two years. The hospital has informed MOH that it is planning for re-opening at the same premises under a new name.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6. Patient safety is of utmost priority. All private and public sector healthcare facilities, including hospitals, clinics, nursing homes and clinical laboratories currently licensed under the PHMC Act, are reminded to fully comply with the Act at all times, and ensure that safety and quality of clinical care are met at all times.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7. All licensed premises are subject to regular and adhoc inspections and audits to ensure compliance to the Act. MOH will not hesitate to take enforcement action against healthcare facilities that fail to comply with the relevant regulatory requirements, which may include a fine of up to $20,000 and/or a revocation of the licence.</description><pubDate>Wed, 14 Jul 2021 16:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:f8436dd7-70f4-4e2d-b4f5-e5bc849d4484</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(14-july)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>UPDATE ON LOCAL COVID-19 SITUATION (14 JULY)</title><description>&lt;p style="text-align: justify;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 14 July 2021, 12pm, Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 56 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 42 belong to the KTV cluster.&amp;nbsp;Of the 56 cases today, 17 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 34 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 5 are currently unlinked. [1] There are 4 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 3 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 1 developed the illness during SHN or isolation. In total, there are 60 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Community Unlinked Cases, and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance, and Dormitory Resident Cases [2]&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig1(14july21)96b9d72958d24d29a8730f088818aa96.png?sfvrsn=c16b9a96_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig1(14july21)96b9d72958d24d29a8730f088818aa96.png?sfvrsn=c16b9a96_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig1(14July21)" title="Fig1(14July21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases &lt;/strong&gt; &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Overall, the number of new cases in the community has increased from 24 cases in the week before to 88 cases in the past week. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also increased from 7 cases in the week before to 15 cases in&amp;nbsp;the past week.&amp;nbsp;The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 10.4 and 2.1 respectively.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Figure 2: &lt;/strong&gt;7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases[3]&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig2(14july21)e2591957de894603bb9547d85950ca43.png?sfvrsn=7bd05f17_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig2(14july21)e2591957de894603bb9547d85950ca43.png?sfvrsn=7bd05f17_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig2(14July21)" title="Fig2(14July21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases &lt;/strong&gt; &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There are a total of 4 imported cases today. 3 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 1 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.   &lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;Figure 3:&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/  Detected During SHN or Isolation &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig3(14july).png?sfvrsn=fbbd65c1_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig3(14july).png?sfvrsn=fbbd65c1_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig3(14July)" title="Fig3(14July)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Active clusters under monitoring &lt;/strong&gt; &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There are 3 new clusters (Case 64642, Case 64735 and Case 64752 clusters) today. In total, there are currently 25 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 94 infections.  &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 4:&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Clusters&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig4(14july).png?sfvrsn=911873a7_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig4(14july).png?sfvrsn=911873a7_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig4(14July)" title="Fig4(14July)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 5:&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64359&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;ION Orchard&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;5&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64184&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;14&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64374&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;90 Redhill Close&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64233&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;121 Bukit Merah View&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;5&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64263&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br clear="all"&gt; &lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt; &lt;div id="ftn1"&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="file:///C:/Users/ISS-USER/Desktop/Press%20Release-Confirmed%20cases%2064752%20to%2064813-Draft%2014Jul%202245h%20(Final).docx#_ftnref1" name="_ftn1"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;div id="ftn1"&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Community surveillance testing and closure of affected premises &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection amongst social hostesses who had frequented KTV lounges or clubs currently operating as F&amp;amp;B outlets, and their close social contacts. Our epidemiological investigations have found that there is likely ongoing transmission at the following premises: &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;i) One Exclusive (114 Middle Road);&lt;br&gt;ii) Level 9 (L9) (114 Middle Road);&lt;br&gt;iii) Terminal 10 (Clarke Quay); and&lt;br&gt;iv) Club M (114 Middle Road).&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;To break any potential chain of transmission and enable deep cleaning, these premises have been closed to all members of the public from 15 July 2021 to 29 July 2021.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We will also extend free COVID-19 testing to members of the public who had:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;i) Visited the following premises between 29 June and 14 July 2021:&lt;br&gt;- One Exclusive (114 Middle Road), Level 9 (L9) (114 Middle Road), Terminal 10 (Clarke Quay) or Club M (114 Middle Road); or &lt;br&gt;- Similar KTV lounges or clubs operating as F&amp;amp;B outlets. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;ii) Interacted with social hostesses of any nationality in any setting between 29 June and 14 July 2021.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Please refer to &lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/rsc/ongoing-community-surveillance-testing-for-visitors-to-ktv-lounges-or-clubs-operating-as-f-b-outlets-that-are-frequented-by-vietnamese-social-hostesses"&gt;https://go.gov.sg/ktv-testing&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for details on the testing operations.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;8.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;All visitors to these premises and similar settings and those who had interacted with social hostesses of any nationality are advised to monitor their health closely, and minimise social interactions as far as possible, for 14 days from their date of visit or interaction. They are encouraged to see a doctor immediately if they feel unwell.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;125 cases are currently warded in hospital. Most are well and under observation. There are currently 8 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 1 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig6(14july).png?sfvrsn=a95cc2be_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig6(14july).png?sfvrsn=a95cc2be_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig6(14July)" title="Fig6(14July)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Age Group&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig7(14july).png?sfvrsn=bc4f0249_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig7(14july).png?sfvrsn=bc4f0249_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig7(14July)" title="Fig7(14July)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;10.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 18 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 14 are unvaccinated, 4 are partially vaccinated and none was fully vaccinated.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status and Severity of Condition[5]&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig8(14july21).png?sfvrsn=67e2f794_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig8(14july21).png?sfvrsn=67e2f794_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig8(14July21)" title="Fig8(14July21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Vaccination Status[4]&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig9(14july).png?sfvrsn=d85bed22_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig9(14july).png?sfvrsn=d85bed22_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig9(14July)" title="Fig9(14July)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;11.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 13 July 2021, we have administered a total of 6,440,735 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme. The total number of doses administered was 6,440,735, covering 4,052,434 individuals. 2,420,824 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 32,523 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 2,388,301 who received their second dose.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 10: &lt;/strong&gt;Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig10(14july).png?sfvrsn=29ed141d_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig10(14july).png?sfvrsn=29ed141d_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig10(14July)" title="Fig10(14July)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose by Age Group[6]&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig11(14july21).png?sfvrsn=223376d7_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig11(14july21).png?sfvrsn=223376d7_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig11(14July21)" title="Fig11(14July21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Figure 12: &lt;/strong&gt;Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen[7] of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group &lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig12(14july21).png?sfvrsn=279f3d2e_0"&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/covid-19-chart-(pr)/fig12(14july21).png?sfvrsn=279f3d2e_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Fig12(14July21)" title="Fig12(14July21)" data-openoriginalimageonclick="true"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;12.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Please refer to MOH’s daily Situation Report (&lt;a href="http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br clear="all"&gt; &lt;div id="ftn1"&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;14 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;br clear="all"&gt;&lt;/b&gt; &lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt; &lt;div id="ftn1"&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;div&gt;   [1] This is updated from the afternoon press release as 1 more case has been linked to the KTV cluster following epidemiological investigations.&lt;br&gt;   &lt;div id="ftn2"&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;[2] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[3] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[4] Includes new cases added today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[5] Fully vaccinated - more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen (both doses of the vaccine or one dose for recovered individuals). Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[6]&amp;nbsp;Based on National Immunisation Registry data. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[7] Full regimen refers to individuals who have received both doses of the vaccine or one dose for vaccinated recovered individuals.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</description><pubDate>Wed, 14 Jul 2021 15:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:337c99f0-8681-4ef9-8a6f-28142c3f0f82</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/56-new-cases-of-locally-transmitted-covid-19-infection(14july)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>56 NEW CASES OF LOCALLY TRANSMITTED  COVID-19 INFECTION</title><description>&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 14 July 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 56 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 41 belong to the KTV cluster.&amp;nbsp;Of the 56 cases today, 17 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 33 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 6 are currently unlinked.  &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In addition, there are 4 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. All 4 were detected upon arrival in Singapore.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;In total, there are 60 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.</description><pubDate>Wed, 14 Jul 2021 09:03:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:f99974ea-1498-49b5-82ad-22b51e0f4db1</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/president-s-award-for-nurses-2021/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>PRESIDENT’S AWARD FOR NURSES 2021</title><description>&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Seven nurses were conferred the President’s Award for Nurses this year. They received their award from President Halimah Yacob at a virtual award ceremony this afternoon. This brings the total number of recipients since the inception of the award in 2000 to 84.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;The highest accolade in Singapore’s nursing profession, the President’s Award for Nurses recognises nurses who have shown sustained outstanding performance and contributions to patient care delivery, education, research and administration.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;This year’s award recipients include five from acute hospitals and one from primary care setting, as well as a nursing educator. Of the seven recipients, two are Advanced Practice Nurses.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;The seven recipients are:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;ul&gt;&lt;li&gt;Dr Huang Fang&lt;br&gt;Assistant Director of Nursing, Advanced Practice Nurse, KK Women’s and Children’s Hospital&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Ms Margaret Lee Kwee Hiang&lt;br&gt;Chief Nurse, Alexandra Hospital&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Ms Katherine Leong Shiao Pheng&lt;br&gt;Assistant Director of Nursing, Nursing Administration, Advanced Practice Nurse, Khoo Teck Puat – National University Children’s Medical Institute&lt;br&gt;National University Hospital&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Ms Christina Lim Poh Ying&lt;br&gt;Chief Nurse, Sengkang General Hospital&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Ms Lim Voon Hooi&lt;br&gt;Chief Nurse, National Healthcare Group Polyclinics&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Dr Shefaly Shorey&lt;br&gt;Assistant Professor, Alice Lee Centre for Nursing Studies (NUS Nursing), Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine, National University of Singapore&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Mr Christopher Soh Kok Keng&lt;br&gt;Assistant Director of Nursing, Emergency Medicine Department and Emergency Department, Tan Tock Seng Hospital &lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;5.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Each awardee received a trophy, a certificate signed by President Halimah Yacob and a $10,000 cash prize that can be used for their professional and personal development. More information on the award recipients is in the &lt;a href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/docs/librariesprovider5/default-document-library/pan2021_annex.pdf?sfvrsn=263175d6_0" title="Annex"&gt;Annex&lt;/a&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;The national award is open to all registered nurses from healthcare institutions in the public, private, and community care sectors, as well as the educational institutions. Nurses are nominated by their institutions, public or peers, and interviewed by a panel chaired by Dr Tan Wu Meng, Chairman of Health Government Parliamentary Committee.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;The virtual award ceremony today was held in recognition of both 2021 and 2020 award recipients’ contributions to Singapore’s healthcare. Due to COVID-19 pandemic, the physical reception for President’s Award for Nurses had been cancelled last year.&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;14 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description><pubDate>Wed, 14 Jul 2021 08:48:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:e5da8f9a-43cb-44ba-8c2f-bd762e70eda2</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/updates-on-border-measures-for-travellers-from-myanmar/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>UPDATES ON BORDER MEASURES FOR TRAVELLERS FROM MYANMAR</title><description>The Multi-Ministry Taskforce has been closely monitoring the global COVID-19 situation and regularly reviews Singapore’s border measures to manage the risk of importation from travellers and onward local transmission, taking into account the current situation in their source countries/ regions.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Restricting Travel from Myanmar&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;2. Given the worsening situation, we will tighten our border measures for travellers from Myanmar. From &lt;strong&gt;15 July 2021, 2359 hours&lt;/strong&gt;, until further notice, a&lt;strong&gt;ll long-term pass holders and short-term visitors with recent travel history (including transit) to Myanmar within the last 21 days will &lt;span style="text-decoration: underline;"&gt;not&lt;/span&gt; be allowed entry into Singapore, or transit through Singapore&lt;/strong&gt;. This will also apply to all those who had obtained prior approval for entry into Singapore. With effect from 15 July 2021, 2359 hours, all travellers with recent travel history to Myanmar will also be subject to an on-arrival Antigen Rapid Test (ART)&lt;sup&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;3. All travellers with recent travel history to Myanmar who have yet to complete their 14-day Stay-Home Notice (SHN) by &lt;strong&gt;15 July 2021, 2359hrs&lt;/strong&gt; will continue to be subjected to:&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;a. 14-day SHN at dedicated SHN facilities; and&lt;br&gt;b. On-arrival polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;, self-administered ART test on Day 3, 7 and 11 of arrival, and PCR test on Day 14 of arrival.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Regular Review of Border Measures&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;4. As the global situation evolves, we will continue to adjust our border measures to manage the risk of importation and transmission to the community with changes updated on the &lt;a href="http://safetravel.ica.gov.sg/"&gt;SafeTravel&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;website. The Ministry of Health will also continue to review the data and evidence on any new viral strains and update the measures accordingly.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[1] For details on the on-arrival ART at Changi Airport, please refer to&amp;nbsp; &lt;a href="https://safetravel.ica.gov.sg/health/covid19-tests/pcrtest"&gt;https://safetravel.ica.gov.sg/health/covid19-tests/pcrtest&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;[2] To expedite the COVID-19 PCR test at the checkpoints, travellers are strongly encouraged to register and pre-pay for their on-arrival COVID-19 PCR test prior to departing for Singapore at https://safetravel.changiairport.com/ (for Changi Airport) and &lt;a href="https://t.2c2p.com/express/parkwayshenton"&gt;https://t.2c2p.com/express/parkwayshenton&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;(for Tanah Merah Ferry Terminal).</description><pubDate>Wed, 14 Jul 2021 04:00:00 Z</pubDate><a10:content type="text"></a10:content></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">urn:uuid:8e19f892-994c-4019-8297-2177d5de3823</guid><link>https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-covid-19-situation-(13-julyfullpr)/</link><a10:author><a10:name> </a10:name></a10:author><title>Update On Local COVID-19 Situation (13 July)</title><description>&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; As of 13 July 2021, 12pm, Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed and verified that there are 19 cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection, of which 8 belong to the emerging KTV cluster.&amp;nbsp;Of the 19 cases today, 5 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 10 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 4 are currently unlinked. There are 7 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 5 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation. In total, there are 26 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 1:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Community Unlinked Cases, and Linked Cases by Already Quarantined/ Detected through Surveillance, and Dormitory Resident Cases [1]&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-1ace38a6aba694f29b5d9159587a952ac.png?sfvrsn=38ac5ef_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 1" title="Figure 1"&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for local cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;2.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;Overall, the number of new cases in the community has increased from 24 cases in the week before to 37 cases in the past week. The number of unlinked cases in the community has also increased from 5 cases in the week before to 12 cases in the past week.&amp;nbsp;The 7-day moving average number of all linked community cases and all unlinked community cases are 3.6 and 1.7 respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 2:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; 7 Day Moving Average Number of Community Unlinked and Linked Cases [2]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-262acf42294a647fcaeb9d2774cecca12.png?sfvrsn=240ab3cc_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 2" title="Figure 2"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Summary of trends for imported cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;3.&amp;nbsp;&lt;b&gt; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;There are a total of 7 imported cases today. 5 were detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 3:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Imported Cases by Detected Upon Arrival/ Detected During SHN or Isolation&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-3987224ede8d149c08dfb06ee4e362374.png?sfvrsn=76a36d59_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 3" title="Figure 3"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Active clusters under monitoring&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;4.&amp;nbsp; &lt;b&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;There are currently 22 active clusters, ranging between 3 and 94 infections.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 4:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; List of Active Clusters&lt;/p&gt;&lt;table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"&gt; &lt;thead&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Cluster&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;New Cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Total [3]&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/thead&gt; &lt;tbody&gt;&lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;KTV lounges/clubs&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;8&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;12&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64697 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;7&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;11&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64599 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;105 Henderson Crescent&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;21&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Changi General Hospital&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;20&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;115 Bukit Merah View Market &amp;amp; Food Centre&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;94&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64478&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64394&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64444&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64264&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;10&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;119 Bukit Merah View&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;8&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64359&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;6&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64135&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;ION Orchard&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;5&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64184&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;14&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64374&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;90 Redhill Close&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64233&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;3&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;121 Bukit Merah View&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;5&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr&gt; &lt;td width="372"&gt; &lt;p&gt;Case 64263&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width="115" valign="top"&gt; &lt;p align="center"&gt;4&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Community surveillance testing and closure of affected premises&amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;5.&lt;strong&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;MOH is investigating cases of COVID-19 infection amongst Vietnamese social hostesses who had frequented KTV lounges or clubs currently operating as F&amp;amp;B outlets, and their close social contacts. Our epidemiological investigations have found that there is likely ongoing transmission at the following premises:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;ul&gt;&lt;li&gt;Club Dolce Pte Ltd (Balestier Point);&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;WU Bistro Pte Ltd (Golden Mile Complex); and&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Club De Zara Pte Ltd (Textile Centre).&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;6.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;To break any potential chain of transmission and enable deep cleaning, these premises have been closed to all members of the public starting from 13 July 2021 to 27 July 2021.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;To quickly uncover any community infection cases, we will be conducting special testing operations for all staff of WU Bistro Pte Ltd (Golden Mile Complex) andClub De Zara Pte Ltd (Textile Centre).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;8.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; We will also extend free COVID-19 testing to members of the public who had:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;i) Visited the following premises between 29 June and 13 July 2021:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;ul&gt;&lt;li&gt;WU Bistro Pte Ltd (Golden Mile Complex) or Club De Zara Pte Ltd (Textile Centre); or &lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Similar KTV lounges or clubs operating as F&amp;amp;B outlets. &lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;p&gt;ii) Interacted with Vietnamese social hostesses in any setting between 29 June and 13 July 2021.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;This is in addition to the testing operations announced yesterday for staff and visitors of Supreme KTV (Far East Shopping Centre), Empress KTV (Tanglin Shopping Centre) and Club Dolce (Balestier Point). Please refer to&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="https://go.gov.sg/ktv-testing"&gt;https://go.gov.sg/ktv-testing&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for details on the testing operations.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;9.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;All visitors to these premises and similar settings and those who had interacted with Vietnamese social hostesses are advised to monitor their health closely, and minimise social interactions as far as possible, for 14 days from their date of visit or interaction. They are encouraged to see a doctor immediately if they feel unwell.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Condition of confirmed cases&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;10.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; 94 cases are currently warded in hospital.Most are well and under observation. There are currently 7 cases of serious illness requiring oxygen supplementation, and 2 in critical condition in the intensive care unit (ICU).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 6:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Number of Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-68acd392e172f4071b5fd8171296245cb.png?sfvrsn=1ce27994_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 6" title="Figure 6"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 7:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Age Group&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-78b42f4073ba246f38f3d51a7cf5d3447.png?sfvrsn=e1e0b2b3_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 7" title="Figure 7"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;11.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; There is continuing evidence that vaccination helps to prevent serious disease when one gets infected. Over the last 28 days, 22 local cases required oxygen supplementation, were admitted to ICU or passed away. 18 are unvaccinated, 4 are partially vaccinated and none was fully vaccinated.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 8:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Local Cases in the Last 28 Days by Vaccination Status and Severity of Condition [4]&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-8fc31fa503f4e42acacfe15fe63c2e53d.png?sfvrsn=d67fb8c1_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 8" title="Figure 8"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 9:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Deaths and Active Cases in ICU or Requiring Oxygen Supplementation, by Vaccination Status4&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Progress of national vaccination programme&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;12.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;As of 12 July 2021, we have administered a total of 6,378,063 doses of COVID-19 vaccines under the national vaccination programme. The total number of doses administered was 6,378,063, covering 4,022,809 individuals. 2,367,424 individuals have completed the full vaccination regimen, consisting of 12,170 recovered persons who received at least one dose and 2,355,254 who received their second dose.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 10:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Progress of National Vaccination Programme&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-1077eca32249a94156bf8f012e883808fd.png?sfvrsn=3f45e289_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 10" title="Figure 10"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 11:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Vaccinated Individuals who Received At Least First Dose by Age Group [5]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-114c75abb0ad754c35af71d8349dda994d.png?sfvrsn=3900e7c8_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 11" title="Figure 11"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;Figure 12:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; Percentage of Individuals who Completed Full Regimen [6]&amp;nbsp;of COVID-19 Vaccine by Age Group&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src="https://www.moh.gov.sg/images/librariesprovider5/default-album/figure-12ba93fbd5c8dc455d80df96b4797bfa45.png?sfvrsn=e44fbecd_0" data-displaymode="Original" alt="Figure 12" title="Figure 12"&gt;13.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; Please refer to MOH’s daily Situation Report (&lt;a href="http://www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report"&gt;www.moh.gov.sg/covid-19/situation-report&lt;/a&gt;) for details.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;div&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;MINISTRY OF HEALTH&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;13 JULY 2021&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div&gt; &lt;hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"&gt; &lt;div id="ftn1"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[1] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn2"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[2] Incorporates re-classifications of earlier reported cases.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn3"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[3] Includes new cases added today. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn4"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[4] Fully vaccinated – more than 14 days after completing vaccination regimen.&amp;nbsp; Partially vaccinated – received 1 dose only of 2-dose vaccine or COVID-19 positive within 14 days of completing vaccination regimen.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id="ftn5"&gt; &lt;p&gt;[5] Based on National Immunisation Registry data. &lt;/p&gt;
